Title: Python Developer
Description:
Mid-Level Python Developer – Python (Fast-API), Docker/Azure – Rotterdam [OTE 65k]




Are you looking for a challenging SaaS-based company that is fully focused on providing the full suite for fintech and investments? An environment that has code quality as their core priority working with SOLID, DDD, TDD, BDD, CQRS and having an perspective on coding languages?




You are a software enthusiast, have interest in the complexity of financial software and have experience with building microsrvices-based apps using the DDD-approach within an automated (TDD) & cloud-based IT landscape. You feel at ease with the full SDLC from design to deployment. You love the complexity of back-end problems and are excited to pick things up on the frontend as well (React/TypeScript).




Your profile:

· Minimum of 2+ years of experience with Python (FastAPI, Flask, Django, e.g.)

· Experience with DDD, BDD, SOA, CQRS, Microservices

· Experience or interest in picking up frontend (TypeScript/React)

· Experience with cloud technologies




Benefits:

· Salary 55k annually

· Holiday allowance

· Bonus

· Profit sharing

· 13th month

· Pension

· Travel allowance

· Health insurance benefits

· 30 holidays




Interested? Please contact me at josse@doghouse-recruitment.nl

Title: Stanowisko ds. zarządzania obszarem BI i HD-specjalność inżynierii systemów Hurtowni Danych
Description:
Nazwa jednostki organizacyjnej


ZUS Oddział we Wrocławiu


Nazwa komórki organizacyjnej


Departament Statystyki i Prognoz Aktuarialnych


Miejsce pracy


ZUS Oddział we Wrocławiu


Adres miejsca pracy


ul. Pretficza 11, 50-930 Wrocław


Województwo


dolnośląskie


Nazwa stanowiska


Stanowisko ds. zarządzania obszarem BI i HD-specjalność inżynierii systemów Hurtowni Danych


Zadania


Zadania


zapewniać utrzymanie i rozwój architektury biznesowej i technicznej obszaru Hurtowni Danych
odpowiadać za proponowanie, budowanie i wdrażanie rozwiązań z zakresu technologii przetwarzania dużych zbiorów danych (Big Data), m.in. modelowania danych, projektowanie modelów ekstrakcji danych, projektowania i utrzymanie systemów magazynowania danych
odpowiadać za analizowanie wydajności sprzętu i oprogramowania w obszarze Hurtowni Danych
uczestniczyć w planowaniu inicjatyw i projektów mających na celu rozbudowę i optymalizację wykorzystywanych rozwiązań w obszarze Hurtowni Danych
współpracować przy projektowanie procesów ETL (Extract, Transform, Load), ELT (Extract, Load, Transform) w celu pozyskiwania, przetwarzania i ładowania danych z różnych źródeł do systemów klasy Hurtowni Danych
uczestniczyć w pracach projektowych, wdrożeniowych i testowych w obszarze Hurtowni Danych
wspierać użytkowników w ramach wdrożeń systemów i narzędzi w obszarze Hurtowni Danych
uczestniczyć w przygotowaniu planu rozwoju (roadmapy) dla środowiska Business Intelligence i Hurtowni Danych
proponować usprawnienia dla realizowanych procesów i zmiany w dokumentacji
Wymagania


Wymagania Niezbędne


wykształcenie wyższe
doświadczenie zawodowe minimum 1 rok (w pracy związanej z planowaniem, tworzeniem i rozwojem w obszarach Business Intelligence i\lub Hurtowni Danych)
staż pracy ogółem minimum 2 lata


Mile Widziane


wykształcenie wyższe (matematyka, informatyka, statystyka)
doświadczenie zawodowe minimum 2 lata (w pracy związanej z planowaniem, tworzeniem i rozwojem w obszarach Business Intelligence i\lub Hurtowni Danych)


Wymagania Dodatkowe


umiejętność obsługi programów MS Office
Znajomość języka SQL
orientacja na cel
orientacja na jakość
komunikacja
współpraca
elastyczność
nastawienie na rozwój
negocjowanie i wywieranie wpływu
podejmowanie decyzji
umiejętność rozwiązywania problemów
innowacyjność


Wymagane Dokumenty


CV
listu motywacyjnego
skan dokumentów potwierdzających wykształcenie
skan dokumentów potwierdzających wymagane doświadczenie zawodowe
skan świadectw pracy dokumentujących wymagany staż pracy lub zaświadczenie o zatrudnieniu zawierające okresy zatrudnienia, w przypadku pozostania w stosunku pracy


Dokumenty należy przesyłać poprzez formularz aplikacyjny 'Aplikuj', znajdujący się na dole oferty

Dodatkowe Informacje


proces rekrutacji obejmować będzie rozmowę kwalifikacyjną (przeprowadzoną w formie zdalnej przez komunikator internetowy - wywiad on-line) lub stacjonarnie
skontaktujemy się tylko z kandydatami spełniającymi wymagania formalne
oferty niekompletne tj. niezawierające skanu, któregokolwiek wymaganego dokumentu nie będą rozpatrywane
oferty przesłane po terminie nie będą rozpatrywane
miejscem świadczenia pracy będzie Centrala ZUS lub dowolny Oddział ZUS
możliwość pracy w trybie stacjonarnym, zdalnym lub hybrydowym
Termin, do którego należy składać dokumenty


12-02-2025


Oferujemy


Oferujemy


stabilne zatrudnienie na podstawie umowy o pracę
możliwość rozwoju zawodowego
bogaty pakiet świadczeń socjalnych
system premiowy


Zakład Ubezpieczeń Społecznych jest pracodawcą przyjaznym osobom z niepełnosprawnościami. Stwarza pracownikom optymalne środowisko pracy, uwzględniając ich potrzeby. Istnieje możliwość dostosowania stanowiska pracy i jego wyposażenia do indywidualnych potrzeb osób z niepełnosprawnościami

Wyposażenie Stanowiska Pracy


sprzęt komputerowy,
sprzęt biurowy.


Warunki Wykonywania Pracy


spełniają warunki określone wymogami bhp i ppoż.,
polegają na obsłudze komputera powyżej 4 godzin na dobę,
konieczność poruszania się po całym obiekcie,
konieczność wykonywania pracy poza biurem,
konieczność odbywania podróży służbowych,
budynek 3-piętrowy z windą oraz pomieszczeniami sanitarnymi dostosowanymi do potrzeb osób niepełnosprawnych,
stanowisko pracy zlokalizowane w pomieszczeniach biurowych na 3- piętrze,
miejsce pracy dostosowane do osób poruszających się przy pomocy wózka inwalidzkiego,
wejście do budynku jest zorganizowane z poziomu chodnika,
drzwi przy wejściu do budynku otwierają się automatycznie,
w bezpośrednim sąsiedztwie wejścia do budynku znajdują się miejsca parkingowe dla osób z niepełnosprawnościami

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Python Developer




Are you ready to be our client's next backend coding guru? We're looking for a superhero in human form (cape optional) who can whip up mind-blowing Python spells, turn coffee into code, and debug faster than you can say "Cheese!" You’ll be cooking up state-of-the-art software solutions that are so efficient, that even our competitors can’t help but send us fan mail.




What You'll Do




Craft and cast impeccable code spells that even Merlin would envy.
Develop and nurture software, databases, and the next big features in tech cheese.
Collaborate across realms (okay, departments) to ensure our projects hit the bullseye.
Support the launch of new products that might just change the face of cybersecurity.
Review the magical work of your peers, enhancing the elixir of our craft.

 

 Must-Haves

A spell book (Bachelor’s degree) in Computer Science or a closely related potion field.
At least 3 years of potion mixing (err, coding) with Python in your cauldron.
Familiarity with exotic spells like Mongo and GraphQL.
A knack for constructing digital fortresses (software architecture).
Bonus points if you’ve previously conjured security software!

Title: AI/ML
Description:
Our client is seeking an experienced AI/ML Engineer with a strong background in Generative AI to join their team in Amsterdam.




The ideal candidate will have expertise in designing, developing, and deploying cutting-edge generative models and solutions. Proficiency in Dutch is highly desirable.




Key Responsibilities:

Design and Development: Design, develop, and deploy advanced AI/ML models with a focus on Generative AI solutions.
Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to build AI systems that deliver high-quality, scalable, and impactful solutions.
Research and Innovation: Conduct research and stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI/ML and Generative AI technologies.
Documentation and Knowledge Sharing: Develop and maintain documentation for AI/ML models, processes, and tools.
Team Leadership: Provide mentorship and technical guidance to junior engineers and contribute to the team's growth.
Testing and Optimization: Conduct thorough tests and experiments on machine learning models to ensure their reliability and effectiveness.
Code and Design Reviews: Participate in code and design reviews to maintain high standards of software quality.
Ethical AI Practices: Ensure compliance with best practices in data privacy and security.




Requirements:

Education: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Experience: Minimum of 5 years of experience in machine learning, with at least 1-2 years of hands-on experience in Generative AI.
Technical Skills:
Expertise in natural language processing (NLP), neural networks, and deep learning technologies.
Experience with large language models (LLMs) and their applications.
Proficiency with deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch.
Strong programming skills in Python and familiarity with other languages such as C++ or Java.
Experience with cloud computing platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and container orchestration tools (Docker, Kubernetes).
Language Skills: Strong English communication skills; proficiency in Dutch is highly desirable.
Soft Skills: Excellent problem-solving skills, ability to work independently and collaboratively, and strong communication skills to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

If you are passionate about AI and Generative AI, and you have a strong technical background with excellent communication skills, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We’re building a world-class team to redefine knowledge work with AI

Zeno is a legal AI startup working to change how legal professionals do their work. By combining leading AI technology with deep insights into the legal profession, we automate complex workflows and increase productivity. In just one year, we’ve evolved from a single Proof of Concept to a platform with multiple tools actively used by hundreds of legal professionals.




We’re in the early stages of building something impressive. With our seed funding secured and early market traction validated, we’re growing a team of engineers and thinkers who want to solve real problems and drive innovation and create lasting change in the legal sector.




The Role

As a Data Scientist at Zeno, your mission is to turn raw data into powerful insights that revolutionize how legal professionals search, analyze, and interact with legal information. You’ll work at the intersection of AI, search technology, and data science—uncovering hidden patterns, refining algorithms, and enhancing our search capabilities to deliver the most relevant and precise results.




This is a unique opportunity to work on deeply challenging problems, shape a high-impact product, and push the boundaries of what AI can achieve in the legal field.




What You’ll Work On

Improve retrieval accuracy, ranking, and relevance using AI-driven approaches.
Identify patterns, extract insights, and refine datasets to improve our platform’s intelligence.
Build and test models that enhance search, document classification, and legal data analysis.
Ensure our datasets are clean, structured, and optimized for AI processing.
Work closely with software engineers, data architects, and domain experts to implement solutions that directly impact our users.
Explore new methodologies, tools, and technologies to keep Zeno at the forefront of AI-driven legal tech.




What We’re Looking For

You love working with data, uncovering insights, and optimizing algorithms to drive meaningful results.
You are skilled in Python and have experience working with AI frameworks, search technologies, graph data science, or NLP.
You take ownership, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and aren’t afraid to experiment.
You enjoy working with like-minded engineers, bouncing ideas, and building next-generation AI systems together.




What we offer

A unique opportunity to work at a startup that is shaping the future of legal tech.
The ability to make a direct and tangible impact on the development and growth of our platform.
An inspiring place to work in an office located at the heart of Rotterdam.
Collaboration with a top-tier team of engineers, researchers, and entrepreneurs.
Competitive compensation, including growth and equity opportunities within the company.




Let’s shape the future of legal work together

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Company Overview:

In FRISS, we enable insurers worldwide to automatically detect potential insurance fraud. Our ultimate dream is that the FRISS Score is the global trusted standard for honest insurance. Are you ready for an adventure? We are on the hunt for a Machine Learning Engineer!







Position Overview:

This role offers the flexibility to work from our vibrant office in Utrecht, Netherlands, or remotely from home. As part of our collaborative team, you will have the opportunity to share knowledge and work alongside other AI practitioners.







Key Responsibilities:

Implement scalable and efficient Machine Learning (ML) models.
Contribute to our in-house code libraries following good software development principles and practices.
Deploy our ML models in the cloud and monitor their performance.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate ML solutions into products.







Requirements:

Great understanding of and experience in building ML (and deep learning) models.
Excellent programming skills in Python; knowledge in SQL and Py/Spark is a plus.
Hands-on experience with MLOps; CI/CD pipelines, model deployment and monitoring.
Prior work using ML frameworks such as PyTorch (or Keras), Scikit-learn, pandas.
Excellent problem-solving skills and a proactive attitude.
Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
Excellent communication skills in English.







Preferred Qualifications:

Knowledge in Large Language Models (LLMs), efficient ML (quantization, distillation etc.) and transfer learning and fine-tuning.
Experience with Azure Services including Azure Datalake/Datahouse and Azure Databricks.
Experience with Rest API.
Familiarity with containerized (Docker) applications and Kubernetes.







What We Offer:

A stimulating and innovative work environment.
Flexible working options: 50/50 work from our Utrecht office or home.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
A collaborative team culture where knowledge sharing is encouraged.







Apply Now:

If you are ready to play a crucial role at FRISS, we want to hear from you! Apply now via recruitment@friss.com to become our ML Engineer at FRISS and make a meaningful impact on our success.




Please note; We are only accepting applications from candidates based in the Netherlands.







About FRISS:

FRISS is a leading provider in fraud detection and risk mitigation solutions for the insurance industry. Founded in 2006, FRISS holds its head office in Utrecht, The Netherlands, with a global presence and global workforce, including Europe, the United States, Canada, Australia, and New Zealand. Our ultimate dream is that the FRISS Score is the global trusted standard for honest insurance.

To learn more about FRISS, have a look at www.friss.com.

FRISS is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We encourage you to be yourself. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, religious affiliation, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, nationality, or veteran status.

Position Overview:

This role offers the flexibility to work from our vibrant office in Utrecht, Netherlands, or remotely from home. As part of our collaborative team, you will have the opportunity to share knowledge and work alongside other AI practitioners.



Key Responsibilities:

  • Implement scalable and efficient Machine Learning (ML) models.
  • Contribute to our in-house code libraries following good software development principles and practices.

Title: Applied Scientist - Pipeline Data Science
Description:
Company Description

Syngenta is one of the world’s leading companies with more than 27.000 employees in over 90 countries dedicated to our purpose: Bringing plant potential to life. Through world-class science, global reach and commitment to our customers we help to increase crop productivity, protect the environment and improve health and quality of life. For more information about us please go to www.syngenta.com.

Job Description

The Seeds Development department for Syngenta seeks a passionate candidate for a full-time position of:

Applied Scientist - Pipeline Data Science

Type: Permanent

Department: Seeds Development / Vegetables

Location: Enkhuizen - The Netherlands

Into action

Do you thrive at the intersection of data engineering, predictive analytics, and innovation? As our Applied Scientist - Pipeline Data Science, you will play a crucial role in designing scalable data solutions that drive actionable insights. By consolidating complex datasets into robust, efficient pipelines, you’ll empower teams to make better decisions and uncover new possibilities in plant breeding. This is your opportunity to work on impactful projects in a collaborative and cutting-edge environment where data drives transformation.

The challenge

Responsibilities

As an Applied Scientist, you’ll focus on building the infrastructure that makes data accessible, reliable, and actionable for diverse stakeholders. Your key responsibilities will include:


Building Scalable Data Pipelines: Design, implement, and optimize data pipelines that integrate and consolidate data from multiple sources, ensuring seamless data flow and availability.
Ensuring Data Quality and Reliability: Develop systems to track, monitor, and maintain the quality, consistency, and integrity of data to ensure robust outputs for analysis and decision-making.
Driving Data Modeling and Mining: Create and implement processes for advanced data modeling and mining to support innovative analytical approaches.
Collaborating Across Teams: Work closely with IT, applied data science teams, and business stakeholders to align data solutions with organizational goals, addressing unique data needs efficiently.
Identify opportunities to incorporate advanced analytics, including machine learning frameworks and cloud platforms to continuously improve predictive pipelines.
Influence adoption of prediction methods, contribute towards their integration in the breeding process and the transformation of breeding schemes


This role combines creativity and problem-solving with a focus on real-world applications. You’ll not only shape the way data is managed but also contribute to meaningful outcomes in plant breeding and sustainable agriculture. Every dataset you refine and every system you enhance will drive smarter decisions and impactful innovations.

Qualifications

Your profile

We’re Looking For a Driven And Detail-oriented Applied Scientist With a Master’s Degree In Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Or a Related Field. You Bring a Strong Mix Of Technical Expertise, Analytical Acumen, And a Collaborative Mindset


Programming: Proficiency in Python, R, and SQL. Experience in both relational and NoSQL databases.
Cloud Proficiency: Familiarity with AWS services and cloud infrastructure
Analytical Acumen: Exceptional analytical skills, with the ability to identify patterns and trends in large and diverse datasets and translate them into meaningful recommendations.
Collaboration & Communication: A strong team player who thrives in cross-functional settings and communicates technical concepts effectively to diverse stakeholders.
Additionally, hands-on experience with containerization tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes) and machine learning frameworks (e.g., Keras, PyTorch, scikit-learn), along with an interest in plant breeding or agricultural innovation, would make you an ideal fit for this role.


Take your chance!

Syngenta is proud of its unique culture and the values that are at the heart of it. We also foster a strong learning culture with plenty of opportunities for personal development. Why? Because our work matters! We offer a competitive salary package, flexible working hours and excellent benefits.

Are you ready to grow your career with us?
Show more

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


CIMSOLUTIONS heeft een actief diversiteitsbeleid en streeft naar een evenwichtige verdeling van professionals naar leeftijd, gender, etnische achtergrond en cultuur, arbeidsvermogen, kennis en competenties. Hierbij benadrukken wij dat wij gelijke kansen belangrijk vinden in de selectie.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0499 – 366 000 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: ML Engineer
Description:
About The Role

We are looking for an ML Engineer to help build and deploy machine learning models that enhance the reliability and efficiency of EV charging networks. This role will focus on developing predictive models for anomaly detection, failure forecasting, and automated diagnostics, working with structured operational data. You will collaborate closely with engineering, AI/ML, and operations teams to integrate models into production, enabling proactive network management at scale.

This is an opportunity to shape the future of AI-powered network operations, ensuring charging infrastructure issues are detected and addressed before they impact users.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and deploy ML models for predictive maintenance, anomaly detection, and root cause analysis.
Analyze large-scale time-series and operational data to extract actionable insights.
Work with engineers to integrate models into AIOps for real-time decision-making.
Automate model retraining, monitoring, and deployment pipelines.
Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure model effectiveness.
Communicate findings and model insights through dashboards, reports, and documentation.


Required Skills & Qualifications


2+ years of experience in machine learning, predictive modeling, or data science.
Prior experience deploying predictive models to production
Strong proficiency in Python, Pandas, and SQL for data processing and model development.
Hands-on experience with ML frameworks (Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Knowledge of statistical modeling, anomaly detection, and time-series forecasting.
Experience with ETL pipelines, workflow automation (Airflow, Prefect), and cloud-based ML deployment.
Ability to work with large-scale structured data and relational databases.


Nice to Have


Experience with MLOps (model monitoring, retraining, and CI/CD for ML).
Familiarity with distributed data processing (Spark, Dask, etc.).
Experience working with Elasticsearch, PostgreSQL, or NoSQL databases.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
At Freeday, we aim to unlock human potential by leveraging disruptive technologies and building an AI-powered digital workforce that excels in repetitive tasks. By automating these tasks, we allow people to focus on more creative, rewarding work. We are a young, fast-growing IT company with a dynamic, no-nonsense culture. Located in the heart of Rotterdam, our team is driven by innovation, collaboration, and a passion for AI's potential to change the world.




Freeday is looking for a motivated Machine Learning Engineer to join our fast-growing AI team. This is an exciting opportunity to take your career to the next level by working on innovative machine-learning solutions that power our automated services. You will be involved in the development, deployment, and optimization of machine learning models, all within a supportive environment that encourages growth and learning.




As a Machine Learning Engineer at Freeday, you'll be surrounded by forward-thinking, innovative minds and cutting-edge AI technologies. Whether you’ve had 1 or 3 years of experience, we want someone who’s eager to learn, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and contribute to the projects that will shape the future of automation.




Responsibilities:




Design, develop, and implement machine learning models to drive our automated services.
Collaborate closely with product and engineering teams to define project objectives and align machine learning efforts with business goals.
Optimize machine learning algorithms for scalability and performance.
Contribute to the deployment of machine learning models in production environments using MLOps practices.
Continuously learn and adapt to new machine learning techniques and tools.
Take ownership of your projects while working in close collaboration with more senior team members for guidance and support.




What We Offer:




A dynamic, fast-growing, and innovative work environment.
A competitive salary and pension plan.
Opportunities for professional development, including learning new machine learning techniques and tools.
A fun, inclusive, and collaborative team culture with regular social events, sports activities, and team-building opportunities.
The chance to work on impactful projects that automate workflows and unlock human potential.
A company laptop to support your work effectively.
Room for growth, initiative, and the chance to make a real difference within the team




Our Culture:

At Freeday, we’re not just about the work—we’re about you. We embrace a collaborative and innovative culture where ideas flow freely, and everyone is encouraged to take ownership. Whether you’re developing machine learning models or learning new skills, you’ll be part of a supportive environment where growth and personal development are key.




Requirements:




1-3 years of experience in machine learning or a related role, preferably in the tech sector.
Strong programming skills in Python and a good understanding of popular ML frameworks (such as TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Basic familiarity with cloud technologies like AWS or Google Cloud.
Some experience or familiarity with MLOps tools like MLflow or Kubeflow is a plus.
You enjoy tackling challenges, are not afraid to take initiative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment.
Passionate about automation, AI, and the potential of technology to solve real-world problems.
Great communication skills and a team-oriented mindset.




Interested?

Do you want to be part of our team? We'd love to receive your resume and a cover letter outlining your motivation and the reason you fit perfectly into our team. If you have any additional questions before applying please reach out to us on vacature@freeday.ai




***

We're an equal-opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.

By automating these tasks, we allow people to focus on more creative, rewarding work. We are a young, fast-growing IT company with a dynamic, no-nonsense culture. Located in the heart of Rotterdam, our team is driven by innovation, collaboration, and a passion for AI's potential to change the world.

Freeday is looking for a motivated Machine Learning Engineer to join our fast-growing AI team. This is an exciting opportunity to take your career to the next level by working on innovative machine-learning solutions that power our automated services. You will be involved in the development, deployment, and optimization of machine learning models, all within a supportive environment that encourages growth and learning.




As a Machine Learning Engineer at Freeday, you'll be surrounded by forward-thinking, innovative minds and cutting-edge AI technologies. Whether you’ve had 1 or 3 years of experience, we want someone who’s eager to learn, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and contribute to the projects that will shape the future of automation.

Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and implement machine learning models to drive our automated services.
Collaborate closely with product and engineering teams to define project objectives and align machine learning efforts with business goals.
Optimize machine learning algorithms for scalability and performance.
Contribute to the deployment of machine learning models in production environments using MLOps practices.
Continuously learn and adapt to new machine learning techniques and tools.
Take ownership of your projects while working in close collaboration with more senior team members for guidance and support.




What We Offer:

A dynamic, fast-growing, and innovative work environment.
A competitive salary and pension plan.
Opportunities for professional development, including learning new machine learning techniques and tools.
A fun, inclusive, and collaborative team culture with regular social events, sports activities, and team-building opportunities.
The chance to work on impactful projects that automate workflows and unlock human potential.
A company laptop to support your work effectively.
Room for growth, initiative, and the chance to make a real difference within the team




Our Culture:




At Freeday, we’re not just about the work—we’re about you. We embrace a collaborative and innovative culture where ideas flow freely, and everyone is encouraged to take ownership. Whether you’re developing machine learning models or learning new skills, you’ll be part of a supportive environment where growth and personal development are key.




Requirements:

1-3 years of experience in machine learning or a related role, preferably in the tech sector.
Strong programming skills in Python and a good understanding of popular ML frameworks (such as TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Basic familiarity with cloud technologies like AWS or Google Cloud.
Some experience or familiarity with MLOps tools like MLflow or Kubeflow is a plus.
You enjoy tackling challenges, are not afraid to take initiative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment.
Passionate about automation, AI, and the potential of technology to solve real-world problems.
Great communication skills and a team-oriented mindset.




***

We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About TCS

Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is a global leader in IT services, digital, and business solutions that partners with its clients to simplify, strengthen, and transform their businesses. We ensure the highest levels of certainty and satisfaction through a deep-set commitment to our clients, comprehensive industry expertise, and a global network of innovation and delivery centers.




TCS operates on a global scale & has over 6,08,985 of the world’s best-trained consultants representing 152 nationalities in 53 countries. TCS established its presence in the Netherlands in 1992 and works with leading Dutch Customers across industry sectors, including several NL20 companies. TCS has been ranked #1 in customer satisfaction, among IT services providers in the Netherlands in a survey by Whitelane Research and is recognized as a Top Employer in the Netherlands, Europe & also Global by the Top Employers Institute




For more information, visit www.tcs.com




Role description

TCS is looking for a highly skilled and motivated Data Scientist to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing large sets of complex data to help guide strategic decision-making, uncover trends, and solve business problems. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, statistical modeling, machine learning, and programming, along with the ability to communicate findings clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Responsibilities:

Data Collection & Preparation:

Gather, clean, and preprocess large datasets from various sources (databases, external datasets, APIs).
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to understand the structure and quality of the data.
Apply data wrangling techniques to handle missing, inconsistent, or incomplete data.




Statistical Analysis & Modeling:

Use statistical techniques to identify patterns, correlations, and trends in data.
Develop predictive and prescriptive models using machine learning algorithms (supervised and unsupervised learning).
Build, test, and optimize models (e.g., regression, decision trees, random forests, SVM, deep learning, etc.).
Perform hypothesis testing and A/B testing to validate assumptions and recommendations.




Machine Learning & AI Implementation:

Implement machine learning models and algorithms for various business applications such as classification, clustering, recommendation systems, and forecasting.
Leverage deep learning techniques and neural networks when necessary for complex problems.
Monitor the performance of deployed models, providing regular updates and improvements as needed.




Data Visualization & Reporting:

Create interactive and insightful visualizations using tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or libraries like Matplotlib and Seaborn (for Python).
Present complex technical findings to non-technical stakeholders using clear, actionable insights.
Prepare detailed reports and dashboards that track key performance indicators (KPIs) and other business metrics.




Collaboration & Communication:

Work closely with cross-functional teams, including business analysts, product managers, and engineers, to define project goals and requirements.
Communicate findings, methodologies, and insights effectively to both technical and business audiences.
Provide actionable recommendations to help drive data-informed decision-making.




Continuous Improvement:

Stay up-to-date with the latest research, tools, and techniques in data science and machine learning.
Experiment with and implement cutting-edge machine learning algorithms and techniques.
Contributes to the refinement and optimization of existing data models and processes.




Data Governance & Ethics:

Ensure data integrity and privacy by following best practices in data handling and processing.
Work in compliance with data security standards and ethical guidelines.




Skills and Qualifications:

Educational Background:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field. PhD is a plus.




Technical Skills:

Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or Java.
Solid knowledge of statistical analysis and machine learning techniques.
Hands-on experience with data manipulation and analysis using libraries like Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, etc.
Familiarity with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, or similar.
Experience with databases (SQL, NoSQL) and data extraction techniques.
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure is a plus.




Analytical Skills:

Excellent problem-solving abilities and critical thinking skills.
Strong understanding of statistical methods, hypothesis testing, and data modeling




Soft Skills:

Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
Detail-oriented with a strong focus on quality and accuracy.




Experience:

Proven experience in a data scientist role or similar.
Experience in implementing machine learning models in a production environment is preferred.
Experience with deep learning frameworks like TensorFlow, Keras, or PyTorch.
Knowledge of NLP (Natural Language Processing) and computer vision techniques.
Experience working with large-scale datasets in a cloud computing environment.




Work Environment:

Collaborative and fast-paced work environment.
Opportunity to work with state-of-the-art technologies.
Supportive and dynamic team culture




This job description outlines the key responsibilities and skills for a Data Scientist role but is not an exhaustive list. As the data science landscape is constantly evolving, the role may adapt over time based on business needs and technological advancements.




Privacy Notice

Privacy Note: https://ibegin.tcs.com/iBegin/privacy-notice




Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is an equal opportunity employer. We truly believe that employing a diverse workforce is pivotal to our success. Please note, recruiting decisions are always based on applicant’s skills, competencies & experience and potential fitment to the available role

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


CIMSOLUTIONS heeft een actief diversiteitsbeleid en streeft naar een evenwichtige verdeling van professionals naar leeftijd, gender, etnische achtergrond en cultuur, arbeidsvermogen, kennis en competenties. Hierbij benadrukken wij dat wij gelijke kansen belangrijk vinden in de selectie.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0499 – 366 000 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
AI/ML Engineer - Utrecht




Heb jij een passie voor AI, data en innovatieve technologieën? Werk je graag aan de implementatie van Machine Learning-producten in productie? Dan is deze rol iets voor jou!




Wat ga je doen?

Als DevOps Engineer / ML Engineer werk je aan de ontwikkeling en implementatie van AI-oplossingen zoals Machine Learning, Deep Learning, OCR, Computer Vision, LLM’s en meer. Je zet modellen in productie en zorgt voor een robuuste en schaalbare AI-omgeving. Technologieën zoals Docker, Kubernetes, AI deployment pipelines en Generative AI spelen hierbij een grote rol.




Je werkt samen met data scientists en engineers om AI-producten te bouwen en te optimaliseren. Denk aan het opzetten van CI/CD pipelines voor AI-modellen, het monitoren van prestaties en het verbeteren van de infrastructuur voor AI-productontwikkeling.




Wie ben jij?

Minimaal 5 jaar ervaring als ML / AI Ops Engineer.
Sterke affiniteit met het naar productie brengen van AI-producten.
Ervaring met on-premise implementatie en AI deployment.
Kennis van Python, Kubernetes, PostgreSQL, MLFlow en AI Enterprise Solutions.
Pré: ervaring met LLM’s en Generative AI.
Goede communicatieve vaardigheden en het vermogen om oplossingen te onderbouwen.




Wat zit er in voor jou?

Een uitdagende en innovatieve werkomgeving.
De vrijheid en verantwoordelijkheid om AI-producten te ontwikkelen en implementeren.
Een mooi basissalaris en flink flex budget!
Hybride werken met een thuiswerkvergoeding en NS Business Card of reiskostenvergoeding.
Uitgebreide ontwikkelmogelijkheden via het Learning Center.
Aantrekkelijke secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, zoals collectiviteitskortingen en een solide pensioenregeling.




Wil jij werken in een dynamische en kennisintensieve omgeving waar AI-producten daadwerkelijk impact maken? Solliciteer nu!

Title: QA Engineer
Description:
Over de functie
Ben jij een ervaren QA Engineer die op systeemniveau het verschil wil maken? Werk je graag aan hoogwaardige softwareproducten en wil je bijdragen aan procesoptimalisatie binnen de industriële automatisering? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou!

In deze gecombineerde rol ben je de cruciale schakel tussen softwareontwikkeling en de klant. Je zorgt ervoor dat het softwareproduct van hoge kwaliteit is en dat releases soepel verlopen. Samen met je collega's werk je aan het verbeteren van test- en releaseprocessen en vertaal je de wensen van interne en externe stakeholders naar concrete oplossingen.

Wat ga je doen?

Opzetten en optimaliseren van release management en quality assurance processen.
Implementeren en onderhouden van geautomatiseerde testframeworks.
Uitvoeren en verbeteren van teststrategieën binnen de softwareontwikkelcyclus.
Werken met tools en technologieën zoals Java (of een andere hogere programmeertaal), JUnit, Selenium, Jira, Confluence, Gradle, GitHub, Github Actions, Eclipse/IntelliJ.
Zorgdragen voor een soepel verlopend CI/CD-proces en releasebeheer.
Samenwerken in een Scrum-team om software van hoge kwaliteit op te leveren.
Indien mogelijk bijdragen aan industriële automatiseringsoplossingen zoals MES en SCADA.

Wat breng je mee?

Een afgeronde MBO- of HBO-opleiding op het gebied van ICT.
Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring op het gebied van software release management en/of quality assurance.
Ervaring met geautomatiseerde testframeworks en het schrijven van tests.
Kennis van teststrategieën binnen een softwareontwikkelcyclus, bij voorkeur met ISTQB-certificering.
Ervaring met release management processen en CI/CD.
Ervaring met Scrum en Agile werkmethodieken.
Affiniteit met industriële automatisering is een pré.

Wat bieden wij?

Een uitdagende functie met veel verantwoordelijkheid en vrijheid.
Persoonlijke begeleiding en ruimte voor professionele groei.
Een goed salaris tussen €3.000 en €4.500 bruto per maand (afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring).
Aantrekkelijke secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, waaronder de mogelijkheid tot thuiswerken.
Een uitstekende pensioenregeling en collectieve zorgverzekering.
Tot 38 vrije dagen per jaar bij een 40-urige werkweek, zodat je een goede werk-privébalans kunt behouden.


Wil jij bijdragen aan de verdere ontwikkeling van innovatieve softwareoplossingen en werken in een dynamische omgeving? Solliciteer dan nu!


Desired Skills and Experience

PLC, SCADA, Test Automation, Java, Jira, Confluence, Selenium, Git, Github, Gitlab

Over de functie
 Ben jij een ervaren QA Engineer die op systeemniveau het verschil wil maken? Werk je graag aan hoogwaardige softwareproducten en wil je bijdragen aan procesoptimalisatie binnen de industriële automatisering? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou!

In deze gecombineerde rol ben je de cruciale schakel tussen softwareontwikkeling en de klant. Je zorgt ervoor dat het softwareproduct van hoge kwaliteit is en dat releases soepel verlopen. Samen met je collega's werk je aan het verbeteren van test- en releaseprocessen en vertaal je de wensen van interne en externe stakeholders naar concrete oplossingen.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
My client is a pioneering medical device and AI company who are seeking an expert machine learning engineer with expertise in medical imaging and diagnosis to join their dynamic team. They will assist with pushing the company forward with cutting edge research and development.




Job Responsibilities:

Develop and implement machine learning models for medical imaging applications, including classification, segmentation, and anomaly detection.
Preprocess and analyse large-scale medical imaging datasets (e.g., MRI, CT, X-ray, ultrasound) to optimize data quality and model performance.
Create deep learning architectures such as CNNs, GANs and Transformers, specifically for medical image analysis.
Deploy and optimize machine learning models for applications, ensuring efficiency and scalability.
Apply the best practices to improve existing solutions and keep up to date with the latest research in AI, machine learning and medical imaging.
Keep track of model development, system integration processes and experimental results.




Requirements:

Master’s degree and/or Phd in related field – i.e: Biomedical Engineering, Electrical engineering, computer science.
3+ years of experience in Machine learning and/or deep learning, specifically focussing on medical imaging.
Experience in medical imaging formats ( DICOM, NIfTI) and related processing tools ( ITK, Simple ITK, OpenCV).
Familiarity with Python Libraries ( Pandas, NymPy, SciPy Etc).
Proficiency with cloud computing platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and MLOPS practices.
Excellent collaborative mindset, communicational skills as well as problem solving skills.




Desirable Qualifications:

Hands-on experience with explainable AI (XAI) methods for medical applications.
Experience with regulatory considerations in medical AI ( FDA, CE Marking)
Prior knowledge and exposure to federated learning and privacy-preserving AI techniques.







Following your application Sophie Batt, a specialist AI Medical Device Recruiter will discuss the opportunity with you in detail.

She will be more than happy to answer any questions relating to the industry and the potential for your career growth. The conversation can also progress further to discussing other opportunities, which are also available right now or will be imminently becoming available

This position has been highly popular, and it is likely that it will close prematurely. We recommend applying as soon as possible to avoid disappointment.

sbatt@barringtonjames.com

Show more

Title: ML Backend Software Engineer
Description:
About the job




Adamas Knight is recruiting for a groundbreaking startup in Amsterdam that’s transforming biology programming into a breeze—making a real-world difference along the way!

Get ready to tackle the intricacies of nature head-on, solving real-world challenges that extend beyond code.




The Role




As a Backend Software Engineer, you’ll go beyond pure software development, contributing to a platform designed to optimize biological systems. You’ll build a modular, service-oriented web application that leverages advanced machine learning techniques for biological optimization. You will also assist the team in developing a robust and adaptable software framework while working closely with Scientists and ML experts to gain deeper insights into their domains.




You will need:

Proficient in algorithms and problem-solving, and Python ecosystem
4 years+ of experience in creating backend systems within a modern cloud environment, following standard software development practices
You are approachable and thrive in collaborative settings




Benefits/Perks:




Attractive Compensation: Enjoy a competitive salary and the opportunity to invest in your future with equity in the company
Comprehensive Benefits: Access private healthcare, a gym allowance, and catered lunches to support your well-being
Work-Life Balance: Benefit from flexible working hours that fit your lifestyle










At Adamas Knight, we are committed to creating an inclusive culture. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, age, veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status. Diversity is highly valued, and we encourage applicants from all backgrounds to apply.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Coders Connect is partnering with a cutting-edge start-up that is revolutionizing how businesses leverage data for decision-making. The company focuses on building advanced forecasting solutions that help drive sustainability efforts and optimize resource use. They're looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join their team and be part of creating their first commercial MVP.




What you'll do:

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a critical role in developing data-driven insights and helping shape the company's long-term success. Your responsibilities will include:

Building the First Product: Collaborate in a cross-functional team to design, optimize, and deploy both the forecasting algorithms and data visuals that will power the company's first MVP.
Designing a Future-Proof Infrastructure: Implement explainable ML and AI solutions, develop systems for monitoring model and data drift, and create processes that will allow the rapid production of new models.
Ensuring Platform Performance: Develop product analytics to monitor performance and inform product development decisions.
Staying Ahead with Technology: Keep up with the latest industry trends to ensure the use of cutting-edge technology that maximizes business impact.




Requirements:

Strong Forecasting Background: Extensive experience in building and deploying forecasting models, with hands-on knowledge of various tools and techniques.
Advanced ML Skills: Proficient in deploying machine learning pipelines and creating explainable AI solutions, while staying in tune with business needs.
Data Visualization Expertise: Skilled at translating complex datasets and time series into easy-to-understand insights.
Team-Oriented with a Product Focus: A clear communicator and collaborative team player with a product-led approach to engineering.
Start-up Experience: A background in early-stage environments, demonstrating adaptability and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced setting.
Relocation Flexibility: Must be an EU citizen and available to relocate to the Netherlands.




Preferred Tech Stack:

You will have input on shaping the company’s tech stack. Some preferred tools and technologies include:




Languages: Python for ML, R for data analysis
ML Libraries: scikit-learn, Prophet, TensorFlow, Keras
Data Processing/Storage: SQL, Spark
Cloud Platform: Azure
Version Control: Git




Benefits:

An initial one-year contract with the possibility of extension, based on the success of the collaboration.
A flexible hybrid work environment that promotes work-life balance.
Continuous learning opportunities and room for career growth within a fast-evolving company.
The chance to work with an international team of talented professionals across tech and product.
A meaningful opportunity to contribute to sustainability efforts and make a real-world impact.




Kindly note that VISA Sponsorship is not available for this position.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


CIMSOLUTIONS heeft een actief diversiteitsbeleid en streeft naar een evenwichtige verdeling van professionals naar leeftijd, gender, etnische achtergrond en cultuur, arbeidsvermogen, kennis en competenties. Hierbij benadrukken wij dat wij gelijke kansen belangrijk vinden in de selectie.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0499 – 366 000 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: Data Science Intern
Description:
Job Description

We have an excellent opportunity for an enthusiastic Bachelor or Master student who is interested in making a difference in Category Development at Kraft Heinz! The Category team is at the heart of our commercial activities and sets out and implements an effective category management our brands. This includes drafting commercial strategies, identifying brand & category opportunities and regular sparring sessions with the marketing, sales, finance, procurement, and other commercial teams. 

The Positions 

Every internship at Kraft Heinz Netherlands offers unique opportunities to develop new knowledge and skills, gain real business experience, get exposure to senior leadership and attend tailored trainings. As an intern you will take ownership of projects and work closely with the business on day-to-day challenges. 

Data scientist internship position in the KraftHeinz Advanced Analytics team. The position will focus on applying statistical and machine learning methodologies to answer challenging questions in the realm of revenue management and brand growth (pricing, promotion, assortment).

As part of KraftHeinz Digital, the intern will work on products used in markets across the globe – and tasks can range from operational check-ins with end-users to exploratory research.

Recruitment process  


CV selection based on eligibility requirements. 
Online Pymetrics assessment 
Online Pymetrics video interview 
Online Screening Interview via Microsoft Teams 
Online Hiring manager interview 



Note The recruitment process can take 4/6 weeks in total 

Kraft Heinz is an Equal Opportunity Employer that prohibits discrimination or harassment of any type. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants who require an accommodation to participate in the job application or hiring process should contact NATAI@kraftheinz.com. 

What we offer you  

Program start date May 2025

Duration 6 months 

Allowance 625 euro per month (40hrs, 5 days) & full reimbursement of travel expenses 

Location Amsterdam 

Become a part of a close intern community as well as a young and ambitious work environment (including online). 

Hybrid Policy  

Kraft Heinz has recently transitioned to a hybrid way of working, which means that we work 60% of the week in the office and have the right to work 40% from home. 

Location(s)

Amsterdam

Kraft Heinz is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Underrepresented Ethnic Minority Groups/Women/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity and other protected classes.

Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0499 – 366 000 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


CIMSOLUTIONS heeft een actief diversiteitsbeleid en streeft naar een evenwichtige verdeling van professionals naar leeftijd, gender, etnische achtergrond en cultuur, arbeidsvermogen, kennis en competenties. Hierbij benadrukken wij dat wij gelijke kansen belangrijk vinden in de selectie.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0499 – 366 000 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: Junior Data Scientist - Early Career Program
Description:
This Is What We Offer You


Gross monthly salary between EUR 3,179 and EUR 4,540 (scale 07) for a 36 hour week
Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance
10% Employee Benefit Budget
EUR 1,400 development budget per year
Hybrid working: balance between home and office work (possible for most roles)
A pension, for which you can set the maximum amount of your personal contribution


View all our benefits.

Junior Data Scientist – Data & analytics Early Career Program

Are you passionate about data and love solving complex analytical puzzles? Challenge yourself and us, and make an impact with the Advanced Analytics Early Career Program at Rabobank. Grow your skills, discover your potential, and help us uncover new possibilities for Rabobank.

The role

As a Junior Data Scientist, you will work on developing, maintaining and improving machine learning models focused on diverse use cases throughout the bank. You will be at the forefront of creating models that help solve complex challenges, streamline processes, and unlock new opportunities. We need someone who can dive deep into data, work with tree based and clustering models and create scalable and reliable solutions.

You and your future

During our Early Career Program, you’ll develop your career over 18 months by becoming an expert in your field. Throughout the program, you’ll stay with one team and receive training to enhance your hard skills. You’ll be paired with a buddy who will guide you in navigating the bank. For your personal development, you and your fellow starters will follow the Early Career Program and receive guidance from a Data & Analytics Development Consultant. We’re here to prepare you for sustainable career!

Practical


Length: 18 months, after which you will continue working within your team
Hours per week: 40 About 10-15% of your weekly working time is spent on personal development, training and other activities. The other hours are spent working within your team;
Every Friday afternoon is Data & Analytics Early Career Program  afternoon at the office! 


Your development as a Young Professional

Within this program, you will have the opportunity to get to know yourself, your trade, and Rabobank. You will start the program in a junior position within one team, participate in (online) workshops and training modules with other young professionals, and quickly gain practical experience.

Together with Data & Analytics community there is room for creativity and initiative to organize events, training sessions, and knowledge-sharing sessions. This way, we continuously improve the program and ourselves! You will easily build a large and valuable network within the bank.

Learning From Each Other

Development is our top priority. The best way to learn is by doing, through both mistakes and successes. At Rabobank, we offer you the right balance between freedom and supervision. Develop talents you never thought you possessed, specialize in a professional field, or explore the things you're good at and enjoy doing. During your Advanced Analytics Early Career Program, you can count on us for excellent supervision. You'll work with experienced colleagues and have lots of contact with other Advanced Analytics young professionals.

‘Working for CLUE has provided a steep technical learning experience. The dynamic atmosphere ensures continuous growth with exciting new implementations always on the horizon.'

Rianne Weijsters, Data Scientist

Work on your own development & shape the world around you

For us, your development and that of society go hand in hand. That's why we want to invest in you and work together towards a better world. We summarize this in one sentence: "At Rabobank, you work on yourself and the world around you at the same time."

This is reflected in your personal development budget, our hybrid work environment, and a good work-life balance. You can work on banking matters for our private and business clients, but also on societal issues such as food and energy transitions.

You and your talent


Educational Background: You have obtained a Master's in (Quantitative) Economics, Econometrics, Data Science, Machine Learning, Informatics or a similar field.
Work Experience: Approximately 0-2 years of work experience.
Residency: Currently living in the Netherlands.
Communication Skills: Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to translate quantitative analysis into comprehensive information for higher management and business users.
Technical Skills: Knowledge of Python as well as (interest in learning) Databricks, PySpark, cloud technologies (e.g. Azure), Git, CI/CD, ETL processes, SQL
Language Proficiency: Excellent command of the English language.


You and the job application process

We believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. What can you bring to Rabobank? We can't wait to hear from you.


Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Contact Natasja Helder-Severijns (Recruiter) via Natasja.helder-severijns@rabobank.nl
1st Interviews will be held via MS Teams.
2nd Interviews will be held via MS Teams or at our offices in Utrecht. A case will be part of the 2nd interview process.
Assessments are part of the application process which will be done before the 1st interview.
We look forward to meeting you in person during the selection days.
A security check is part of the process.
We respect your privacy.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
*** CONTRACT Machine Learning Engineer/Software Engineer ***

Location: Amsterdam, Netherlands (remote)

Contract Length: 6 months + rolling contract

The Client:

A fast-growing tech scale-up developing AI-powered solutions to optimize renewable energy trading. Their technology helps energy companies manage power market fluctuations and maximize efficiency.




Responsibilities:

Develop, deploy, and maintain machine learning pipelines for real-time and batch forecasting.
Automate ML model retraining and deployment for improved efficiency.
Optimize the scalability, reliability, and performance of AI-driven solutions.
Transform experimental ML code into production-ready software.
Implement best practices in CI/CD, DevOps, and performance monitoring.
Work with Python (ML/Data Stack), cloud platforms (GCP), Docker, Kubernetes, BigQuery, DBT, & monitoring tools




Requirements:

4+ years of experience in software development in an ML environment.
Strong experience with ML model life-cycle management (MLOps), preferably of time series models
Strong Python skills and ability to write clean, scalable code.
Experience with MLOps, CI/CD, DevOps, and software testing.
Hands-on experience with cloud infrastructure (GCP/AWS) and containerization.
BONUS: previous experience in energy or renewables sector

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
AI Engineer (With a focus on LLM & RAG)




Location - Netherlands (Hybrid Working)

Salary - DoE (Range €65,000/€80,000)




Transform Real Estate with AI – Be Part of the Revolution!




Are you ready to take on the challenge of blending artificial intelligence with one of the world’s most dynamic industries? I’m working with a forward-thinking organisation that’s using AI to revolutionise the real estate sector. They’re building cutting-edge tools to empower professionals with smarter, faster, and more intuitive solutions—and they need your expertise to make it happen.




If you’re excited about AI innovation and want to leave your mark on an evolving industry, this role is for you!




Your Mission as an LLM Engineer:

As an LLM Engineer, you’ll play a key role in designing and deploying advanced AI applications that push the boundaries of what’s possible. You’ll be part of a team that’s not just dreaming about the future but actively building it.




What You’ll Do:

- Build and refine AI-powered tools tailored to solve real-world challenges in real estate.

- Take prototypes to the next level by scaling them into impactful, production-ready solutions.

- Experiment with and optimise large language models (LLMs) to ensure accuracy and reliability.

- Work closely with cross-functional teams to integrate AI tools seamlessly into workflows.

- Present innovative solutions to stakeholders, demonstrating how technology can transform their operations.










The Company:

This company is at the forefront of data-driven innovation in real estate. With access to the largest property database in the Netherlands, they’re leveraging AI and machine learning to create transparency, efficiency, and accessibility for industry professionals. Their goal? To simplify complex processes and unlock insights that drive success.




You’ll join a diverse, passionate team of over 50 innovators who thrive on collaboration and creativity. Located in Utrecht, the office offers a modern workspace, flexible hybrid work options, free parking, and a culture that values both productivity and well-being.







Who We’re Looking For:

We’re seeking a tech-savvy professional with a passion for AI and a knack for problem-solving. If you’re someone who loves tackling complex challenges and thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, this role is perfect for you.




Must-Have Skills:

- Hands-on experience developing and deploying LLM applications in cloud environments (AWS is a plus).

- Strong understanding of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) and prompt engineering techniques.

- Proficiency in Python, machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hugging Face), SQL, Git, and API integration.

- Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, ML Ops tools, and data pipeline management.

- Fluent in both English and Dutch.

- Currently residing in the Netherlands.




Bonus Points For:

- Experience with platforms like Amazon Bedrock or OpenAI API.

- Knowledge of the real estate industry, especially NVM Wonen.




Let’s build the future of real estate together—one AI solution at a time.




For more information please get in touch RRJ@oxygendigital.ai

Show more
