Title: AI/ML Researcher
Description:
About TCS

Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is a global leader in IT services, digital, and business solutions that partners with its clients to simplify, strengthen, and transform their businesses. We ensure the highest levels of certainty and satisfaction through a deep-set commitment to our clients, comprehensive industry expertise, and a global network of innovation and delivery centers.




TCS operates on a global scale & has over 6,08,985 of the world’s best-trained consultants representing 152 nationalities in 53 countries. TCS established its presence in the Netherlands in 1992 and works with leading Dutch Customers across industry sectors, including several NL20 companies. TCS has been ranked #1 in customer satisfaction, among IT services providers in the Netherlands in a survey by Whitelane Research and is recognized as a Top Employer in the Netherlands, Europe & also Global by the Top Employers Institute




For more information, visit www.tcs.com




Role description

An AI/ML Researcher at TCS is responsible for advancing the field of artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) through the design, development, and implementation of innovative algorithms and models. The role typically involves:




Responsibilities:

Research and Development:

Conduct cutting-edge research in AI and ML to advance state-of-the-art models and algorithms.
Explore and experiment with new machine learning techniques such as deep learning, reinforcement learning, and unsupervised learning.
Develop novel AI solutions for complex problems across various industries, including healthcare, finance, robotics, and autonomous systems.




Algorithm Design:

Design and implement novel algorithms for data analysis, predictive modeling, pattern recognition, and natural language processing.
Improve the efficiency and scalability of existing models and algorithms.




Data Analysis:

Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights for training models.
Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, anomalies, and key features that drive decision-making.




Model Training & Evaluation:

Train machine learning models on large datasets and optimize them for accuracy and performance.
Conduct thorough evaluation and testing of models using appropriate metrics to ensure generalizability and robustness.




Collaboration:

Work closely with cross-functional teams, including software engineers, product managers, and domain experts, to deploy AI/ML models into real-world applications.
Collaborate with other researchers and academic institutions to stay at the forefront of AI/ML trends and contribute to the academic community.




Publications & Presentations:

Publish research findings in peer-reviewed journals and present at industry conferences.
Communicate complex research results to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Requirements:

Educational Qualifications:

A Ph.D. or master’s degree in computer science, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field with a strong focus on AI/ML.




Technical Skills:

Expertise in machine learning libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, Scikit-learn).
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, C++, or Java.
Strong knowledge of mathematical concepts, including linear algebra, probability, statistics, and optimization techniques.
Contributions to AI/ML open-source projects or publications in top-tier journals or conferences.
Experience in cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) for model deployment.
Familiarity with large-scale distributed systems and data processing frameworks (e.g., Hadoop, Spark)




Experience:

Strong research background, deep technical expertise in AI and ML, and a passion for solving real-world problems with advanced technologies
Experience with deep learning, natural language processing (NLP), computer vision, or reinforcement learning.
Practical experience in designing and deploying ML models at scale.




Soft Skills:

Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for innovation.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills to explain complex concepts clearly.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.




Privacy Notice

Privacy Note: https://ibegin.tcs.com/iBegin/privacy-notice




Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is an equal opportunity employer. We truly believe that employing a diverse workforce is pivotal to our success. Please note, recruiting decisions are always based on applicant’s skills, competencies & experience and potential fitment to the available role

Title: Data scientist
Description:
At Cocoroco.com we're looking for a Data scientist to join and build our team.

About Us

We are Cocoroco.com! We believe the war on talent is a matter of a loca l market mismatch. That’s why we’re enabling companies to tap into the global talent pool through our online talent marketplace for remote customer service, sales and compliance talent. By doing so, global talent can connect with international companies, work from home and get fair compensation. It is therefore our mission to make work accessible for everyone globally, regardless of their location or background. Talents will now access the global labor market and maximize their career growth by unlocking their full potential.

Founded in early 2021, Cocoroco.com is growing at a fast pace and has built a proven online marketplace to support our business model. Speed and quality are the core drivers of our success which are accelerated by automation, and our model is trusted by companies such as Bunq, Rituals, Picnic, and many more. About the job.

Job Description

We are now looking for a Data scientist to join our team located at the Keizersgracht in the center of Amsterdam. Be our first in-house data hire and shape our innovative marketplace to make work accessible for everyone globally. We're currently working with an agency to develop our platform, and this will be our first internal position to grow the in-house tech team.

This gives the opportunity to become part of a profitable, fast-growing company with the flexibility to define and build on the technical foundations of our business. The ideal candidate has the ability to our data development and has the potential to lead the future tech team.

Does this sound like the challenge you need? Don’t wait—reach out to discuss.

Role


Data scientist


Objective


Spearhead the team’s data success by building, validating and maintaining our data roadmap.


Scope


Reporting to the Co-Founder.
Be the first in-house data hire


Responsibilities


Develop and optimize Machine Learning models to improve hiring efficiency, predict candidate success, and enhance business operations.
Build and maintain NLP-based solutions for resume parsing, automated job matching, and candidate profiling.
Design and execute A/B tests to improve platform features, user engagement, and decision-making.
Work with structured and unstructured datasets to uncover trends and actionable insights.
Deploy AI-powered solutions to automate repetitive tasks and enhance operational workflows.
Develop data pipelines and cloud-based analytics solutions in collaboration with engineers.
Create interactive dashboards and reports to support business teams in making data-driven decisions.


Requirements

Technical skills:


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, AI, Computer Science, or a related field.
Experience with Machine Learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn).
Strong programming skills in Python (Pandas, NumPy, FastAPI).
Experience with Cloud & Big Data technologies (AWS S3, Glue, Athena, Supabase).
Proficiency in SQL & NoSQL databases (PostgreSQL, MariaDB, DynamoDB).
Familiarity with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, Matplotlib, Seaborn).
Bonus: Experience with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) and Large Language Models (LLMs) for AI-driven applications.


Experience


>2 years work experience with mainstream frameworks
Proven track record of developing full-stack applications.
Experience in AI integration and database management.
Demonstrated ability to work on complex projects from concept to deployment.
Experience in managing and deploying applications in cloud environments.


Soft Skills


Strong problem-solving abilities.
Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.


Nice To Have


Experience with marketplaces and AI-driven projects.
Understanding of generative AI database prompting.


Benefits

Perks and benefits:


Competitive salary, on a labor contract.
Opportunity to work on innovative projects.
Professional development and growth opportunities.
Flexible working hours and remote work options.


Application Process


Submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your experience and why you are a good fit for this role.
Review
Cultural interview
Technical interview
Offer


Apply for the job

Do you want to join our team as our new Data scientist? Then we'd love to hear about you!

Title: Risk Data Scientist
Description:
Sia is a next-generation, global management consulting group. Founded in 1999, we were born digital. Today our strategy and management capabilities are augmented by data science, enhanced by creativity and driven by responsibility. We’re optimists for change and we help clients initiate, navigate and benefit from transformation. We believe optimism is a force multiplier, helping clients to mitigate downside and maximize opportunity. With expertise across a broad range of sectors and services, our 3,000 consultants serve clients worldwide from 48 locations in 19 countries. Our expertise delivers results. Our optimism transforms outcomes.









Job Description



The Amsterdam Data Science team, currently 8 data scientists/engineers, is young, diverse and growing. As we are still relatively small you will be in the driver seat to shape its future. We have a flat structure and value the entrepreneurial spirit of our members: initiative is highly encouraged. We are also striving for well-being, diversity and knowledge-sharing inside the team, so that we all grow. We want to expand our capabilities in the risk domain and are currently looking for at least 3 new risk data scientists to join our team.



As a risk data scientist you will be working on various client projects as well as on building our own Sia AI solutions, together with our French Data Engineering team and the Financial Services business units of Sia Global. You perform complex analyses, build or improve risk models, identify business needs and create relevant solutions and action plans. You work on structural solutions for our clients and to that end you ensure that your work is understandable, well documented and reusable. If there are any commercial opportunities within your expertise, you notice and develop these together with the team.



Since you are the expert in the field of Risk, you take initiative and are not afraid to guide other consultants from your team in achieving deliverables and facilitate personal development. You will actively participate in knowledge sharing, code reviews and deep dives to develop the ambitious team that you are part of.





Qualifications


You hold a Master’s Degree with a strong quantitative component (e.g. Econometrics, Physics, Mathematics, Statistics, Quantitative Finance)
You have 1-3 years of relevant experience in the financial services sector (e.g. credit risk, portfolio management, assessing regulations, trading strategies)
You have deep understanding of modelling techniques used within the risk domain and are capable to communicate and explain your knowledge to different audiences
You are a true problem solver, you turn complex issues into simple business understandable solutions
You have excellent interpersonal and team working skills
Strong coding skills in at least Python, other programming languages are a plus
Good experience with database management languages (e.g., SQL, PostgreSQL)
Consulting experience is a plus.
Proficiency with unix-based command line and DevOps tools (Git, Docker, Kubernetes), big data technologies(Spark, Hadoop, Databricks) and in cloud-based infrastructures (AWS/ GCP/ Azure) is a very strong plus
Excellent English and Dutch verbal and written skills are required.

What do we offer?



Competitive salary with great extra advantages such as, a clear and structured yearly salary increase and yearly bonuses.
Flexible transport options that match your personal needs.
Training plan to develop yourself as an expert in your discipline.
You have the opportunity to work from home, with the client or from our inspiring office in Amsterdam.
Working in an international environment creates opportunities to share knowledge and work together on international projects with colleagues all over the world.


Additional Information



We are unable to provide a work permit for this position



Non-Dutch speaker will no be accepted



Sia is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

Show more

Title: Solutions Engineer
Description:
Syndigo powers the continual flow of data and content throughout the entire commerce ecosystem— accelerating delivery of accurate and compelling information that increases sales on every shelf. We are the recognized leader in software and services for the management of master data, product information, digital assets, and content syndication and analytics across industries including grocery, foodservice, hardlines, home improvement, oil & gas, pet, health and beauty, automotive, apparel, and healthcare products.

Syndigo serves the industry’s largest two-sided network, connecting more than 50,000 global users across 12,000+ global brands with more than 1,750 global retailers.

Basically, we're the people that deliver the rich, accurate product content that helps consumers shop online with confidence, and helps brands and retailers operate efficient product supply chains. We cannot do all of this without our amazing employees who make the magic happen here at Syndigo. As we continue to grow, we’re always looking to identify talented individuals to join our team.


This is a remote position open to candidates in the UK or the Netherlands only at this time**



Pre-sales isn’t just about explaining a product—it’s about helping people see what’s possible. It’s about understanding, guiding, and storytelling. When done well, pre-sales transforms complexity into clarity, ideas into solutions, and prospects into customers.

For those of us who’ve spent years refining this craft, we know there’s nothing quite like the moment when a client truly gets it—when they can see how your platform fits their world, solves their challenge, and moves their business forward. That’s what great pre-sales does, and that’s what we’re looking for in our next Solutions Engineer.

This role isn’t just about running through a demo script or ticking off a checklist. It’s about engaging, challenging, and inspiring. It’s about knowing your audience—when to dive deep into technical detail and when to elevate the conversation to business value. It’s about being adaptable, resourceful, and always looking for ways to enhance the story we tell and the way we tell it.

If you love problem-solving, storytelling, and shaping client decisions, we’d love to talk.

How We’ll Be Winning Together Day To Day


Consult and Collaborate: Work with prospects to deeply understand their business challenges across industries and data domains. Tailor consultative approaches to guide them towards impactful outcomes.
Deliver Engaging Demonstrations: Bring our expertise to life through impactful, value-driven demonstrations and presentations—showcasing how our capabilities align with their needs.
Elevate the Narrative: Shift conversations beyond technical details to meaningful discussions about differentiation, business outcomes, and industry trends.
Push the Boundaries: Use our API framework and SDK to explore creative ways to extend our capabilities, tailoring innovative solutions to meet the unique needs of prospects and their use cases.
Drive Competitive Edge: Use your expertise to create messaging and collateral that highlight our strengths and establish us as a trusted partner in PIM, MDM, PXM, and Syndication.
Own Your Demo Environments: Take responsibility for configuring, maintaining, and optimising your demo accounts and software environments. Ensure they are always ready to deliver seamless, impactful, and tailored demonstrations.
Collaborate Across Teams: Partner with sales, product management, and marketing to refine our offerings, address customer feedback, and stay ahead of market demands.
Support and Inspire the Team: Help your fellow team members shine by sharing ideas, providing support, and showcasing the team’s achievements. Drive efforts that move the needle and elevate the art of pre-sales within the team, fostering collaboration and innovation.



WE SHOULD TALK IF THIS SOUNDS LIKE YOU

We need someone who understands pre-sales at its core—who sees it as more than just answering questions, but rather as crafting experiences that resonate.


5+ years of Solution Engineering Experience in SaaS environment
Technical Expertise: A strong grasp of APIs, cloud-native technologies, and the ability to quickly learn and articulate complex capabilities. You thrive on exploring possibilities within our API framework and SDK to creatively extend our offerings and meet unique prospect use cases.
Industry Knowledge: Proven experience in the areas of PIM, MDM, PXM, Syndication, and Ecommerce—ideally in multi-domain contexts.
Consultative Mindset: Ability to position capabilities as enablers of business value, rather than just technical tools.
Communication Skills: A polished and persuasive communicator with a knack for simplifying complex ideas and building trust with diverse stakeholders.
Self-Motivation: A proactive, solution-oriented attitude that drives you to deliver results independently and collaboratively.
Presentation Mastery: Experience delivering engaging product demonstrations to both technical and business audiences.
Strategic Insight: Familiarity with competitive landscapes and industry trends to refine messaging and support differentiation efforts.
Creative Problem-Solving: A desire to push the boundaries of what’s possible, using innovation and technical acumen to create tailored solutions that address specific business challenges.



WHY JOIN US

Joining us means becoming part of a high-performing, collaborative team where pre-sales is valued, refined, and continuously improved. You’ll have the freedom to innovate, experiment, and craft compelling client experiences, not just repeat standard demos.

Here, you’ll work in an environment where your contributions make a direct impact—where your ideas shape the way we engage, the way we differentiate, and the way we win. This is a place for pre-sales professionals who love the craft, the challenge, and the thrill of making complex problems simple. If that sounds like you, we should talk.

Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

Authenticity fuels our work. In fact, it’s one of our Syndigo Values. To achieve the best version of our organization, we know it takes new ideas, new approaches, new perspectives and new ways of thinking. A purpose we are 100% committed to cultivating.

Diversity is woven into our fabric at Syndigo and it’s how we stay an industry leader, innovating technology solutions that equip our customers with everything they need to be successful!

All are welcome here and we invite you to join our team if you are ready to help us continue that growth!

GDPR/CCPA

Syndigo, to process applications, holds onto data for a "reasonable time" after applications are submitted. This data is stored for Syndigo's internal use by HR/Recruiting Staff only. Verified requests for data deletion and exports will be completed upon request.

Syndigo Job Applicant Privacy Notice

At Syndigo, we care about your privacy. As you go through our recruitment process, we are committed to being transparent about how we process your personal data. To learn more about how Syndigo processes your personal data, go to our Job Applicant Privacy Notice.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Als AI & ML Engineer bij VisionBI houd je je bezig met het ontwikkelen van innovatieve en state-of-the-art oplossingen op het gebied van Artificial Intelligence en Machine Learning. Je werkt binnen het Microsoft ecosysteem en bent bedreven in technologieën zoals Azure OpenAI, Large Language Models (LLM), Python en PyTorch. Generative AI en andere geavanceerde AI-technieken behoren tot jouw gereedschapskist.




Je bent nieuwsgierig en analytisch en weet complexe AI-oplossingen te vertalen naar praktische toepassingen voor onze klanten. Samen met hen werk je aan de meest efficiënte en effectieve oplossingen, waarbij je rekening houdt met zowel de technische als de zakelijke kant. Je begrijpt het belang van goede communicatie en samenwerking binnen een team en werkt veelal Agile/Scrum om samen met jouw team tot de juiste oplossing te komen. Dagelijkse stand-ups en teamoverleg zijn voor jou vanzelfsprekend.




De ideale werkweek betekent voor jou dat je gemiddeld twee dagen op de klantlocatie werkt en de resterende dagen desgewenst vanuit ons kantoor in De Meern of gewoon remote. Ook al zien we elkaar niet elke dag, het VisionBI team staat altijd voor je klaar!




Dit ga je nog meer doen: Naast dat je als AI & ML Engineer werkt aan uiteenlopende projecten voor VisionBI klanten, volg je de nieuwste ontwikkelingen op het gebied van AI en Machine Learning op de voet. Je hebt een passie voor het ontwikkelen en trainen van AI-modellen en bent bedreven in het implementeren van geavanceerde algoritmes en dataverwerkingspipelines. Je werkt met cutting-edge technologieën zoals LLM’s, transformer-based modellen en generatieve AI om innovatieve oplossingen te realiseren. Daarnaast werk je samen met data engineers en software ontwikkelaars om robuuste en schaalbare AI-oplossingen te bouwen die direct impact hebben op de business.




Wat je meebrengt: Het liefst heb je een op AI, Data Science of Informatica gerichte HBO of WO opleiding afgerond. Na het afronden van jouw opleiding heb je reeds meer da 2 jaar relevante werkervaring. Stap je net de universiteit buiten, laat je dan niet afschrikken en geef een gil. Ook onze opleidingsmogelijkheden zullen de start van jouw carrière een mooie kick-start geven.




Wat bieden wij jou?

Enthousiaste en zeer kundige nieuwe collega’s!
Mobiliteitsplan - erop uit.
Een telefoonabonnement - hallo wie is daar?
Een laptop - in de schoot geworpen.
Collectieve pensioenregeling - we worden allemaal ouder.
25 vakantiedagen – even lekker weg.
Gave VisionBI-uitjes – overal en nergens.
Focus op kennisdeling en verbreding – Je staat toch niet stil?
Royale opleidingsmogelijkheden - jouw carrière in de lift.
Ruime flexibiliteit waar het gaat om remote werken – lekker nieuwerwets.
Mis je nog iets? - Het zou kunnen ;)




Wat vragen wij van jou?

Een afgeronde HBO of WO opleiding in een technische richting.
Gerichte werkervaring (>2 jaar).
Goede zelfkennis, weten wat je kunt en wat je nog wenst te leren.
Jouw passie is een combinatie van AI, data én de mens.
Analytisch sterk ontwikkelde vaardigheden.
Pragmatisch, maar altijd kritisch op kwaliteit.
Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse (must) en Engelse taal.
Uitstekend ontwikkelde sociale en communicatieve vaardigheden.




Jouw technische vaardigheden:

Python – uiteraard.
Machine Learning frameworks zoals PyTorch, TensorFlow en Scikit-Learn.
Generative AI en Large Language Models (LLM's).
Azure OpenAI en andere Azure AI-diensten.
Data Engineering skills zoals werken met Databricks, Synapse Analytics en Azure ML.
Cloud computing en DevOps (Azure DevOps, CI/CD voor ML-modellen).
Kennis van MLOps en model deployment technieken.
SQL en NoSQL databases voor AI toepassingen.
Andere gerelateerde kennis die je hier niet ziet staan? ….laat het ons weten!




Waarom VisionBI?

Dagelijks zorgen we ervoor dat onze klanten beschikken over slimme en innovatieve AI-oplossingen. Wij houden ervan om vernieuwend en vooruitstrevend te zijn. We zoeken altijd de uitdaging op, en dat geldt natuurlijk ook voor jou. Kom jij met nieuwe ideeën om ons en jezelf verder te laten groeien? Wil je écht iets anders? Dan is VisionBI de plek voor jou om te werken.

Daarnaast brengen we je ook helemaal up to speed met maandelijkse kennissessies via ons Center of Excellence.




Onze manier van werken:

We bieden iedereen een persoonlijk opleidingsplan.
We geven ondersteuning waar nodig om je te laten groeien in je werk.
Je ambities worden gehoord en daar acteren we dan ook op.
Reizen is geen doel op zich, we werken zo flexibel mogelijk.
Work-life balance is voor ons belangrijk.




Kom VisionBI ontdekken en versterken, solliciteer vandaag nog.




We maken graag kennis! Face to face of via Teams. Wat vind jij fijn?

Show more
HTML:
Als AI & ML Engineer bij VisionBI houd je je bezig met het ontwikkelen van innovatieve en state-of-the-art oplossingen op het gebied van Artificial Intelligence en Machine Learning. Je werkt binnen het Microsoft ecosysteem en bent bedreven in technologieën zoals Azure OpenAI, Large Language Models (LLM), Python en PyTorch. Generative AI en andere geavanceerde AI-technieken behoren tot jouw gereedschapskist.


Je bent nieuwsgierig en analytisch en weet complexe AI-oplossingen te vertalen naar praktische toepassingen voor onze klanten. Samen met hen werk je aan de meest efficiënte en effectieve oplossingen, waarbij je rekening houdt met zowel de technische als de zakelijke kant. Je begrijpt het belang van goede communicatie en samenwerking binnen een team en werkt veelal Agile/Scrum om samen met jouw team tot de juiste oplossing te komen. Dagelijkse stand-ups en teamoverleg zijn voor jou vanzelfsprekend.


De ideale werkweek betekent voor jou dat je gemiddeld twee dagen op de klantlocatie werkt en de resterende dagen desgewenst vanuit ons kantoor in De Meern of gewoon remote. Ook al zien we elkaar niet elke dag, het VisionBI team staat altijd voor je klaar!


Dit ga je nog meer doen: Naast dat je als AI & ML Engineer werkt aan uiteenlopende projecten voor VisionBI klanten, volg je de nieuwste ontwikkelingen op het gebied van AI en Machine Learning op de voet. Je hebt een passie voor het ontwikkelen en trainen van AI-modellen en bent bedreven in het implementeren van geavanceerde algoritmes en dataverwerkingspipelines. Je werkt met cutting-edge technologieën zoals LLM’s, transformer-based modellen en generatieve AI om innovatieve oplossingen te realiseren. Daarnaast werk je samen met data engineers en software ontwikkelaars om robuuste en schaalbare AI-oplossingen te bouwen die direct impact hebben op de business.


Wat je meebrengt: Het liefst heb je een op AI, Data Science of Informatica gerichte HBO of WO opleiding afgerond. Na het afronden van jouw opleiding heb je reeds meer da 2 jaar relevante werkervaring. Stap je net de universiteit buiten, laat je dan niet afschrikken en geef een gil. Ook onze opleidingsmogelijkheden zullen de start van jouw carrière een mooie kick-start geven.


Wat bieden wij jou?

  • Enthousiaste en zeer kundige nieuwe collega’s!
  • Mobiliteitsplan - erop uit.
  • Een telefoonabonnement - hallo wie is daar?
  • Een laptop - in de schoot geworpen.
  • Collectieve pensioenregeling - we worden allemaal ouder.
  • 25 vakantiedagen – even lekker weg.
  • Gave VisionBI-uitjes – overal en nergens.
  • Focus op kennisdeling en verbreding – Je staat toch niet stil?
  • Royale opleidingsmogelijkheden - jouw carrière in de lift.
  • Ruime flexibiliteit waar het gaat om remote werken – lekker nieuwerwets.
  • Mis je nog iets? - Het zou kunnen ;)


Wat vragen wij van jou?

  • Een afgeronde HBO of WO opleiding in een technische richting.
  • Gerichte werkervaring (>2 jaar).
  • Goede zelfkennis, weten wat je kunt en wat je nog wenst te leren.
  • Jouw passie is een combinatie van AI, data én de mens.
  • Analytisch sterk ontwikkelde vaardigheden.
  • Pragmatisch, maar altijd kritisch op kwaliteit.
  • Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse (must) en Engelse taal.
  • Uitstekend ontwikkelde sociale en communicatieve vaardigheden.


Jouw technische vaardigheden:

  • Python – uiteraard.
  • Machine Learning frameworks zoals PyTorch, TensorFlow en Scikit-Learn.
  • Generative AI en Large Language Models (LLM's).
  • Azure OpenAI en andere Azure AI-diensten.
  • Data Engineering skills zoals werken met Databricks, Synapse Analytics en Azure ML.
  • Cloud computing en DevOps (Azure DevOps, CI/CD voor ML-modellen).
  • Kennis van MLOps en model deployment technieken.
  • SQL en NoSQL databases voor AI toepassingen.
  • Andere gerelateerde kennis die je hier niet ziet staan? ….laat het ons weten!


Waarom VisionBI?

Dagelijks zorgen we ervoor dat onze klanten beschikken over slimme en innovatieve AI-oplossingen. Wij houden ervan om vernieuwend en vooruitstrevend te zijn. We zoeken altijd de uitdaging op, en dat geldt natuurlijk ook voor jou. Kom jij met nieuwe ideeën om ons en jezelf verder te laten groeien? Wil je écht iets anders? Dan is VisionBI de plek voor jou om te werken.

Daarnaast brengen we je ook helemaal up to speed met maandelijkse kennissessies via ons Center of Excellence.


Onze manier van werken:

  • We bieden iedereen een persoonlijk opleidingsplan.
  • We geven ondersteuning waar nodig om je te laten groeien in je werk.
  • Je ambities worden gehoord en daar acteren we dan ook op.
  • Reizen is geen doel op zich, we werken zo flexibel mogelijk.
  • Work-life balance is voor ons belangrijk.


Kom VisionBI ontdekken en versterken, solliciteer vandaag nog.


We maken graag kennis! Face to face of via Teams. Wat vind jij fijn?

Title: AI & ML Engineer
Description:
Are you an AI & ML Engineer who thrives on building intelligent systems and developing cutting-edge machine learning models?




This is your chance to join an innovative organization where your expertise will shape the future of AI-driven solutions! You’ll have the freedom to experiment, deploy, and optimize models while working alongside top-tier engineers and business leaders.







What You’ll Be Doing:




Designing and implementing machine learning models and AI algorithms.
Developing scalable, production-ready AI/ML solutions.
Working with large datasets to build predictive analytics and automation.
Optimizing model performance, deployment, and monitoring in real-world applications.




Essential Skills:




✅ 3+ years of experience in AI & ML Engineering

✅ Strong proficiency in Python

✅ Strong proficiency in frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn

✅ Experience with data pipelines and MLOps

✅ Cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP)

✅ Proven ability to develop and deploy ML models at scale

✅ Professional proficiency in Dutch (native not required)




Bonus Skills:




Knowledge of NLP, Computer Vision, or Generative AI.
Experience with Big Data technologies (Spark, Hadoop, or Kafka).







Flexible working: Hybrid setup – 2 days in-office, the rest remote!




Fantastic opportunities for career growth in a booming industry.




Work on high-impact AI projects with real-world applications.




Don’t miss this opportunity! Apply now to be at the forefront of AI & ML innovation.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Are you a Machine Learning Engineer who thrives on designing and deploying scalable ML solutions?




This is your opportunity to join an innovative organization where your expertise will drive data-driven decision-making and business success! You’ll work with cutting-edge technologies, build robust ML pipelines, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to transform data into actionable insights.







What You’ll Be Doing:




Developing and maintaining data pipelines using Python and tools like Apache Airflow and Kafka.
Building, training, and deploying machine learning models for production environments.
Conducting software testing and ensuring the reliability of ML solutions.
Managing relational and NoSQL databases for efficient data storage and querying.
Implementing CI/CD pipelines and using Docker/Kubernetes for deployment.
Utilizing cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud) for infrastructure management.
Documenting workflows and best practices for data engineering and ML processes.




Essential Skills:




✅ 5+ years of experience in data engineering and machine learning roles

✅ Strong proficiency in Python

✅ Experience with Pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Airflow, and Kafka

✅ Cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP)

✅ Strong understanding of Agile, Scrum, and DevOps methodologies

✅ Experience with CI/CD pipeline management and Docker/Kubernetes




Bonus Skills:




Knowledge of simulations, optimization algorithms
Knowledge of real-time data streaming.







Flexible working: Hybrid setup – 2 days in-office, the rest remote!




Work on high-impact ML projects with real-world applications.




Don’t miss this opportunity! Apply now to be at the forefront of AI & ML innovation.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you passionate about constructing AI systems that unlock predictive insights at an unprecedented scale? Can you design and implement solutions using cutting-edge LLM and deep learning technologies? Don't hesitate—apply now!

In a nutshell


Hop on a journey with an exciting fast-growing SaaS company in an international environment (steep learning curve is guaranteed).
Secure an impactful role with lots of growth potential for yourself.
Spearhead innovative initiatives on the intersection of AI/ML and NLP.
Develop scalable and accurate AI models that deliver predictive insights beyond human capacity.
Join a team of diverse and passionate people with a culture that empowers great work (15 ninjas & 10 nationalities).
Enjoy a lot of perks: Flexible working hours & unlimited holiday policy, attractive office in Amsterdam, visa sponsorship, mentorship program, own laptop & home equipment, team events & games... (and more!).



🧑‍💻 What are we doing?

At Kaizo, we're not just building a platform - we're creating a dynamic ecosystem that actively guides employees to achieve their goals and make a lasting impact on their organizations. Our focus is on revolutionizing the daily work experience for customer support teams through a performance development and compliance platform that combines cutting-edge AI technologies with gamification.


AI-Powered Engagement: We're leveraging cutting-edge AI technologies to improve operational efficiency, enhance team performance, and provide unparalleled performance visibility. Our goal is to make the daily work experience more engaging, fun, and productive for customer support agents, quality assurance professionals, and team leaders.
Stream Processing Excellence: Built on a microservices-based stream processing platform, we process over 200 million events per day using cutting-edge technologies such as Akka Streams and Kafka. Our services, deployed on Kubernetes in Google Cloud, seamlessly feed data into ElasticSearch, MongoDB, and Google BigQuery.
Developing the Future: Our team is at the forefront of developing AI systems that are not only scalable, affordable, and interpretable but also flexible and empowering. We're pursuing real-time solutions that redefine the way compliance monitoring is done.
Our journey is not without its challenges, and we embrace them as opportunities for innovation:
Scalability Quest: Processing approximately 10 tickets per second requires solutions with lightning-fast inference speeds. We're working on LLMs that match GPT's accuracy but operate at an unparalleled speed.
Cost Efficiency Mandate: Dealing with large ticket volumes requires economically feasible solutions that do not scale linearly in terms of cost with the expected volume. We're on a mission to optimize efficiency and resource utilization.
Accuracy Triumph: Our compliance engine aims for maximum accuracy while maintaining a conservative approach to predictions.
Data Privacy Conundrum: The presence of sensitive PII in our customers' data adds a layer of complexity. We're addressing the challenge of fine-tuning models on raw data while upholding the highest standards of data privacy and security.
Data Diversity Voyage: Dealing with diverse data formats, from text and raw speech to metadata and tabular data, presents its own set of challenges. We navigate this diversity to ensure our solutions are adaptable and comprehensive.



🗓️ What are your 12 labours here?

As a Data Scientist, you will help us implement new features into our product by building and deploying production-grade models that leverage state-of-the-art technologies. Your primary focus will be on developing high quality prediction models that can be integrated with our services, performing statistical analysis, designing scalable AI systems using innovative architecture.

🤖 You will focus on


NLP and NLG using state-of-the-art methods
Improving and extending the features used by our existing systems
Processing, cleaning, and aggregating data used for analysis
Performing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner
Creating automated systems and tracking their performance
Building and optimising prediction systems using open source and proprietary LLMs
Collaborating with other team-members within the company to drive product development
Communicating results and ideas to key decision makers
Experimenting with different tools and technologies, and evaluate new data science approaches for the business



🧑‍💻 What you bring to the table?


3+ years industry experience
Experience in prototyping and deploying at least one data science project to a production environment
Experience with common data science toolkits, such as Pandas, Numpy, Matplotlib, Scikit-learn and Jupyter Notebooks
Experience with one of the following: Tensorflow, PyTorch, or any other deep learning/machine learning framework
Experience with data visualisation tools, such as Dash, Seaborn, D3, etc
Good applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.
Good scripting and programming skills using Python
Familiarity with MLOps is a plus.
Experience in using one or more of the following tools and technologies is a plus: Google Cloud Platform, Github, Docker, Kubernetes, MongoDB, ElasticSearch
Data-oriented personality
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques
Being part of an early stage startup, we sometimes need you to wear multiple hats just to keep things going, hence being a team player is a must have.



🏆 What’s in it for you?


An office right in the heart of Amsterdam, complemented by the flexibility of hybrid working
Visa sponsorship available for eligible candidates
Great office gear: MacBook, tools, desks, chair — there’s something for everyone
The freedom of a flexible working schedule
Fun workations & open holiday policy
Show more

Title: Graduate Software Engineer
Description:
About Us

We are a proprietary trading firm based in Amsterdam, focused on dynamic and fast-paced Energy markets. As a firm, we operate without external clients, allowing us to create and refine in-house tools that streamline and enhance our trading operations. We value innovation, autonomy, and a passion for development.




About you

We are looking for a recent graduate with a strong foundation in software development and a keen interest in the trading or financial industry. You’re eager to take on new challenges, work independently, and apply your skills to deliver quality solutions. You have a good understanding of both back-end and front-end development, with a focus on writing reliable code and creating functional, user-friendly interfaces for in-house use. You’re excited to grow in a fast-paced environment and contribute to solving real-world problems in the financial space.




Responsibilities

In this role, you’ll be part of a team working on designing, building, and improving software tools that help with real-time data analysis and automate tasks for traders. You’ll dive deep into prototyping and deploying solutions quickly, contributing to both back-end logic and basic front-end interfaces. You’ll work directly with traders to understand their needs and help improve tools to support their work, implementing changes and making adjustments to fit evolving strategies.




Requirements

Experience with industry-standard coding languages such as C++, Python, or Java.
Strong understanding of underlying computer architectures, algorithms, memory and concurrency models, operating systems, and databases.
Comfortable in Windows environments.
Experience in gathering business requirements, communication with stakeholders is a key requirement in this role.
Hands-on mentality, we have a culture of ownership taking of the work we do at OTC Flow.
Strong communication skills and a strong eagerness to achieve high results through collaboration with colleagues.




What we offer

Vibrant work environment: Join a highly driven, young, and international team that values collaboration and energy.
Support for growth and innovation: Thrive in an innovation-driven workplace in the heart of Amsterdam, where we actively invest in and support employee ideas, turning them into real opportunities.
Holidays: Enjoy 25 vacation days annually.
Competitive compensation: Receive an attractive remuneration package, including bonuses.
Covered commute costs: Benefit from covered commute expenses, including public transport reimbursements, a Swap-bicycle plan, mileage allowance, or free parking.
Daily Perks: well-stocked fridges and cabinets full of snacks and drinks available throughout the day and healthy team lunches prepared by our in-house chef.
Exciting team activities: Participate in monthly (sports)-events, (inter)-national company trips, and various social activities with your department and the wider Amsterdam team.
Recognition and rewards: We celebrate milestones with company awards, anniversary celebrations, and generous referral bonuses for bringing talented colleagues on board.
Purpose-driven impact: Be part of a team making a real difference in the environmental sector through projects that create positive, sustainable change.




What's next

If we have just described your profile, don't miss out on this opportunity.




The recruitment process is as follows*:

Submit your application with your CV and cover letter (optionally);
We will get to know you better through a pre-screening interview with our corporate recruiter;
We will invite you to take an assignment and meet the hiring team for 1-2 interviews.




*Please note that sometimes there are slight changes to this process.




We believe in the strength of our diverse team and are committed to creating an inclusive workplace where everyone can grow – together as a company, in teams, and as individuals. That's why we carefully consider all job applicants, fostering a culture that embraces everyone.

Show more

Title: Data Science Intern
Description:
About The Job

Do you love working with data and contributing to technological innovation? Are you a motivated and enthusiastic student with a passion for data science, food sciences, or chemical engineering? Then apply now and join us as our new Data Science Intern in our Utrecht office starting June 2025!

About The Job

As our new Data Science Intern, you will be part of our enthusiastic and diverse Data and Modelling team who help with technological innovation using data-driven decision-making within Danone’s One Planet One Health vision. Your key role will be to contribute to our model portfolio for filtration and hydrolysate processes. During this internship, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams and support various initiatives. Your main responsibilities include


Collect and organize data from various sources (pdf, csv) to create a structured database.
Conduct root cause analysis to identify factors contributing to filter fouling.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to uncover insights and trends.
Engage in feature engineering, modelling, validation, and report writing.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and validate models.
Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders.
Summarize results in a comprehensive report.


About you

As a Data Science Intern, data analysis and modelling will be second nature to you. You can collect and organize data, conduct root cause analysis, and perform exploratory data analysis. On top of that? You’re a proactive and creative individual who’s always looking for opportunities to learn and develop.

There are also some compulsory requirements


You are enrolled at a Dutch university for the whole duration of the internship (if you are a non-EU citizen, you must be enrolled in a Dutch university to be eligible for this internship).
You are fluent in English—both verbal and written.
You have knowledge of batch processes, filtration, and hydrolysis.
You are proficient in SQL and Python.
You are available to start from June 2025 for a minimum of 6 months, 5 days a week.
You are willing to travel to Utrecht, The Netherlands.


About us

Working at Danone is a unique experience. It’s fast-paced and complex and, at times, it can get a little challenging. But it’s packed with opportunities to learn and grow working with some of the best-known brands in the world, like Evian, Alpro, Nutricia, Activia, and Nutrilon. Bring your unique perspective, ambitions, and entrepreneurial ideas to the table – the impact you could make might just surprise you. One Planet. One Health – BY YOU.

We’re proud to be a B-Corp certified company. That means we meet the highest verified standards of social and environmental performance, transparency, and accountability in everything we do. We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. As an Equal Opportunities Employer, we base our hiring decisions on merit, job requirements, and business needs.

We Offer

As a Modelling Intern, you will learn extensively and have the opportunity to work alongside professionals in the field. And the best part? You’ll be supported from beginning to end by your supervisor and will have the chance to contribute to meaningful projects. Together, we’ll build a healthier world.

We offer a gross monthly internship allowance of 650 euros per month and a home working allowance/contribution towards travel. Please do keep in mind that we do not offer relocation and/or accommodation benefits for students coming from abroad.

In the Netherlands, we also offer a hybrid working environment which enables each team to meet our people's desire for flexibility. Across our 3 office hubs in Hoofddorp, Rijswijk, and Utrecht, this helps us create better opportunities for connection & synergies across our entities, teams, functions, and categories.

What’s Next

It’s simple – hit the “apply” button. In order to comply with GDPR, we can’t process your personal data without your given consent, so please apply directly via this website. Good luck! We can’t wait to meet you. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.

It’s simple – hit the “apply” button. In order to comply with GDPR, we can’t process your personal data without your given consent, so please apply directly via this website. Good luck! Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Checkout.com is one of the most exciting fintechs in the world. Our mission is to enable businesses and their communities to thrive in the digital economy. We’re the strategic payments partner for some of the best known fast-moving brands globally such as Wise, Hut Group, Sony Electronics, Homebase, Henkel, Klarna and many others. Purpose-built with performance and scalability in mind, our flexible cloud-based payments platform helps global enterprises launch new products and create experiences customers love. And it's not just what we build that makes us different. It's how.

We empower passionate problem-solvers to collaborate, innovate and do their best work. That’s why we’re number 9 on the Forbes Cloud 100 list and on Glassdoor’s list of Top 10 fintechs to work for. And we’re just getting started. We’re building diverse and inclusive teams around the world — because that’s how we create even better experiences for our merchants and our partners. And we need your help. So, join us to build tomorrow, today.

Job Description

As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer at Checkout.com in the ML Platform team, you will play a key role in the early design and development of our machine learning platform. You will contribute to the establishment of standards & architecture and collaborate with an ambitious group of engineers to increase the maturity level of our platform.

The solutions that you will be building will power our stack of value added services in the Payments Performance area. We’re a growing team in an expanding area within the company and we’re looking for individuals who have strong ownership, are passionate about productionising ML and have a pragmatic approach to converting big problems into smaller iterations to constantly deliver value.

How you’ll make an impact:


Develop and deliver solutions used across products such as Fraud Detection and Payment Optimization
Build systems for training, deploying and monitoring machine learning models used in real-time inference
Scale our feature store to more and increasingly complex use-cases both online and offline
Contribute to technical and architectural decisions that increase the maturity level of the platform
Actively promote critical thinking, to challenge and improve our systems and processes by leveraging past experience


Qualifications


Production experience with building and operating high-volume ML systems, including low-latency model and feature serving
Experience with monitoring and observability of production ML systems, with a strong sense of ownership
Proficiency in Cloud-based application development (we use AWS)
Experience with one or more of these technologies: Spark, Databricks, SageMaker, Vertex AI, Kubeflow, Seldon
Versed in writing clear, production-ready Python code
Solid understanding of theoretical aspects of machine learning
Growth mindset, always on the lookout for stretch challenges
Excellent communication skills, ability to interact effectively with multidisciplinary teams
Experience dealing with data from complex domains (FinTech, Fraud Detection or Payments Processing are a significant plus)


Additional Information

Apply without meeting all requirements statement

If you don't meet all the requirements but think you might still be right for the role, please apply anyway. We're always keen to speak to people who connect with our mission and values.

We believe in equal opportunities

We work as one team. Wherever you come from. However you identify. And whichever payment method you use.

Our clients come from all over the world — and so do we. Hiring hard-working people and giving them a community to thrive in is critical to our success.

When you join our team, we’ll empower you to unlock your potential so you can do your best work. We’d love to hear how you think you could make a difference here with us.

We want to set you up for success and make our process as accessible as possible. So let us know in your application, or tell your recruiter directly, if you need anything to make your experience or working environment more comfortable. We’ll be happy to support you.

Take a peek inside life at Checkout.com via


Our Culture video https://youtu.be/BEwnpHuadSw
Our careers page https://www.checkout.com/careers
Our LinkedIn Life pages bit.ly/3OaoN1U
Our Instagram https://www.instagram.com/checkout_com/

Title: Medior ML engineer / Data Scientist
Description:
people at the heart of everything we do

Working at Randstad is unlike working at any organization. Because at Randstad we put people at the heart of everything we do. This goes for our clients, our talent, our employees and society. We combine our passion for people with the power of today’s technologies. This helps us support people and organizations in realizing their true potential. Learn more about our mission, history and values on our website: www.randstad.com




how you will contribute

As a Machine Learning Engineer / Data Scientist you will create brand new insights into the global world of work. We use the latest ML and AI techniques to deliver highly accurate models for supporting a variety of business applications and processes, including market demand, talent supply, career patterns, salaries and rates, and pricing.

The focus in this role will be working on our global taxonomy program, that is supporting our systems landscape worldwide. In this program we are creating and maintaining information on all kinds of vital elementary data concepts, such as jobs, occupations, skills, certificates, education and more. We are using the latest ML technology and LLMs to create our models, and present the results via ML pipelines with a balanced set of microservices.

You will be a part of an international and agile team of highly skilled specialists, including data scientists, ML engineers, data engineers, and data analysts. We have a major research background and are publishing some of our greatest work in academic papers.

You will work closely with other colleagues within the Randstad ecosystem, especially in the various global projects. The impact of your work depends not only on the quality of your products, but especially on your ability to communicate the value and proof of concept of your models and analyses.




what you will be doing

building Machine Learning (ML) models: preparing data from a wide variety of internal and external data sources; creating and evaluating ML models, primarily in the NLP domain, based a.o. on open source LLMs and GenAI;

● building ML pipelines that automate the training and deployment of models

● defining and appropriating work to the product backlog

● training and coaching junior team members

● collaborating within the data science community within the Randstad ecosystem, on sharing best practices, harmonizing ML models, and grow collective data science skills




who will you work with

Our global data science team helps our customers make better hiring decisions and helps talent advance in their career paths. We help people find work by creating new insights into the dynamics of the global labor market and integrate those insights into customer- and talent-focused data products. We build and deploy machine learning models and tell stories with those insights. As an example - we create clarity where there are gaps in diversity, what a talent's next job might be, how market conditions should influence a hiring strategy, where we predict demand will go, and much more.




what you will bring

● Masters degree in Computer science / Data Science, or related technical studies (M.Sc. or equivalent experience)

● min. 2 to 3 years work experience as a ML engineer or data scientist with strong engineering skills

● machine learning (ML) platform: excellent working knowledge of analytical, AI and ML stacks on cloud platforms, preferably on Google Cloud Platform (incl. BigQuery, AI & ML stack) or comparable platforms

● coding: high proficiency in Python (incl. relevant libraries and packages) and SQL

● ML engineering: experience with the creation of ML pipelines and ML Ops related techniques

● ML modeling: relevant experience with NLP, LLMs, and working with the set of tools needed to build models on large and complex datasets (preferably in applied and research setting)




what’s in it for you

We put people at the heart of everything we do. Our employment conditions reflect this;

● competitive salary

● an additional flexible benefit budget

● attractive bonus scheme

● option to take part in Randstad's success through our employee Share Purchase Plan

● option to go on a sabbatical leave or buy extra holidays

● flexible working hours in the office or hybrid]

● attractive mobility arrangements

● opportunity to give back to local communities through paid volunteering leave

● a generous budget to set up your home office space and a net internet allowance]

● growth and development opportunities in a fast changing global environment

● working with great people and being part of a network where everyone wants you to succeed

● an environment where differences are understood, valued and celebrated




We want our teams and talent to reflect the rich diversity of the societies we serve. We thrive for an environment of belonging, safety and confidence. So everyone can bring their whole selves to work and flourish. Learn more about equity, diversity, inclusion and belonging at randstad here.




If you recognize yourself in the profile above, we invite you to apply for this role.

For more information you can reach out to our recruitment business partner Jenny Roberts .

The recruitment procedure consists of a screening and at least two interviews. Later in the process, an (online) assessment and a job offer conversation take place

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist

Location: Groningen

About XPAR Vision

An ice-cold beer or a fine glass of wine every now and then – we’re all for it! But have you ever thought about how a glass bottle is made? We do, every single day. At XPAR Vision, we are dedicated to optimizing the production process of glass bottles and jars for clients in the global glass packaging industry. XPAR Vision develops, installs, and implements cutting-edge sensor and robot technology, enabling glass manufacturers—such as those producing for Heineken and Coca-Cola— to produce more good bottles with less energy/materials/people skills. With over 600 systems installed in more than 35 countries, we are the specialist and market leader in our field. We firmly believe that glass is the best packaging material in terms of experience, quality, health, and, most importantly, sustainability. Our mission is to encourage more food and beverage manufacturers to choose glass, directly contributing to a greener future by reducing the carbon footprint and minimizing the impact on our environment.

XPAR Vision is the global leader in advanced monitoring, control, and optimization solutions for the glass manufacturing industry. To make our systems smarter and more autonomous so they can support our customers—operators and specialists in the factory—by, for example, automatically generating recommendations for adjusting the production process, we are looking for a new colleague for the role of Data Scientist.




What will you do?

You will work in a multidisciplinary team of developers on innovative products.

As a Data Scientist, your main tasks will include:

Analyzing and exploring correlations in data streams from our systems and external sources. Examples include (infrared) images, temperatures, timing information from production machines, the number and types of detected defects, etc.
Developing mathematical models based on fundamental (physical) knowledge and available empirical knowledge of the production process.
Collecting (labeled) datasets and contributing to the development of tools/methods for this purpose.
Applying and developing Machine Learning / AI techniques to fully automate an increasing number of intelligent decisions regarding the production process or the adjustment of equipment, reducing the reliance on operators.




What do we ask?

A completed HBO+/WO degree in Data Science or a related technical field. We welcome recent graduates to apply.
Experience or affinity with Machine Learning / Artificial Intelligence, including tools such as scripting languages (Python) and databases (MySQL, GraphQL).
Affinity with process industries.
Residency in (or near) Groningen, the Netherlands.
Good English language skills.
Strong communication skills, an entrepreneurial mindset, and a result- and customer-oriented attitude.




What do we offer?

A diverse role in an organization with short communication lines and an informal work atmosphere. This position comes with a competitive salary (€3.600 - €4.800) and excellent secondary benefits, including 30 vacation days per year.

You will become part of an enthusiastic, informal, and driven team of 15+ developers who support each other to achieve the best results and ensure customer satisfaction. You will have the opportunity to further develop and expand your talents by participating in different phases of product development (from research and feasibility studies to the completion and delivery of a final product). You might work with new technologies, take on a project leadership role, or interact more with customers and suppliers.

During the onboarding period, we will introduce you to our products, tools, and techniques. From day one, you will participate in development projects, and soon, you will see your work being used by our customers worldwide.




Want more information?

You can find more about our organization at www.xparvision.com, where you will also find a video demonstrating the implementation and application of XPAR Vision products in the glass industry. Our products can be found at XPAR Vision Products.




Apply now!

Send your motivation letter and CV to hrm@xparvision.com, addressed to Antonella Quaranta. For more information, contact us at +31 (0)6-552 255 04.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We’re building a world-class team to redefine knowledge work with AI

Zeno is a legal AI startup working to change how legal professionals do their work. By combining leading AI technology with deep insights into the legal profession, we automate complex workflows and increase productivity. In just one year, we’ve evolved from a single Proof of Concept to a platform with multiple tools actively used by hundreds of legal professionals.

We’re in the early stages of building something impressive. With our seed funding secured and early market traction validated, we’re growing a team of engineers and thinkers who want to solve real problems and drive innovation and create lasting change in the legal sector.

The Role

As a Data Scientist at Zeno, your mission is to turn raw data into powerful insights that revolutionize how legal professionals search, analyze, and interact with legal information. You’ll work at the intersection of AI, search technology, and data science—uncovering hidden patterns, refining algorithms, and enhancing our search capabilities to deliver the most relevant and precise results.

This is a unique opportunity to work on deeply challenging problems, shape a high-impact product, and push the boundaries of what AI can achieve in the legal field.

What You’ll Work On


Improve retrieval accuracy, ranking, and relevance using AI-driven approaches.
Identify patterns, extract insights, and refine datasets to improve our platform’s intelligence.
Build and test models that enhance search, document classification, and legal data analysis.
Ensure our datasets are clean, structured, and optimized for AI processing.
Work closely with software engineers, data architects, and domain experts to implement solutions that directly impact our users.
Explore new methodologies, tools, and technologies to keep Zeno at the forefront of AI-driven legal tech.


What We’re Looking For


You love working with data, uncovering insights, and optimizing algorithms to drive meaningful results.
You are skilled in Python and have experience working with AI frameworks, search technologies, graph data science, or NLP.
You take ownership, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and aren’t afraid to experiment.
You enjoy working with like-minded engineers, bouncing ideas, and building next-generation AI systems together.


What We Offer


A unique opportunity to work at a startup that is shaping the future of legal tech.
The ability to make a direct and tangible impact on the development and growth of our platform.
An inspiring place to work in an office located at the heart of Rotterdam.
Collaboration with a top-tier team of engineers, researchers, and entrepreneurs.
Competitive compensation, including growth and equity opportunities within the company.


Let’s shape the future of legal work together
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
Data Engineer


De functie


Bouw jij mee aan slimme data-oplossingen voor de publieke sector? Bij Van Dam Datapartners ontwikkelen we datagedreven oplossingen voor overheidsinstanties, zorginstellingen en kinderopvangorganisaties. We zoeken een Data Engineer die niet alleen technisch sterk is, maar ook snapt hoe data maatschappelijke impact kan maken.


Wat ga je doen?


  • Je ontwikkelt en onderhoudt ETL-processen en databronnen die overheden helpen betere beslissingen te nemen.
  • Je zorgt ervoor dat dashboards en rapportages in Power BI, Tableau, Qlik of Cognos betrouwbaar en up-to-date zijn.
  • Je werkt nauw samen met klanten en collega’s om data-architecturen te optimaliseren.
  • Je vertaalt complexe datastromen naar heldere structuren die gebruikers écht helpen.

Wie ben jij?


  • Je hebt minimaal 1 jaar ervaring binnen het publieke domein.
  • Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring met BI-tools en databewerking.
  • Kennis van SQL, Python of een andere programmeertaal.
  • Je kunt technische vraagstukken begrijpelijk uitleggen aan niet-techneuten.
  • Je voelt je thuis in een commercieel bedrijf, maar haalt voldoening uit projecten met maatschappelijke waarde.


Wat bieden wij jou?


  • Een marktconform salaris (€ 3.750 – €5.500 bruto per maand op basis van 40 uur per week), afhankelijk van jouw werkervaring;
  • 8% vakantiegeld;
  • NS-Business Card of reiskostenvergoeding (€ 0,23 per km);
  • Een laptop en telefoon;
  • 25 vakantiedagen;
  • De mogelijkheid om (maximaal 5) dagen bij te kopen of te verkopen;
  • Pensioenregeling bij Nationale Nederlanden;
  • Een thuiswerkvergoeding van € 2,40 per dag en de mogelijkheid om een thuiswerkplek in te richten;
  • Toegang tot de Academy en de mogelijkheid om een persoonlijk opleidingsprogramma samen te stellen. Volop ruimte voor groei en specialisatie.


Heb je nog vragen, dan mag je altijd contact met ons opnemen via werkenbij@vandamdatapartners.nl.

Title: Data Scientist - Global Finance
Description:
At a glance

ABN AMRO Clearing N.V. (AACB) is looking for a data scientist to join our new RegTech (Regulatory Technology) team within our core Data Science team. This new team of data scientists will focus exclusively on developing data science solutions for regulatory reporting. Do you want to work in a data science team that operates within the financial markets and the clearing industry in an international environment? With our global network of offices in ten countries and close connections to all major exchanges, you'll have the chance to work with leading trading firms across four continents.

Your job

RegTech is a fast-evolving field in the financial industry in which AACB wants to increasingly utilize data science capabilities to meet both our internal and external regulatory standards. This role offers a unique opportunity to be part of a new team and develop solutions in collaboration with professionals from different domains, such as engineering, legal, compliance, regulatory, and finance, within a diverse and multicultural environment. With 6.1 billion transactions cleared annually and peak volumes reaching up to 51 million transactions per day, AACB generates a substantial amount of data. The aim is to develop state-of-the-art technology that is scalable for both data volume and application purposes, supported by our existing infrastructure.

Key responsibilities:


Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand regulatory requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions.
Develop, implement, and maintain ML models to enhance regulatory compliance and reporting.
Implement MLOps best practices, including CI/CD pipelines and model versioning, while developing monitoring frameworks to detect bias, drift, and data corruption in production models.
Continuously optimize models to improve accuracy, efficiency, and scalability.
Monitor model performance and accuracy, and make necessary adjustments to optimize outcomes.
Introduce GenAI/LLM tools to support the RegTech vision.
Translate regulatory guidelines (EMIR, MIFID, and SFTR) into data science solutions while keeping up to date with data science developments in the regulatory space. AACB has the network and skills to support you in this endeavour.
Analyse large datasets and apply statistical techniques to extract meaningful insights that inform strategic decision-making related to regulatory compliance.
Document methodologies, processes, and results in a clear and comprehensive manner.
Communicate data concepts and insights to non-technical stakeholders effectively.



Positioning in the organization

You'll be joining a vibrant group of people in the Global Finance Data Science team in Amsterdam. Reporting to the Global CFO, you'll collaborate closely with regional finance teams and other departments, bringing fresh perspectives and energy to our innovative projects. Join us and be part of a team where your ideas can truly make an impact!

Working environment

ABN AMRO Clearing is recognised as a global leading provider of integrated solutions in clearing, execution, custody, financing and risk management. With 10 offices globally, we are able to service clients on 160+ exchanges, MTFs and FX liquidity centres, processing over 20 million trades daily. ABN AMRO Clearing consistently ranks amongst the top 3 clearing firms on most relevant derivatives exchanges globally and enjoys market share of 20% or higher for many of the major exchanges on which it operates. Our service is tailored to the needs of Principal Trading groups, Brokers, Financial Institutions, Corporates active in the physical commodity value chain and of Hedge Funds that apply strategies in multiple asset classes based on CTA/Managed Futures, Relative Value Volatility Arbitrage, and Long/Short positions including Synthetics.

Your profile

We are looking for the following criteria:


MSc or PhD in a STEM field e.g. Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, etc.
At least 2+ years of hands-on experience in developing and deploying production-ready data science solutions.
Proficiency programming in Python, experience with Git (preferably Bitbucket) and SQL/PySpark.
Solid theoretical understanding of machine learning techniques and statistics, with the ability to clearly explain data science concepts and ML models to business stakeholders.
Experience with productionizing ML models according MLOps principles (data drift, monitoring etc.).
Curiosity and motivation to work in the financial markets.
Knowledge about regulatory frameworks such as EMIR, MIFID and SFTR is a plus.
Experience and/or theoretical knowledge about LLMs (agents, RAGs, LLMOps, etc.) to solve business problems is a plus.
Fluent speaking and writing in English.
Authorized to work in the Netherlands.



We are offering

You will be able to gain a lot of knowledge of the financial industry and products and further develop your data science skills. We offer you excellent terms of employment and benefits:


A good monthly salary.
An additional benefit budget of 11%, with which you can buy flexible terms of employment.
25 holidays with the option to purchase extra days through the benefit budget.
A personal development budget of € 1,000 per year.
An annual public transport ticket for unlimited travel.
A good pension scheme.
A position that offers a lot of opportunities for professional development.
The ability to work flexibly (3 days at the Amsterdam Office)
Interesting work and challenging projects in a diverse and international environment.



interested?

Does this sound like something you’d be interested in? Send us your application as soon as possible.

Equal opportunities for all

The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.

Disclaimer external recruitment agencies

External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. No unsolicited services or offers, please.

Title: AI Engineer
HTML:
Ben jij een ervaren developer die een passie heeft voor AI? Solliciteer direct!

Join the journey

Wat ga je doen?

Als AI Engineer bij HSO ben je verantwoordelijk voor het implementeren van AI-modellen in bedrijfsprocessen en- applicaties bij onze klanten. Je bent een technische expert met een scherp oog voor detail en een diepgaande kennis/passie van AI. Verder houdt de AI Engineer zich bezig met het:   

  • Ontwikkelen van prompt flows en integraties met systemen binnen de klantomgeving;
  • Samenwerken met het team en de klant om technische specificaties te definiëren en te documenteren;  
  • Testen en valideren van de geïmplementeerde modellen.


Over het team

In het gedreven en gezellige Data & AI team werk je samen met zo'n 50 consultants die uitblinken in Data Engineering, Data Analytics, AI en UX. Om je kennis te verbreden zijn er maandelijkse team meetings, expert sessies en is er alle ruimte voor het volgen van trainingen, conferenties en workshops.

Requirements

Wat breng jij mee?

  • Ruime ervaring in Machine Learning Engineering/AI Engineering;
  • Diepgaande kennis van python en/of C#;
  • Ervaring met prompt engineering & prompt flows in Large Language Models (LLM);
  • Jij kunt overweg met API's en SDKs om AI solutions effectief in te zetten (image processing, video processing, NLP processing, etc.);
  • Kennis en ervaring met Azure AI, ML Studio, Databricks en/of het OpenAI portfolio;
  • Een passie voor AI, je houdt actief je kennis bij en volgt ontwikkelingen in het veld;
  • Jij bent in staat om verantwoorde AI principes te begrijpen en toe te passen;
  • Uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal, zowel in woord als geschrift.


Benefits

Wat bieden we jou? 

Werken bij HSO is uitdagend, we willen je daar graag een goede beloning voor teruggeven. Naast goede primaire voordelen bieden wij: 

  • Een competitief salaris, een jaarlijkse bonus op basis van bedrijfs-, team- en individuele prestaties en een vast contract;
  • Mobiliteitsvergoeding waarbij je of een auto kunt leasen of het bedrag toe kunt voegen aan je salaris. Daar bovenop krijg je 100% betaald van de ov-kosten;
  • 25 vakantiedagen met de mogelijkheid om er 35 van te maken; 
  • Hybride werken, vanuit huis, op kantoor (Rotterdam, Veenendaal) of zelfs tijdens je Workation; 
  • EUR 65,- netto vitaliteitsbudget - we vinden het belangrijk dat we gezond blijven en een veilige werkplek hebben, zowel op kantoor als remote; 
  • Je kunt deelnemen aan het leasefietsplan; 
  • En vooral een leven lang leren. Op dag één start jouw onboardingprogramma, daarnaast krijg je een persoonlijk studiebudget dat je kunt inzetten voor jouw professionele ontwikkeling en ontvang je ook een GoodHabitz account, een online trainingstool voor je persoonlijke ontwikkeling.  


Vrijheid, flexibiliteit en fun

Je werkt in een internationale omgeving met professionals met verschillende nationaliteiten. Een flexibele werkweek van 40, 36 of 32 uur behoort tot de mogelijkheden omdat wij van mening zijn dat jouw manier van werken bij jouw levensstijl moet passen. HSO heeft professionals in dienst die plezier hebben in hun werk en klaar staan voor elkaar. Om het plezier in ons werk nog groter te maken, organiseren we uiteraard teamuitjes en bedrijfsfeesten, maar ook wekelijkse zomerborrels op ons dakterras, allerlei sportactiviteiten en is er de mogelijkheid bij te dragen aan onze Maatschappelijk Verantwoord Ondernemen-werkzaamheden.

Over HSO  

HSO is de eerste full-service Microsoft Partner in Nederland. Samen met ruim 2500 getalenteerde medewerkers in Europa, Azië en Noord-Amerika verlenen we ondersteuning op lokaal en internationaal niveau aan industriële bedrijven, retailers, financiële en zakelijke dienstverleners en overheidsinstellingen. 

 

HSO is voortdurend op zoek naar nieuw talent. We blijven onze wereldwijde community uitbreiden en scheppen er plezier in om samen te werken met prestatiegerichte mensen met een ondernemersgeest. Professionals die voortdurend willen leren en innoveren. 

Solliciteren   

Enthousiast? Heb je vragen vooraf?  

Neem contact op met Micha Visser (Recruitment Business Partner) op mvisser@hso.com

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Job Title: Python Developer

Location: Amsterdam, NL

B2B Contract




Role Description:

Making sure that the team knows which standards to adhere to and guard this during development
Understand the agile startup methodology and comfortable to work this way
Optimize the use of Python frameworks
Ensure sufficient up to date documentation
Be able to contribute to software architecture and technical designs
Enable and implement continuous delivery (Jenkins/ArgoCD/Azure DevOps/GitHub Actions)
Prevent technical debt




Essential Skills:

Must have experience with the cycle of building and releasing software solutions from development all the way to production in a DevOps way of working.
This person knows about industry standards, architecture, clean code and is skilled with supporting team members to realize the desired results.




Desirable Skills:

Solid communication and collaboration skills in English
Fluency in Dutch is a plus
Experience with the Azure Data Stack (and/or Databricks or similar)
