Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
My Client within the AI Powered Legal-Tech space located in Amsterdam are in search of an AI Software engineer who can successfully implement Generative AI into their Backend focused code-base.




Key Responsibilities:

Integrate Large Language Models (LLMs) (such as GPT-3, GPT-4, or other transformer-based models) into our backend systems using Node.js.
Collaborate with AI researchers and machine learning engineers to design, build, and scale generative AI and language models that can be deployed in production environments.
Develop efficient backend APIs and services to expose LLM capabilities (text generation, summarization, question-answering, etc.) to frontend applications.
Implement and optimize Generative AI algorithms (e.g., GPT, BERT, T5) to generate high-quality, relevant, and context-aware outputs in real-time.
Ensure scalability and performance optimization of AI-driven backend systems, with an emphasis on reducing latency and computational costs.
Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code following industry best practices for backend development in Node.js.
Contribute to model fine-tuning, ensuring the best performance of LLMs on specific tasks (e.g., customer support, content generation, natural language understanding).







Required Qualifications:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
Proven experience in integrating Generative AI models and Large Language Models (LLMs) into production environments.
Expertise in Node.js and backend development, with a strong understanding of server-side architectures and API design.
Hands-on experience with deep learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hugging Face) for model implementation and fine-tuning.
Strong proficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript and understanding of asynchronous programming and RESTful APIs.
Experience working with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) and containerization tools (Docker, Kubernetes) for deploying AI-driven services.




Salary Package:

Up to €100,000
Flexible Hybrid working
Exciting Scale-up working environment
Travel Reimbursement

Title: Data Analist Assortiment
Description:
Data Analist Assortiment bij Albert Heijn

Zaandam - 40 uur per week

Wil jij graag bepalen welke producten in onze winkels gevoerd worden en jouw werk terugzien op de schappen in meer dan 1.250 winkels? Zie jij jezelf daarbij meewerken aan gave projecten op het snijvlak van commercie en analytics? En ben je op zoek naar een leuk team waar hard werken in combinatie gaat met humor en gezelligheid? Dan is deze baan zeker iets voor jou!




Albert Heijn vult met 125.000 collega’s, verdeeld over ruim 1.250 winkels in Nederland en Vlaanderen, negen home shop centers, zeven distributiecentra en ons hoofdkantoor elke avond ruim zeven miljoen borden.




Jouw nieuwe baan en werkplek.

Als Data Analist Assortiment bij Albert Heijn maak jij impact door te zorgen dat het juiste assortiment op de beste plek in de schappen van onze ruim 1.250 winkels wordt gepresenteerd. Je werkt op het snijvlak van het belang van de klant, commercie en onze winkels. Een uitdagende rol, waarbij je als belangrijke drijver achter grote assortimentsveranderingen nadenkt over hoe we iedere klant optimaal kunnen bedienen, zo veel mogelijk resultaat kunnen behalen én tegelijkertijd zo min mogelijk producten hoeven af te prijzen of weg te gooien. En dit doen we door continue bij te sturen. Dit alles doe je natuurlijk niet alleen: je werkt veel samen met de afdeling Commercie om kansen te presenteren en initiatieven te ontwikkelen en Analytics om onze assortiment modellen te verbeteren. Met jouw focus op ons assortiment, haarscherpe analyses en lef ben je in staat om vernieuwende inzichten te geven, de juiste partijen bij elkaar te brengen én zorg je dat alle doelen op tijd worden gerealiseerd. Je bent hierbij dé sparringpartner van de Category Manager op het gebied van assortiment: je denkt met hem/haar mee en stuurt hierbij op het juiste eindresultaat. Dat komt neer op een ideale mix van een commerciële mindset, de wil om te blijven verbeteren waarbij je een beroep kan doen op jouw skills in projectmanagement en procesbewaking.




In deze functie werk je 40 uur per week, deels vanuit het hoofdkantoor in Zaandam en deels vanuit huis.




Dit ga je als Data Analist Assortiment bij ons doen.

Je signaleert continue kansen op het gebied van assortiment en zet deze om tot concrete inzichten en acties tijdens integrale ‘deep-dives’.
Je bent de sparringpartner voor bijvoorbeeld Category Managers. Je neemt hen mee en overtuigt hen van met vernieuwende inzichten of voorstellen als het gaat om continue het juiste assortiment voor klant en winkel bieden.
Je analyseert het assortiment op basis van performance data en gebruikt daarvoor big data-applicaties zoals PowerBI en Assortiment Optimization. Hiermee vertaal je de data in specifieke assortimentsadviezen.
Je weet verzoeken vanuit Commercie voor schapanalyse en ruimteverdeling te vertalen naar kansen en commerciële plannen en draagt zorg voor de implementatie daarvan.
Je stuurt continu op kansen in assortiment. Denk aan assortiment met hoge derving, lage marge, kansen op biologisch of producten met een slechte beschikbaarheid.
Je biedt end-to-end begeleiding bij het proces voor veranderingen van assortiment in de winkel waarbij je verschillende afdelingen binnen Albert Heijn (Concept Development, Winkel Support, Merchandising, Strategy en Analytics) aanhaakt, informeert en samenbrengt.




We vinden het belangrijk dat jij bij Albert Heijn jezelf kunt zijn in een omgeving die openstaat voor verschillende perspectieven, een omgeving waarin we nieuwsgierig zijn en elkaar waarderen. Voor deze functie zoeken we bij voorkeur iemand die de diversiteit in ons team, in de breedste zin van het woord, versterkt. Iemand die vanuit eigen achtergrond en persoonlijke eigenschappen een ander geluid brengt en daarmee een goede aanvulling is op ons team.




Dit bieden we jou.

We betalen je inzet terug met een bruto jaarsalaris tussen €50.800 en €61.700 - afhankelijk van je ervaring. Dit bedrag is inclusief 8% vakantiegeld.
Je werkt mee aan onze groei en ontvangt daarom een gegarandeerde winstuitkering.
Je kunt 45 (ja, vijf-en-veertig) dagen met vakantie: je krijgt 25,5 vaste vakantiedagen en 19,5 Adv-dagen.
Een uitstekende pensioenregeling bij het Ahold Delhaize Pensioenfonds.
Een reiskostenvergoeding of NS-trajectkaart om van en naar Zaandam te reizen.
10% korting op je boodschappen bij Albert Heijn, tot maximaal €300 per jaar.
Verdere doorgroeimogelijkheden in de Albert Heijn en/of Ahold Delhaize organisatie.
Een Mijn Albert Heijn Premium abonnement met vele voordelen.
Via onze Albert Heijn Deals ontvang je exclusieve kortingen op leuke uitjes en producten van grote merken.
Een inclusieve omgeving waarin je op persoonlijk en vakinhoudelijk vlak continu kan blijven ontwikkelen.




Dit breng je mee.

Met onze 125.000 collega’s vullen we elke avond ruim zeven miljoen borden. En als het aan ons ligt, doen we dat binnenkort ook samen met jou als onze nieuwe Data Analist Assortiment. Zeker als je jouw commerciële kennis en analytische blik naar Albert Heijn meebrengt. Ook heb je:

Een afgeronde WO-opleiding, bij voorkeur in de richting van Economie of Bedrijfskunde.
Circa 3-5 jaar werkervaring liefst in een commerciële, trade marketing of consulting rol.
Je hebt affiniteit met assortiment en presentatie, kwantitatieve analyses en automatiseringssoftware
Je bent thuis in een Retail- of FMCG-omgeving.
Ervaring met Consultancy en/of onze winkels is een flink pluspunt.
Als je, net als wij, graag onderdeel bent van een team dat hard werken combineert met humor en gezelligheid, helemaal top!




Daarnaast ben je:

Analytisch, een must voor deze baan! Je kan snel problemen en oorzaken onderkennen, je ziet samenhang tussen onderwerpen, software en behoudt structuur en overzicht. Je interpreteert grote datasets en vertaalt deze naar inzichten richting de business en naar regels voor modellen.
Een denker in oplossingen en lekker proactief, je deinst niet terug voor complexe uitdagingen op het snijvlak van business, software en algoritmes.
Resultaatgericht: je weet concrete commerciële resultaten en/of doelstellingen te behalen. Je geeft niet op bij tegenslagen en houdt de uitgezette lijn voor ogen.
Overtuigend, je kan verschillende stakeholders overtuigen van onderbouwde ideeën en houdt daarbij rekening met mogelijke weerstand. Ook ben je in staat een boodschap krachtig, doelgericht en duidelijk over te brengen.
Flexibel/wendbaar en in staat je (snel) aan te passen aan veranderende omstandigheden of werkwijze, blijft daarbij kalm en houdt overzicht.
Verbindend, je bent je bewust van anderen, kan effectief de samenwerking opzoeken en verwachtingen van collega’s begrijpen en hier het eigen gedrag waar nodig op aanpassen.
Ondernemend, je wacht ontwikkelingen niet af, maar bent proactief en onderneemt zelf actie en stelt zaken ter discussie.




Samen beter eten bereikbaar maken. Voor iedereen.

Bij Albert Heijn geloven we dat eten en drinken een essentiële rol speelt bij de grote uitdagingen in de maatschappij. Het levert een belangrijke bijdrage aan een gezonde levensstijl, het verbindt mensen en draagt bij aan een beter klimaat en daarmee een duurzame samenleving. Onze missie is dan ook: Samen beter eten bereikbaar maken. Voor iedereen. Albert Heijn Nederland is B Corp gecertificeerd. Deze certificering onderstreept onze missie waarmee het een bijdrage levert aan een gezonde, sociale en duurzame samenleving. De B Corp certificering wordt toegekend aan bedrijven die voldoen aan hoge normen voor sociale- en milieuprestaties, transparantie en wettelijke verantwoordelijkheid.




Ben jij er klaar voor om deze missie samen waar te maken?

Klik op de sollicitatiebutton en laat jouw cv en motivatiebrief achter. Dat kan ook als je nét niet alle artikelen van ons boodschappenlijstje in huis hebt.

Show more
HTML:
Data Analist Assortiment bij Albert Heijn

Zaandam - 40 uur per week

Wil jij graag bepalen welke producten in onze winkels gevoerd worden en jouw werk terugzien op de schappen in meer dan 1.250 winkels? Zie jij jezelf daarbij meewerken aan gave projecten op het snijvlak van commercie en analytics? En ben je op zoek naar een leuk team waar hard werken in combinatie gaat met humor en gezelligheid? Dan is deze baan zeker iets voor jou!


Albert Heijn vult met 125.000 collega’s, verdeeld over ruim 1.250 winkels in Nederland en Vlaanderen, negen home shop centers, zeven distributiecentra en ons hoofdkantoor elke avond ruim zeven miljoen borden.


Jouw nieuwe baan en werkplek.

Als Data Analist Assortiment bij Albert Heijn maak jij impact door te zorgen dat het juiste assortiment op de beste plek in de schappen van onze ruim 1.250 winkels wordt gepresenteerd. Je werkt op het snijvlak van het belang van de klant, commercie en onze winkels. Een uitdagende rol, waarbij je als belangrijke drijver achter grote assortimentsveranderingen nadenkt over hoe we iedere klant optimaal kunnen bedienen, zo veel mogelijk resultaat kunnen behalen én tegelijkertijd zo min mogelijk producten hoeven af te prijzen of weg te gooien. En dit doen we door continue bij te sturen. Dit alles doe je natuurlijk niet alleen: je werkt veel samen met de afdeling Commercie om kansen te presenteren en initiatieven te ontwikkelen en Analytics om onze assortiment modellen te verbeteren. Met jouw focus op ons assortiment, haarscherpe analyses en lef ben je in staat om vernieuwende inzichten te geven, de juiste partijen bij elkaar te brengen én zorg je dat alle doelen op tijd worden gerealiseerd. Je bent hierbij dé sparringpartner van de Category Manager op het gebied van assortiment: je denkt met hem/haar mee en stuurt hierbij op het juiste eindresultaat. Dat komt neer op een ideale mix van een commerciële mindset, de wil om te blijven verbeteren waarbij je een beroep kan doen op jouw skills in projectmanagement en procesbewaking.


In deze functie werk je 40 uur per week, deels vanuit het hoofdkantoor in Zaandam en deels vanuit huis.

  • Je stuurt continu op kansen in assortiment. Denk aan assortiment met hoge derving, lage marge, kansen op biologisch of producten met een slechte beschikbaarheid.

Iemand die vanuit eigen achtergrond en persoonlijke eigenschappen een ander geluid brengt en daarmee een goede aanvulling is op ons team.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Who We Are: At VML, we are a beacon of innovation and growth in an ever-evolving world. Our heritage is built upon a century of combined expertise, where creativity meets technology, and diverse perspectives ignite inspiration. With the merger of VMLY&R and Wunderman Thompson, we have forged a new path as a growth partner that is part creative agency, part consultancy, and part technology powerhouse.

Our global family now encompasses over 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 64 markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences.

Our expertise spans the entire customer journey, offering deep insights in communications, commerce, consultancy, CRM, CX, data, production, and technology. We deliver end-to-end solutions that result in revolutionary work. Data Scientist – VML

At VML, we help companies grow by accelerating their digital performance. As a Data Scientist, you’ll turn data into actionable insights that drive business growth. You'll work with large datasets, support decision-making, and help optimize digital marketing performance. With data at the core of our business, you’ll have the opportunity to work on impactful projects across industries.

What you’ll do

Analyze and interpret complex datasets to uncover insights that improve digital performance.

Develop dashboards and reports that make performance data accessible and actionable.

Support the development of predictive models and data-driven solutions.

Work closely with digital strategists, performance marketers, and developers to embed data into business strategies.

Present findings clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Stay ahead of the latest trends in data science, analytics, and digital marketing.

What we’re looking for

1-3 years of experience in data analysis or data science, preferably in a commercial or consulting environment.

Strong SQL skills for data processing and analysis.

Experience with BI tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.

Familiarity with machine learning techniques and statistical analysis is a plus.

Python skills are a plus, but not required—we can teach you on the job.

Knowledge of marketing analytics, attribution modeling, or A/B testing is a plus.

A proactive mindset—you don’t just analyze data, you spot opportunities and drive impact.

A strong communicator who can translate data into clear business insights.

A degree in a relevant field such as Econometrics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or similar.

Be part of our growing Data Science & Analytics team

At VML, data is central to everything we do. Our Data Science & Analytics team is growing fast and plays a key role in many of our projects. You’ll be surrounded by like-minded data professionals who are passionate about using data to drive impact. This is a unique opportunity to develop your skills in digital analytics, consultancy, and data science, working on high-impact projects. We’re here to help you grow.

Why VML?

At VML, we’re a digital accelerator—we help companies grow by optimizing their digital domain. You’ll be part of a team of ambitious, skilled professionals who thrive on solving complex digital challenges. We work closely with our clients and each other, fostering innovation, experimentation, and continuous learning.

We offer:

Exciting projects with top-tier brands.

A fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment where your ideas matter.

A collaborative culture with a team of experts to learn from.

The freedom and responsibility to make an impact.

Fun—we love what we do, and we do it together.

Ready to make an impact in the digital world? Join us at VML.

At VML, we are committed to fostering an all-inclusive work environment that is both rewarding and career-forward. Our Inclusion, Equity & Belonging initiatives, alongside the VML Foundation, reflect our dedication to giving back and making a positive impact in our communities and beyond. Our people are the heartbeat of our organization—creators, doers, innovators, makers, and thinkers—who drive not just marketing, but meaningful experiences that resonate in every action and interaction.

VML is a WPP Agency. For more information, please visit our website, and follow VML on our social channels via Instagram, LinkedIn, and X.

When you click "Submit Application", this will send any information you add below to VML. Before you do this, we think it's a good idea to read through our Recruitment Privacy Policy. California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice. This explains what we do with your personal data when you apply for a role with us, and, how you can update the information you have provided us with or how to remove it.

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


CIMSOLUTIONS heeft een actief diversiteitsbeleid en streeft naar een evenwichtige verdeling van professionals naar leeftijd, gender, etnische achtergrond en cultuur, arbeidsvermogen, kennis en competenties. Hierbij benadrukken wij dat wij gelijke kansen belangrijk vinden in de selectie.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0499 – 366 000 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: Data Science Intern
Description:
Job Description

We have an excellent opportunity for an enthusiastic Bachelor or Master student who is interested in making a difference in Category Development at Kraft Heinz! The Category team is at the heart of our commercial activities and sets out and implements an effective category management our brands. This includes drafting commercial strategies, identifying brand & category opportunities and regular sparring sessions with the marketing, sales, finance, procurement, and other commercial teams. 

The Positions 

Every internship at Kraft Heinz Netherlands offers unique opportunities to develop new knowledge and skills, gain real business experience, get exposure to senior leadership and attend tailored trainings. As an intern you will take ownership of projects and work closely with the business on day-to-day challenges. 

Data scientist internship position in the KraftHeinz Advanced Analytics team. The position will focus on applying statistical and machine learning methodologies to answer challenging questions in the realm of revenue management and brand growth (pricing, promotion, assortment).

As part of KraftHeinz Digital, the intern will work on products used in markets across the globe – and tasks can range from operational check-ins with end-users to exploratory research.

Recruitment process  


CV selection based on eligibility requirements. 
Online Pymetrics assessment 
Online Pymetrics video interview 
Online Screening Interview via Microsoft Teams 
Online Hiring manager interview 



Note The recruitment process can take 4/6 weeks in total 

Kraft Heinz is an Equal Opportunity Employer that prohibits discrimination or harassment of any type. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants who require an accommodation to participate in the job application or hiring process should contact NATAI@kraftheinz.com. 

What we offer you  

Program start date May 2025

Duration 6 months 

Allowance 625 euro per month (40hrs, 5 days) & full reimbursement of travel expenses 

Location Amsterdam 

Become a part of a close intern community as well as a young and ambitious work environment (including online). 

Hybrid Policy  

Kraft Heinz has recently transitioned to a hybrid way of working, which means that we work 60% of the week in the office and have the right to work 40% from home. 

Location(s)

Amsterdam

Kraft Heinz is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Underrepresented Ethnic Minority Groups/Women/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity and other protected classes.

We have an excellent opportunity for an enthusiastic Bachelor or Master student who is interested in making a difference in Category Development at Kraft Heinz! The Category team is at the heart of our commercial activities and sets out and implements an effective category management our brands. This includes drafting commercial strategies, identifying brand & category opportunities and regular sparring sessions with the marketing, sales, finance, procurement, and other commercial teams.

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


CIMSOLUTIONS heeft een actief diversiteitsbeleid en streeft naar een evenwichtige verdeling van professionals naar leeftijd, gender, etnische achtergrond en cultuur, arbeidsvermogen, kennis en competenties. Hierbij benadrukken wij dat wij gelijke kansen belangrijk vinden in de selectie.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0499 – 366 000 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: AI & ML Engineer
Description:
AI/ML Engineer




Are you an AI/ML Engineer driven by building smart systems and developing innovative machine learning models?




You’ll be part of an international team, who are passionate about the work they do. The company offers a dynamic work environment, with career progression with the AI/ML Space.




What You’ll Be Doing:

Build scalable, robust applications using Python and cloud platforms.
Develop end-to-end AI solutions, from concept to production.
Deploy ML pipelines using Python on cloud platforms.
Stay updated with state-of-the-art ML research.
Deploy ML models to large user bases.
Stay updated on cutting-edge ML research and tools.




Essential skills:

✅ 3+ years of experience in AI/ML Engineering

✅ Strong proficiency in Python

✅ Strong proficiency in frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch.

✅ Experience with CI/CD and MLOps

✅ Cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP)

✅ Experience deploying ML models to a large user base

✅ Professional proficiency in English. Any Dutch (or German) is a bonus.







Flexible working: Hybrid – 2 days in Amsterdam office, the rest remote!




Fantastic opportunities for career growth in a booming industry.




Work with one of Europe’s fastest growing AI specialists




Apply now to be at the forefront of AI & ML innovation.

Title: Junior Data Scientist - Early Career Program
Description:
This Is What We Offer You


Gross monthly salary between EUR 3,179 and EUR 4,540 (scale 07) for a 36 hour week
Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance
10% Employee Benefit Budget
EUR 1,400 development budget per year
Hybrid working: balance between home and office work (possible for most roles)
A pension, for which you can set the maximum amount of your personal contribution


View all our benefits.

Junior Data Scientist – Data & analytics Early Career Program

Are you passionate about data and love solving complex analytical puzzles? Challenge yourself and us, and make an impact with the Advanced Analytics Early Career Program at Rabobank. Grow your skills, discover your potential, and help us uncover new possibilities for Rabobank.

The role

As a Junior Data Scientist, you will work on developing, maintaining and improving machine learning models focused on diverse use cases throughout the bank. You will be at the forefront of creating models that help solve complex challenges, streamline processes, and unlock new opportunities. We need someone who can dive deep into data, work with tree based and clustering models and create scalable and reliable solutions.

You and your future

During our Early Career Program, you’ll develop your career over 18 months by becoming an expert in your field. Throughout the program, you’ll stay with one team and receive training to enhance your hard skills. You’ll be paired with a buddy who will guide you in navigating the bank. For your personal development, you and your fellow starters will follow the Early Career Program and receive guidance from a Data & Analytics Development Consultant. We’re here to prepare you for sustainable career!

Practical


Length: 18 months, after which you will continue working within your team
Hours per week: 40 About 10-15% of your weekly working time is spent on personal development, training and other activities. The other hours are spent working within your team;
Every Friday afternoon is Data & Analytics Early Career Program  afternoon at the office! 


Your development as a Young Professional

Within this program, you will have the opportunity to get to know yourself, your trade, and Rabobank. You will start the program in a junior position within one team, participate in (online) workshops and training modules with other young professionals, and quickly gain practical experience.

Together with Data & Analytics community there is room for creativity and initiative to organize events, training sessions, and knowledge-sharing sessions. This way, we continuously improve the program and ourselves! You will easily build a large and valuable network within the bank.

Learning From Each Other

Development is our top priority. The best way to learn is by doing, through both mistakes and successes. At Rabobank, we offer you the right balance between freedom and supervision. Develop talents you never thought you possessed, specialize in a professional field, or explore the things you're good at and enjoy doing. During your Advanced Analytics Early Career Program, you can count on us for excellent supervision. You'll work with experienced colleagues and have lots of contact with other Advanced Analytics young professionals.

‘Working for CLUE has provided a steep technical learning experience. The dynamic atmosphere ensures continuous growth with exciting new implementations always on the horizon.'

Rianne Weijsters, Data Scientist

Work on your own development & shape the world around you

For us, your development and that of society go hand in hand. That's why we want to invest in you and work together towards a better world. We summarize this in one sentence: "At Rabobank, you work on yourself and the world around you at the same time."

This is reflected in your personal development budget, our hybrid work environment, and a good work-life balance. You can work on banking matters for our private and business clients, but also on societal issues such as food and energy transitions.

You and your talent


Educational Background: You have obtained a Master's in (Quantitative) Economics, Econometrics, Data Science, Machine Learning, Informatics or a similar field.
Work Experience: Approximately 0-2 years of work experience.
Residency: Currently living in the Netherlands.
Communication Skills: Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to translate quantitative analysis into comprehensive information for higher management and business users.
Technical Skills: Knowledge of Python as well as (interest in learning) Databricks, PySpark, cloud technologies (e.g. Azure), Git, CI/CD, ETL processes, SQL
Language Proficiency: Excellent command of the English language.


You and the job application process

We believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. What can you bring to Rabobank? We can't wait to hear from you.


Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Contact Natasja Helder-Severijns (Recruiter) via Natasja.helder-severijns@rabobank.nl
1st Interviews will be held via MS Teams.
2nd Interviews will be held via MS Teams or at our offices in Utrecht. A case will be part of the 2nd interview process.
Assessments are part of the application process which will be done before the 1st interview.
We look forward to meeting you in person during the selection days.
A security check is part of the process.
We respect your privacy.
Show more

  • 1st Interviews will be held via MS Teams.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
*** CONTRACT Machine Learning Engineer/Software Engineer ***

Location: Amsterdam, Netherlands (remote)

Contract Length: 6 months + rolling contract

The Client:

A fast-growing tech scale-up developing AI-powered solutions to optimize renewable energy trading. Their technology helps energy companies manage power market fluctuations and maximize efficiency.




Responsibilities:

Develop, deploy, and maintain machine learning pipelines for real-time and batch forecasting.
Automate ML model retraining and deployment for improved efficiency.
Optimize the scalability, reliability, and performance of AI-driven solutions.
Transform experimental ML code into production-ready software.
Implement best practices in CI/CD, DevOps, and performance monitoring.
Work with Python (ML/Data Stack), cloud platforms (GCP), Docker, Kubernetes, BigQuery, DBT, & monitoring tools




Requirements:

4+ years of experience in software development in an ML environment.
Strong experience with ML model life-cycle management (MLOps), preferably of time series models
Strong Python skills and ability to write clean, scalable code.
Experience with MLOps, CI/CD, DevOps, and software testing.
Hands-on experience with cloud infrastructure (GCP/AWS) and containerization.
BONUS: previous experience in energy or renewables sector

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
AI Engineer (With a focus on LLM & RAG)




Location - Netherlands (Hybrid Working)

Salary - DoE (Range €65,000/€80,000)




Transform Real Estate with AI – Be Part of the Revolution!




Are you ready to take on the challenge of blending artificial intelligence with one of the world’s most dynamic industries? I’m working with a forward-thinking organisation that’s using AI to revolutionise the real estate sector. They’re building cutting-edge tools to empower professionals with smarter, faster, and more intuitive solutions—and they need your expertise to make it happen.




If you’re excited about AI innovation and want to leave your mark on an evolving industry, this role is for you!




Your Mission as an LLM Engineer:

As an LLM Engineer, you’ll play a key role in designing and deploying advanced AI applications that push the boundaries of what’s possible. You’ll be part of a team that’s not just dreaming about the future but actively building it.




What You’ll Do:

- Build and refine AI-powered tools tailored to solve real-world challenges in real estate.

- Take prototypes to the next level by scaling them into impactful, production-ready solutions.

- Experiment with and optimise large language models (LLMs) to ensure accuracy and reliability.

- Work closely with cross-functional teams to integrate AI tools seamlessly into workflows.

- Present innovative solutions to stakeholders, demonstrating how technology can transform their operations.










The Company:

This company is at the forefront of data-driven innovation in real estate. With access to the largest property database in the Netherlands, they’re leveraging AI and machine learning to create transparency, efficiency, and accessibility for industry professionals. Their goal? To simplify complex processes and unlock insights that drive success.




You’ll join a diverse, passionate team of over 50 innovators who thrive on collaboration and creativity. Located in Utrecht, the office offers a modern workspace, flexible hybrid work options, free parking, and a culture that values both productivity and well-being.







Who We’re Looking For:

We’re seeking a tech-savvy professional with a passion for AI and a knack for problem-solving. If you’re someone who loves tackling complex challenges and thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, this role is perfect for you.




Must-Have Skills:

- Hands-on experience developing and deploying LLM applications in cloud environments (AWS is a plus).

- Strong understanding of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) and prompt engineering techniques.

- Proficiency in Python, machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hugging Face), SQL, Git, and API integration.

- Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, ML Ops tools, and data pipeline management.

- Fluent in both English and Dutch.

- Currently residing in the Netherlands.




Bonus Points For:

- Experience with platforms like Amazon Bedrock or OpenAI API.

- Knowledge of the real estate industry, especially NVM Wonen.




Let’s build the future of real estate together—one AI solution at a time.




For more information please get in touch RRJ@oxygendigital.ai

Show more
HTML:
AI Engineer (With a focus on LLM & RAG)


Location - Netherlands (Hybrid Working)

Salary - DoE (Range €65,000/€80,000)


Transform Real Estate with AI – Be Part of the Revolution!


Are you ready to take on the challenge of blending artificial intelligence with one of the world’s most dynamic industries? I’m working with a forward-thinking organisation that’s using AI to revolutionise the real estate sector. They’re building cutting-edge tools to empower professionals with smarter, faster, and more intuitive solutions—and they need your expertise to make it happen.


If you’re excited about AI innovation and want to leave your mark on an evolving industry, this role is for you!


Your Mission as an LLM Engineer:

As an LLM Engineer, you’ll play a key role in designing and deploying advanced AI applications that push the boundaries of what’s possible. You’ll be part of a team that’s not just dreaming about the future but actively building it.


What You’ll Do:

- Build and refine AI-powered tools tailored to solve real-world challenges in real estate.

- Take prototypes to the next level by scaling them into impactful, production-ready solutions.

- Experiment with and optimise large language models (LLMs) to ensure accuracy and reliability.

- Work closely with cross-functional teams to integrate AI tools seamlessly into workflows.

- Present innovative solutions to stakeholders, demonstrating how technology can transform their operations.




The Company:

This company is at the forefront of data-driven innovation in real estate. With access to the largest property database in the Netherlands, they’re leveraging AI and machine learning to create transparency, efficiency, and accessibility for industry professionals. Their goal? To simplify complex processes and unlock insights that drive success.


You’ll join a diverse, passionate team of over 50 innovators who thrive on collaboration and creativity. Located in Utrecht, the office offers a modern workspace, flexible hybrid work options, free parking, and a culture that values both productivity and well-being.



Who We’re Looking For:

We’re seeking a tech-savvy professional with a passion for AI and a knack for problem-solving. If you’re someone who loves tackling complex challenges and thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, this role is perfect for you.


Must-Have Skills:

- Hands-on experience developing and deploying LLM applications in cloud environments (AWS is a plus).

- Strong understanding of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) and prompt engineering techniques.

- Proficiency in Python, machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hugging Face), SQL, Git, and API integration.

- Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, ML Ops tools, and data pipeline management.

- Fluent in both English and Dutch.

- Currently residing in the Netherlands.


Bonus Points For:

- Experience with platforms like Amazon Bedrock or OpenAI API.

- Knowledge of the real estate industry, especially NVM Wonen.


Let’s build the future of real estate together—one AI solution at a time.


For more information please get in touch RRJ@oxygendigital.ai

Title: AI/ML Researcher
Description:
About TCS

Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is a global leader in IT services, digital, and business solutions that partners with its clients to simplify, strengthen, and transform their businesses. We ensure the highest levels of certainty and satisfaction through a deep-set commitment to our clients, comprehensive industry expertise, and a global network of innovation and delivery centers.




TCS operates on a global scale & has over 6,08,985 of the world’s best-trained consultants representing 152 nationalities in 53 countries. TCS established its presence in the Netherlands in 1992 and works with leading Dutch Customers across industry sectors, including several NL20 companies. TCS has been ranked #1 in customer satisfaction, among IT services providers in the Netherlands in a survey by Whitelane Research and is recognized as a Top Employer in the Netherlands, Europe & also Global by the Top Employers Institute




For more information, visit www.tcs.com




Role description

An AI/ML Researcher at TCS is responsible for advancing the field of artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) through the design, development, and implementation of innovative algorithms and models. The role typically involves:




Responsibilities:

Research and Development:

Conduct cutting-edge research in AI and ML to advance state-of-the-art models and algorithms.
Explore and experiment with new machine learning techniques such as deep learning, reinforcement learning, and unsupervised learning.
Develop novel AI solutions for complex problems across various industries, including healthcare, finance, robotics, and autonomous systems.




Algorithm Design:

Design and implement novel algorithms for data analysis, predictive modeling, pattern recognition, and natural language processing.
Improve the efficiency and scalability of existing models and algorithms.




Data Analysis:

Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights for training models.
Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, anomalies, and key features that drive decision-making.




Model Training & Evaluation:

Train machine learning models on large datasets and optimize them for accuracy and performance.
Conduct thorough evaluation and testing of models using appropriate metrics to ensure generalizability and robustness.




Collaboration:

Work closely with cross-functional teams, including software engineers, product managers, and domain experts, to deploy AI/ML models into real-world applications.
Collaborate with other researchers and academic institutions to stay at the forefront of AI/ML trends and contribute to the academic community.




Publications & Presentations:

Publish research findings in peer-reviewed journals and present at industry conferences.
Communicate complex research results to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Requirements:

Educational Qualifications:

A Ph.D. or master’s degree in computer science, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field with a strong focus on AI/ML.




Technical Skills:

Expertise in machine learning libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, Scikit-learn).
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, C++, or Java.
Strong knowledge of mathematical concepts, including linear algebra, probability, statistics, and optimization techniques.
Contributions to AI/ML open-source projects or publications in top-tier journals or conferences.
Experience in cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) for model deployment.
Familiarity with large-scale distributed systems and data processing frameworks (e.g., Hadoop, Spark)




Experience:

Strong research background, deep technical expertise in AI and ML, and a passion for solving real-world problems with advanced technologies
Experience with deep learning, natural language processing (NLP), computer vision, or reinforcement learning.
Practical experience in designing and deploying ML models at scale.




Soft Skills:

Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for innovation.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills to explain complex concepts clearly.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.




Privacy Notice

Privacy Note: https://ibegin.tcs.com/iBegin/privacy-notice




Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is an equal opportunity employer. We truly believe that employing a diverse workforce is pivotal to our success. Please note, recruiting decisions are always based on applicant’s skills, competencies & experience and potential fitment to the available role

Title: Data scientist
Description:
At Cocoroco.com we're looking for a Data scientist to join and build our team.

About Us

We are Cocoroco.com! We believe the war on talent is a matter of a loca l market mismatch. That’s why we’re enabling companies to tap into the global talent pool through our online talent marketplace for remote customer service, sales and compliance talent. By doing so, global talent can connect with international companies, work from home and get fair compensation. It is therefore our mission to make work accessible for everyone globally, regardless of their location or background. Talents will now access the global labor market and maximize their career growth by unlocking their full potential.

Founded in early 2021, Cocoroco.com is growing at a fast pace and has built a proven online marketplace to support our business model. Speed and quality are the core drivers of our success which are accelerated by automation, and our model is trusted by companies such as Bunq, Rituals, Picnic, and many more. About the job.

Job Description

We are now looking for a Data scientist to join our team located at the Keizersgracht in the center of Amsterdam. Be our first in-house data hire and shape our innovative marketplace to make work accessible for everyone globally. We're currently working with an agency to develop our platform, and this will be our first internal position to grow the in-house tech team.

This gives the opportunity to become part of a profitable, fast-growing company with the flexibility to define and build on the technical foundations of our business. The ideal candidate has the ability to our data development and has the potential to lead the future tech team.

Does this sound like the challenge you need? Don’t wait—reach out to discuss.

Role


Data scientist


Objective


Spearhead the team’s data success by building, validating and maintaining our data roadmap.


Scope


Reporting to the Co-Founder.
Be the first in-house data hire


Responsibilities


Develop and optimize Machine Learning models to improve hiring efficiency, predict candidate success, and enhance business operations.
Build and maintain NLP-based solutions for resume parsing, automated job matching, and candidate profiling.
Design and execute A/B tests to improve platform features, user engagement, and decision-making.
Work with structured and unstructured datasets to uncover trends and actionable insights.
Deploy AI-powered solutions to automate repetitive tasks and enhance operational workflows.
Develop data pipelines and cloud-based analytics solutions in collaboration with engineers.
Create interactive dashboards and reports to support business teams in making data-driven decisions.


Requirements

Technical skills:


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, AI, Computer Science, or a related field.
Experience with Machine Learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn).
Strong programming skills in Python (Pandas, NumPy, FastAPI).
Experience with Cloud & Big Data technologies (AWS S3, Glue, Athena, Supabase).
Proficiency in SQL & NoSQL databases (PostgreSQL, MariaDB, DynamoDB).
Familiarity with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, Matplotlib, Seaborn).
Bonus: Experience with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) and Large Language Models (LLMs) for AI-driven applications.


Experience


>2 years work experience with mainstream frameworks
Proven track record of developing full-stack applications.
Experience in AI integration and database management.
Demonstrated ability to work on complex projects from concept to deployment.
Experience in managing and deploying applications in cloud environments.


Soft Skills


Strong problem-solving abilities.
Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.


Nice To Have


Experience with marketplaces and AI-driven projects.
Understanding of generative AI database prompting.


Benefits

Perks and benefits:


Competitive salary, on a labor contract.
Opportunity to work on innovative projects.
Professional development and growth opportunities.
Flexible working hours and remote work options.


Application Process


Submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your experience and why you are a good fit for this role.
Review
Cultural interview
Technical interview
Offer


Apply for the job

Do you want to join our team as our new Data scientist? Then we'd love to hear about you!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We’re building a world-class team to redefine knowledge work with AI

Zeno is a legal AI startup working to change how legal professionals do their work. By combining leading AI technology with deep insights into the legal profession, we automate complex workflows and increase productivity. In just one year, we’ve evolved from a single Proof of Concept to a platform with multiple tools actively used by hundreds of legal professionals.

We’re in the early stages of building something impressive. With our seed funding secured and early market traction validated, we’re growing a team of engineers and thinkers who want to solve real problems and drive innovation and create lasting change in the legal sector.

The Role

As a Data Scientist at Zeno, your mission is to turn raw data into powerful insights that revolutionize how legal professionals search, analyze, and interact with legal information. You’ll work at the intersection of AI, search technology, and data science—uncovering hidden patterns, refining algorithms, and enhancing our search capabilities to deliver the most relevant and precise results.

This is a unique opportunity to work on deeply challenging problems, shape a high-impact product, and push the boundaries of what AI can achieve in the legal field.

What You’ll Work On


Improve retrieval accuracy, ranking, and relevance using AI-driven approaches.
Identify patterns, extract insights, and refine datasets to improve our platform’s intelligence.
Build and test models that enhance search, document classification, and legal data analysis.
Ensure our datasets are clean, structured, and optimized for AI processing.
Work closely with software engineers, data architects, and domain experts to implement solutions that directly impact our users.
Explore new methodologies, tools, and technologies to keep Zeno at the forefront of AI-driven legal tech.


What We’re Looking For


You love working with data, uncovering insights, and optimizing algorithms to drive meaningful results.
You are skilled in Python and have experience working with AI frameworks, search technologies, graph data science, or NLP.
You take ownership, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and aren’t afraid to experiment.
You enjoy working with like-minded engineers, bouncing ideas, and building next-generation AI systems together.


What We Offer


A unique opportunity to work at a startup that is shaping the future of legal tech.
The ability to make a direct and tangible impact on the development and growth of our platform.
An inspiring place to work in an office located at the heart of Rotterdam.
Collaboration with a top-tier team of engineers, researchers, and entrepreneurs.
Competitive compensation, including growth and equity opportunities within the company.


Let’s shape the future of legal work together

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
Data Engineer


De functie


Bouw jij mee aan slimme data-oplossingen voor de publieke sector? Bij Van Dam Datapartners ontwikkelen we datagedreven oplossingen voor overheidsinstanties, zorginstellingen en kinderopvangorganisaties. We zoeken een Data Engineer die niet alleen technisch sterk is, maar ook snapt hoe data maatschappelijke impact kan maken.


Wat ga je doen?


  • Je ontwikkelt en onderhoudt ETL-processen en databronnen die overheden helpen betere beslissingen te nemen.
  • Je zorgt ervoor dat dashboards en rapportages in Power BI, Tableau, Qlik of Cognos betrouwbaar en up-to-date zijn.
  • Je werkt nauw samen met klanten en collega’s om data-architecturen te optimaliseren.
  • Je vertaalt complexe datastromen naar heldere structuren die gebruikers écht helpen.

Wie ben jij?


  • Je hebt minimaal 1 jaar ervaring binnen het publieke domein.
  • Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring met BI-tools en databewerking.
  • Kennis van SQL, Python of een andere programmeertaal.
  • Je kunt technische vraagstukken begrijpelijk uitleggen aan niet-techneuten.
  • Je voelt je thuis in een commercieel bedrijf, maar haalt voldoening uit projecten met maatschappelijke waarde.


Wat bieden wij jou?


  • Een marktconform salaris (€ 3.750 – €5.500 bruto per maand op basis van 40 uur per week), afhankelijk van jouw werkervaring;
  • 8% vakantiegeld;
  • NS-Business Card of reiskostenvergoeding (€ 0,23 per km);
  • Een laptop en telefoon;
  • 25 vakantiedagen;
  • De mogelijkheid om (maximaal 5) dagen bij te kopen of te verkopen;
  • Pensioenregeling bij Nationale Nederlanden;
  • Een thuiswerkvergoeding van € 2,40 per dag en de mogelijkheid om een thuiswerkplek in te richten;
  • Toegang tot de Academy en de mogelijkheid om een persoonlijk opleidingsprogramma samen te stellen. Volop ruimte voor groei en specialisatie.


Heb je nog vragen, dan mag je altijd contact met ons opnemen via werkenbij@vandamdatapartners.nl.

Title: Lead Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description:
Your New Career

Are you a technical leader and outstanding expert in the field of AI? Are you looking for a new challenge in an exciting environment working on cutting-edge AI on petabytes of high-velocity sensor data? As technical lead of a highly motivated data science team you will work with interdisciplinary teams and push the boundary of AI in a fascinating industry having a wide range of demanding applications.




Your Responsibilities

In a technical leadership role, you will be further strengthening our sizeable and well-rounded Data Science team.

Drive hands-on the development of innovative and highly impactful AI products ensuring their successful market launch
Provide technical leadership, guidance and mentorship to a high-performing and highly impactful data science team fostering a culture of excellence and innovation.
Define and implement Deep Learning architectures and strategies creating synergies across data science projects aligned with AP Sensing’s business needs.
Stay ahead of emerging trends and best practices in data science, AI, and advanced analytics, introducing innovative ideas to the team.
Engage with engineering, product, domain experts and business to align with products and organizational goals.
Report to and co-ordinate with the Data Science Manager.




Your Profile

7+ years of hands-on experience in applied data science, with at least 2 years in a technical leadership role.
Proven track record of delivering impactful data science solutions in a business environment.
Outstanding ability in proactively developing high performing data science solutions in short time frames.
Strong Python programming skills and expertise in machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn).​
Deep understanding of latest deep learning architectures and how to apply them on complex sensor data.
Hands-on mentality being deeply involved in all stages of the MLOps Lifecylce.
Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or related field. A PhD is a plus.
Ability to present complex machine learning outcomes in simple narratives to non-technical stakeholders. English is must. German is a plus.




Our Company

WE ARE AGAIN AWARDED AS TOP ARBEITGEBER 2024!

A success story that once began in the garage of Bill Hewlett and Dave Packard can be continued by you: As an independent HP spin-off, AP Sensing has been combining outstanding technological know-how with passion and success for more than 15 years. At our Böblingen site, we develop and produce measuring devices and software solutions that are used worldwide. For example, we monitor offshore wind farms in the North Sea, numerous sections of the European electricity and pipeline network, important transport facilities such as the Eurotunnel or the metro in Singapore and hundreds of other critical facilities. With your support, we want to continue to optimize plants and protect people and the environment. Don't miss this opportunity and become part of our strong and cooperative team!




Our Offer

half-yearly bonus distribution
(depending on company performance)
annual salary increases
holiday bonus
christmas bonus
AP Sensing Card with 50 Euro credit per month
permanent employment contract with job security
company pension scheme
participation in the Corporate Benefits Program
meal subsidy for in-house canteen
free drinks and fresh fruit
job-bike offer
career opportunities due to steady, healthy company growth
flat hierarchies and very collegial relationship with managers
very positive and appreciative working atmosphere
international and intercultural team
flexible working hours and home office options
company laptop for everyone
ideal work-life balance
regular company and team events
employee training and education
new and fully equipped kitchen with high-tech coffee machine
kiosk in the building
large, bright and air-conditioned offices
modern office equipment with creative spaces
height-adjustable desks for ergonomic working
2 minutes to the S-Bahn and motorway
free parking spaces
charging points for e-cars
sports facilities: weekly jogging group and fitness coach
showers available (for cyclists or "lunch break joggers")




Are you ready to play a BIG role in a small team instead of a SMALL role in a big team?

Then you are spot-on with us…




hr@apsensing.com

Contact: Ingrid Licht

Reference: 448G




AP Sensing GmbH

71034 Böblingen

www.apsensing.com

  • Strong Python programming skills and expertise in machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn).​
  • Deep understanding of latest deep learning architectures and how to apply them on complex sensor data.
  • Hands-on mentality being deeply involved in all stages of the MLOps Lifecylce.
  • Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or related field. A PhD is a plus.
  • Ability to present complex machine learning outcomes in simple narratives to non-technical stakeholders. English is must. German is a plus.


Our Company

WE ARE AGAIN AWARDED AS TOP ARBEITGEBER 2024!

A success story that once began in the garage of Bill Hewlett and Dave Packard can be continued by you: As an independent HP spin-off, AP Sensing has been combining outstanding technological know-how with passion and success for more than 15 years. At our Böblingen site, we develop and produce measuring devices and software solutions that are used worldwide. For example, we monitor offshore wind farms in the North Sea, numerous sections of the European electricity and pipeline network, important transport facilities such as the Eurotunnel or the metro in Singapore and hundreds of other critical facilities. With your support, we want to continue to optimize plants and protect people and the environment. Don't miss this opportunity and become part of our strong and cooperative team!


Our Offer

  • half-yearly bonus distribution
  • (depending on company performance)
  • annual salary increases
  • holiday bonus
  • christmas bonus
  • AP Sensing Card with 50 Euro credit per month
  • permanent employment contract with job security
  • company pension scheme
  • participation in the Corporate Benefits Program
  • meal subsidy for in-house canteen
  • free drinks and fresh fruit
  • job-bike offer
  • career opportunities due to steady, healthy company growth
  • flat hierarchies and very collegial relationship with managers
  • very positive and appreciative working atmosphere
  • international and intercultural team
  • flexible working hours and home office options
  • company laptop for everyone
  • ideal work-life balance
  • regular company and team events
  • employee training and education
  • new and fully equipped kitchen with high-tech coffee machine
  • kiosk in the building
  • large, bright and air-conditioned offices
  • modern office equipment with creative spaces
  • height-adjustable desks for ergonomic working
  • 2 minutes to the S-Bahn and motorway
  • free parking spaces
  • charging points for e-cars
  • sports facilities: weekly jogging group and fitness coach
  • showers available (for cyclists or "lunch break joggers")


Are you ready to play a BIG role in a small team instead of a SMALL role in a big team?

Then you are spot-on with us…


hr@apsensing.com

Contact: Ingrid Licht

Reference: 448G


AP Sensing GmbH

71034 Böblingen

www.apsensing.com

Title: Senior Data Scientist (m/w/d)
Description:
Senior Data Scientist

Location: Germany, hybrid/remote

Job Overview


Collaboration in projects of the European Data Science & Advanced Analytics Team.
Concept, design, development and execution of complex innovative AI/Machine Learning solutions as well as execution and implementation of concept studies using advanced statistical methods.
Productionalization of machine learning algorithms in Big Data platforms.
Application of modern data mining and machine learning techniques in connection with Healthcare Big Data to
Identify complex relationships and link heterogeneous data sources.
Advanced usage of Large Language Models for summarization, chatbot, entity extraction etc.
Develop foundational Deep Learning Models for assets and patients.
Builds and trains new production grade algorithms that can learn from complex, high dimensional data in order to uncover patterns from which machine learning models and applications can be developed.


Qualifications


Master degree in Computer Science, Mathematics/Statistics, Economics/Econometrics or related field.
At least 5 years of professional experience in quantitative data analysis or PhD with at least 1 year of relevant professional experience with research in machine learning algorithms.
Very good knowledge and in depth understanding of Machine Learning methods, both classical and deep learning models.
Very strong technical capability in Python, SQL, Hadoop ecosystem.
Experience applying AI/Machine Learning methods to business questions.
Very good knowledge of the higher statistical and econometric methods in theory and practice.
Experience with handling Big Data.
Ability to write clean, reusable, production-level code
Excellent communication skills (written and oral) including technical aspects of a project, ability to develop usable documentation, results interpretation and business recommendations.
Strong analytic mindset and logical thinking capability, strong QC mindset.
Knowledge of pharmaceutical market and experience with pharmaceutical data (medical, hospital, pharmacy, claims data) would be a plus, but not a must.
Self-responsible for managing projects.
Fluency in German and English.


IQVIA is a leading global provider of clinical research services, commercial insights and healthcare intelligence to the life sciences and healthcare industries. We create intelligent connections to accelerate the development and commercialization of innovative medical treatments to help improve patient outcomes and population health worldwide. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

Title: Data Scientist (all genders)
Description:
Unser Bereich Digital begleitet unsere Kunden auf ihrem Weg in die digitale Zukunft und entwickelt mit ihnen innovative Konzepte und Lösungen. Als Data Scientist arbeitest du an spannenden und zukunftsweisenden Projekten in verschiedenen Branchen wie Automotive, Banking, Versicherungen, Transportation und dem öffentlichen Sektor. Du transformierst komplexe Daten in wertvolle Erkenntnisse und unterstützt unsere Kunden dabei, datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu treffen und ihre Geschäftsprozesse zu optimieren.

Verantwortlichkeiten


Modellentwicklung: Entwicklung und Implementierung von datengetriebenen Modellen und Algorithmen, die teilweise auf künstlicher Intelligenz (KI) basieren.
Datenverarbeitung: Erhebung, Verarbeitung und Bereinigung von großen und komplexen Datensätzen.
Datenanalyse: Analyse von Daten zur Identifikation von Mustern, Trends und Zusammenhängen.
Berichterstellung: Erstellung und Präsentation von Berichten und Dashboards zur Visualisierung von Daten und Ergebnissen.
Teamarbeit: Zusammenarbeit mit verschiedenen Teams, um datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu unterstützen.
Prozessverbesserung: Kontinuierliche Verbesserung bestehender Datenprozesse und -strukturen.


Qualifikationen


Studium: Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Masterstudium (ggf. Promotion) im Bereich Wirtschafts­wissenschaften, Informatik, Physik oder einem vergleichbaren quantita­tiven Bereich
Sprachkenntnisse: Du bringst verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und fließende Englischkenntnisse mit und weißt diese in der Zusammenarbeit mit Kunden einzusetzen


Erforderliche Fähigkeiten


Data Science: Du konntest bereits Erfahrungen in den Bereichen Data Science, Data Engineering und Data Analytics sammeln.
Programmierkenntnisse: Du bringst fundierte Kenntnisse in Programmiersprachen wie Python, R oder SQL mit.
Datenvisualisierung: Mit Datenvisualisierungstools wie Tableau, Power BI oder ähnlichen bist du vertraut.
Big-Data-Technologien: Kenntnisse in Big-Data-Technologien wie Hadoop, Spark oder ähnliche sind von Vorteil.
Analytische Fähigkeiten: Du bringst starke analytische und problemlösende Fähigkeiten mit und kannst komplexe technische Konzepte gegenüber Kunden verständlich kommunizieren.


Leistungen


Bei Expleo setzen wir auf Teamwork, Offenheit, Transparenz und Wertschätzung. Wir gehen unsere Aufgaben gemeinsam an
Bei uns erwartet dich ein internationales und multikulturelles Team
Bei uns sind alle gleich und wir tragen alle die gleiche Farbe: LILA!
Wir bieten dir Gleitzeit, ein ausführliches Onboarding, Home-Office-Möglichkeiten und unzählige Mitarbeiter-Benefits. Wir bieten einen Arbeitsplatz, der deine persönlichen Lebensumstände berücksichtigt und dich absichert
Man lernt nie aus: Deine Weiterentwicklung liegt uns sehr am Herzen. Wir bieten interne Aus- und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten und unterstützen dich und deine perspektivischen Ziele
Wir haben Lust etwas zu bewegen, uns gegenseitig zu motivieren und freuen uns, wenn auch du deinen Teil zum großen Ganzen beitragen: Deine Erfahrung, deine Ideen und dein Engagement finden bei uns Gehör und werden honoriert
Unsere Kunden können sich nicht nur sehen lassen; sie gehören zu den Top-Playern ihrer Branchen, in den Bereichen Banken und Versicherungen, Automotive, Luftfahrt, Transport, Life Science und viele mehr
Das soziale Miteinander ist uns wichtig. Wir setzen auf Teambuilding und Identifikation


Du willst mehr über uns wissen? Besuche einfach unseren Youtube-Kanal und schau Dir unsere Videos an. Wir freuen uns über Deine Bewerbung und darauf, Dich persönlich kennenzulernen.
Show more

Title: Field Application Engineer / sensors / C++ / signal processing
Description:
Field Application Engineer (m/f/d) - Sensors / signal processing / C++




We are proud to be partnered with a leading technology innovator in the sensor business. We are looking for a midsize company around Stuttgart, who is looking for a Field Application Engineer to support their customers, the sales team, and their distribution partners in the design of products with special focus on ultrasonic flow converters, flow modules and sensor interfaces.




Please not, we can only consider candidates, who are already based in Germany or with a valid work permit for Germany.







Ideal profile

Minimum Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering or Physics, Master is welcome
Good knowledge of physics and signal processing related to sensor systems.
Considerable know-how in electronics development (hardware and software)
Good knowledge of programming languages (C++, ideally Assembler, Labview)
Strong ability to identify technical problems and solution strategies.
Able to adapt to a very dynamic work environment and changing customer requirements.
Good negotiation and communication skills as well as good critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Business fluency in English is mandatory, German is welcome.




Responsibilities

Providing technical support to distribution partners and/or directly to customers in Europe and the Americas.
Close interaction with the Sales team, the distribution partners, and the engineering team on a consistent basis.
On-site support and trainings while travelling within EMEA and AMEC.
Responding to technical customer questions, conducting schematic & layout reviews, creating sample software.
Reproduction and verification of customer requests and identification of solutions.
Develop and produce application notes and instructional (or demo) videos.







If this sounds interesting and you'd like to learn more, click the link below to apply or email me with a copy of your resume on lh@eu-recruit.com




By applying to this role you understand that we may collect your personal data and store and process it on our systems. For more information please see our Privacy Notice https://eu-recruit.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/European-Tech-Recruit-Privacy-Notice-2024.pdf

Title: Software Engineer - Machine Learning
Description:
About Applied Intuition

Applied Intuition is a vehicle software supplier that accelerates the adoption of safe and intelligent machines worldwide. Founded in 2017, Applied Intuition delivers the AI-powered ADAS/AD toolchain, Vehicle OS, and autonomy stack to help customers shorten time to market, build high-quality systems, and create next-generation consumer experiences. 18 of the top 20 global automakers trust Applied Intuition’s solutions to drive the production of modern vehicles. Applied Intuition serves the automotive, trucking, construction, mining, agriculture, and defense industries and is headquartered in Mountain View, CA, with offices in San Diego, CA, Ft. Walton Beach, FL, Ann Arbor and Detroit, MI, Washington, D.C., Stuttgart, Munich, Stockholm, Seoul, and Tokyo. Learn more at appliedintuition.com.

We are an in-office company, and our expectation is that employees primarily work from their Applied Intuition office 5 days a week. However, we also recognize the importance of flexibility and trust our employees to manage their schedules responsibly. This may include occasional remote work, starting the day with morning meetings from home before heading to the office, or leaving earlier when needed to accommodate family commitments. (Note: this is not applicable for EpiSci roles).

About The Role

We are looking for software engineers with expertise in ML-first perception, prediction or planning for autonomous vehicles or mobile robots. Your contributions will focus on building out key ML capabilities of an autonomous vehicle stack.

In addition to your engineering contributions, by working in our dynamic and customer-focused team culture, you will contribute to and learn from best practices in the autonomy industry. We move fast and focus on excellence, for our products and for our business. If you are hands-on and looking for a place to have a multiplying effect on making autonomous systems a reality, Applied Intuition is the place for you!

At Applied Intuition, you will


Design and implement capabilities and workflows for cutting-edge real-world perception or planning/prediction systems
Leverage established products at Applied Intuition to build the software and infrastructure foundation for our ML developments


We're looking for someone who has


Experience with the end-to-end development cycle of deep learning models
Expertise in subdomains such as modeling, input pipelines, evaluation, deployment, and model optimization
3+ years of experience building production software using modern software practices
Fluency in C++, or fluency in Python with intermediate experience in C++
Deep understanding of the concepts and methods behind any frameworks or libraries that they worked with
Experience working with production level ML and DL perception algorithms for autonomous vehicles


Nice to have


MSc or PhD in machine learning, ideally applied to perception, prediction,planning or closely related field
Experience building and shipping software frameworks or tools
Experience with driver assistance or autonomous driving systems
Experience in evaluating and improving system-in-the-loop model performance
Deep hands-on expertise in relevant algorithms or methods, such as non-linear optimization, computational geometry, numerical analysis, or distributed systems


Benefits and perks


Lunch and dinner allowance
Fitness (600 USD) and learning stipends (1,000 USD) annually
Stock options


Don’t meet every single requirement? If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Applied Intuition is an equal opportunity employer and federal contractor or subcontractor. Consequently, the parties agree that, as applicable, they will abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-1.4(a), 41 CFR 60-300.5(a) and 41 CFR 60-741.5(a) and that these laws are incorporated herein by reference. These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified individuals based on their status as protected veterans or individuals with disabilities, and prohibit discrimination against all individuals based on their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin. These regulations require that covered prime contractors and subcontractors take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status or disability. The parties also agree that, as applicable, they will abide by the requirements of Executive Order 13496 (29 CFR Part 471, Appendix A to Subpart A), relating to the notice of employee rights under federal labor laws.

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
R&D Software Engineer | 3 stage process | Hybrid | Stuttgart | 60-75k | English & or German Speakers

I am working with a company who work with the top 50 tech companies in the world trailing all their newest products.
I need a Software Engineer with a background in hardware and electronics to join the team.

My client are based just outside Stuttgart and need people to come into the office 2 times per week due to working on both hardware and software.

This is an English speaking role, of course any Germany helps! It is a 3 stage interview process and I can offer a salary of €60,000-€75,000 per annum.

Skills:

Electrical Engineering or Engineering background
Used to testing on hardware devices
Several years in software engineering roles ideally with C#
C#/.Net experience needed
MATLAB programming skills - IDEALLY
Interested in working on hardware and software

If this sounds interesting and you would like to learn more, please apply and or reach out to me on LinkedIn and we can set up a call!
