  • Erfahrung mit PCO UA Kommunikation
  • Gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
  • MS-Office-Kenntnisse (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)


Klingt gut? Dann senden Sie uns Ihre Bewerbung unter Angabe Ihres frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermins. Wir freuen uns darauf Sie kennenzulernen!

Title: Senior Research Engineer
Description:
Job Description

Our mission is to create outstanding research and innovative technologies for networking, telecommunication, and software systems. Our team research focuses on the operational challenges in deploying, maintaining and troubleshooting networks and software systems. We create data-driven solutions and implement software systems to provide autonomy to network operation in such a way that scales with future workload demands.

How You Will Contribute And What You Will Learn


Identify new and ambitious research challenges, define research projects to address these challenges, and carry out ground-breaking research in the areas of software systems and/or software engineering with focus on the afore mentioned research agendas for creating both theoretical innovations and novel practical implementations.
Propose new innovations and generate patents to help continuing Nokia’s leadership in intellectual property in software services and technologies.
Implement and validate new innovations and accelerate their adoption through Nokia business groups, incubation, or external spin-offs.
Publish research in major conferences and journals worldwide.
Keep an active and visible role in the research community through conference committees and reviewing panels.
Create and maintain strong collaborative associations with university-based researchers.


Key Skills And Experience

You have:


Ph.D. degree (or equivalent experience) in computer science, electrical engineering with a strong focus on software systems or software engineering research.
Deep understanding of distributed systems, AI/ML systems, Web3 technologies, and distributed software systems.
A proven track record in research, with publications in prestigious IEEE/ACM conferences and/or journals
Strong written and spoken English communications skills. You have delivered talks at relative international workshops, conferences, or other events.
Demonstratable programming skills. Pointers to research prototypes you have built or open-source libraries you contributed to are much appreciated.
Ability to conduct independent research with minimal day-to-day guidance while also contributing to team-oriented projects.
Strong communication skills and the ability to successfully work in collaborative projects.


It would be nice if you also had:


Proven experience in designing and realizing large and complex software systems.
Familiarity with implementing decentralized systems.
PostDoc experience is a plus.


About Us

Come create the technology that helps the world act together

Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people’s lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world.

We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work

What we offer

Nokia offers continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered.

Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer

Nokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality:


One of the World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere
Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg
Workplace Pride Global Benchmark


At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people. Nokia’s employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect.

Join us and be part of a company where you will feel included and empowered to succeed.

Additional Information

US/Canada Nokia Offers a comprehensive benefits package that includes but is not limited to:


Corporate Retirement Savings Plan
Health and dental benefits
Short-term disability, and long-term disability
Life insurance, and AD&D – Company paid 2x base pay
Optional or Supplemental life and AD&D insurance (Employee/Spouse/Child)
Paid time off for holidays and Vacation
Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Tuition Assistance Plan
Adoption assistance
Employee Assistance Program/Work Life Resource Program


The above benefits exclude students. Disclaimer for US/Canada

Nokia Maintains broad annual base salary ranges for its roles in order to account for variations in knowledge, skills, experience and market conditions, and with consideration to internal peer equity.(Check the salary ranges in the job info section for this role)

All North America job posts will post for a minimum of 7 calendar days and up to 180 days or until candidate/s identified.

Title: Softwareentwickler (m/w/d) Reinigungsroboter
Description:
Das Werden Deine WOW-Momente


Unsere smarten Reinigungsroboter übernehmen auf großen Industrieflächen wie z. B. in Logistikzentren, Supermärkten und auf Flughäfen selbständig die Bodenreinigung. Wir entwickeln innovative vernetzte Geräte mit komplexer Software, Sensorik und Hardware. Mit Dir möchten wir unsere autonom navigierenden Reinigungsmaschinen weiterentwickeln.
Abgestimmt mit dem Produktmanagement konzeptionierst Du Robotik- und KI-Lösungen für aktuelle und zukünftige Kärcher-Produkte, entwickelst entsprechende Funktionen und begleitest deren Transfer in die Serie.
Dein Fokus liegt dabei auf den Themen Navigation und Perzeption.
In den Projekten arbeitest Du eng mit unseren internationalen Partnern zusammen.


Es Wäre WOW, Wenn Du Das Hier Mitbringst


Du hast ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes ingenieurwissenschaftliches Studium in z. B. Robotik / Robotics, Automatisierungstechnik / Automation, Informatik, Mechatronik oder einem ähnlichen MINT-Studiengang.
Du bringst erste berufliche oder akademische Erfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung für mobile Roboter mit (z.B. als Softwareingenieur*in).
Idealerweise lag Dein Fokus dabei auf Navigationsalgorithmen zur Pfadplanung und Wahrnehmungsalgorithmen zur Hinderniserkennung.
Linux, ROS / ROS2, C++ und Python sind genau Dein Ding und Du kennst Dich aus mit modernen Software Entwicklungsprozessen.
Sehr gute Deutsch- oder Englischkenntnisse.
Ownership, Kreativität, Drive und Freude an der Zusammenarbeit in internationalen Teams zeichnen Dich aus.


Unser Kärcher WOW-Paket


Damit Du in eine abgesicherte WOW-Zukunft blicken kannst, zahlen wir für alle Mitarbeitenden einen jährlichen Beitrag in die betriebliche Altersvorsorge ein, den Du zusätzlich durch individuelle Eigenbeiträge erhöhen kannst.
Kleine Traum-Erfüll-Hilfen: Jubiläumszuwendungen für alle, die lang in unserem Team bleiben, Zielprämien und weitere Sonderzahlungen.
Genug Zeit, um Familie, Freund*innen und die Welt zu sehen: Bis zu 32 Tage Urlaub. An Heiligabend und Silvester hast Du frei.
Mobilität auf Dich zugeschnitten: Fahrtkostenzuschuss für den ÖPNV von 60%, attraktive Entgeltumwandlungsmodelle zum Leasing von Fahrrad oder PKW, Prämien für Radfahrer*innen.
Ausgewogen, frisch und WOW: Regionale und saisonale Küche in unseren mehrfach ausgezeichneten Betriebsrestaurants.


Also: Wanna WOW with us?

Lade einfach deinen Lebenslauf online hoch und hinterlasse deine Kontaktinfos. Wir freuen uns darauf, dich von deiner persönlichen WOW-Seite kennenzulernen! Wir begrüßen die Bewerbung von Menschen mit Behinderung, deren Integration uns ein besonderes Anliegen ist.

Together towards a clean world.

Lisa Busch | Recruiterin

lisa.busch@karcher.com | +49 (0) 7195 14 5781
Show more

Title: Software Developer (m/f/d)
Description:
As a leading personnel service provider in the field of specialists and executives, we have long-standing business relationships with many renowned companies in the region.

We are looking for a Software Developer (m/f/d) for a well-known client from Esslingen.

What you can expect from us


Flexible working hours
Very good transport connections with free parking
In-house canteen
Company pension scheme
Attractive discounts via corporate benefits
Sports and fitness offers to promote health
Childcare services to support families
Company health insurance with exclusive additional benefits
Your tasks
Development of cloud applications for the IoT platform iX4.0
Implementation of algorithms and user-friendly web interfaces
Application of modern web technologies and frameworks such as Angular and Nest.js
Agile working in the Scrum team
Your profile
Completed studies in computer science, business informatics or comparable qualification
Practical experience in JavaScript or preferably TypeScript
Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS or Azure
Confident in written and spoken German and English
Strong communication skills, flexibility and a solution-oriented way of working

mi FACHpersonal engineering GmbH

Özlem Catalkaya

Bunsenstrasse 2

72622 Nürtingen

Phone: 07022/503 50 121

E-Mail: bewerbung-engineering@mi-fachpersonal.de

Title: Senior Artificial Intelligence Specialist (all genders)
Description:
Wir gehören zu den Top-Adressen in der IT-Welt und fokussieren uns auf die Optimierung der Kerngeschäfts­prozesse unserer Kunden. Durch den smarten Einsatz maßgeschneiderter IT-Lösungen unterstützen wir unsere Kunden dabei, das Beste aus ihrem Business und aktuellen Technologien herauszuholen. Unseren Erfolg aber erreichen wir nur durch eins: die Menschen bei adesso! Sie bringen Ideen, fachliches Know how und Technologien zusammen. Gemeinsam programmieren wir (deine) Zukunft bei adesso.

DEINE ROLLE


Branchenübergreifende Beratung: Du berätst unsere Kunden branchenübergreifend bezüglich datengetriebener Lösungen mit einem Fokus auf künstliche Intelligenz.Ganzheitliche
Projektbetreuung: Du betreust die Umsetzung von KI-Projekten ganzheitlich, beginnend bei der Use Case Definition, über die Entwicklung, bis hin zur Operationalisierung.
Projekteinsatz: Du übernimmst je nach Seniorität die Rolle eines Product Owners, Requirements Engineers oder Entwicklers in Projekten.
Themenentwicklung: Du unterstützt aktiv bei der Entwicklung neuer Themen.


DEIN PROFIL


Fundiertes Wissen: Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in den Fachrichtungen Informatik, Data Science, (Computer-)Linguistik, Kognitionswissenschaft oder ein vergleichbarer Studiengang. Eine Promotion ist von Vorteil, aber keine Voraussetzung .
Programmierkenntnisse: Gute Kenntnisse in Python oder R, inklusive Entwicklung in der Cloud (z.B. AWS, Azure)
Berufserfahrung: Mindestens zwei Jahre Berufserfahrung in einer vergleichbaren Position, inklusive agiler Projekt- bzw. Produktentwicklung
Kommunikationsfähigkeiten: Teamgeist mit sehr guten Kommunikations-, Management- und Präsentationsfähigkeiten
Leidenschaft: Begeisterung für Beratung, künstliche Intelligenz und die Entwicklung innovativer Produkte
Sprachkenntnisse: Fließend in Deutsch und Englisch, weitere Sprachen sind von Vorteil


Unser Versprechen: Du wirst dich bei uns wohlfühlen! Kollegial, familiär und auf Augenhöhe – wir leben Austausch, Teamgeist und einen respektvollen Umgang miteinander. Diversität und verschiedene Blickwinkel werden bei uns genauso geschätzt wie du als Mensch. Das und viel mehr steht für unser ganz besonderes Wir-Gefühl. Für das es sogar ein Wort gibt: adessi.

Unsere Kultur und das Zusammenarbeiten sind geprägt von gegenseitiger Wertschätzung, Anerkennung und Unterstützung. Das verbindet uns hierarchieübergreifend – auch im Home-Office. So belegen wir zum wiederholten Mal den 1. Platz beim Wettbewerb „Deutschlands Beste Arbeitgeber in der ITK“!. Unser umfangreiches Trainingsangebot und ein transparentes Laufbahnstufenmodell für alle sorgen dafür, dass deine Entwicklung bei uns nicht stillsteht. Denn gemeinsam zu wachsen und Chancengeber zu sein, das ist programmiert in unserer DNA.
Show more

Title: Ingenieur (gn) Fahrzeugdatenauswertung
Description:
Für unseren Kunden, einen KFZ-Hersteller in Stuttgart Untertürkheim, suchen wir einen erfahrenen Ingenieur (gn) im Bereich Fahrdatenauswertung.

Was wir bieten


Überdurchschnittliche Vergütung in Abhängigkeit von Berufsausbildung und Berufserfahrung
Eine spannende und verantwortungsvolle Tätigkeit in einem festen erfahrenen Team
Die Möglichkeit zur persönlichen und fachlichen Weiterbildung
Betriebliche Altersvorsorge
30 Tage Urlaub bei einer 5-Tage-Woche
Gesundheitsprogramm (Beteiligung an Fitnessstudiomitgliedschaft, Businessbike)
Corporate Benefits
Regelmäßige Team- und Firmenevents


Deine Aufgaben


Erstellung von ETL Pipelines für Zeitreihendaten
Visualisierung von Zusammenhängen von Zeitreihendaten und Diagnostic Trouble Codes
Entwicklung von Funktionen mittels testgetriebener Softwareentwicklung
Identifikation und Kategorisierung von Fehlern aus Fahrversuchen mit Brennstoffzellentechnologie
Zuweisung und Tracking von Fehlern und Abstellvorgängen
Entwicklung einer Methodik zur Automatisierung der Fehleridentifikation und Kategorisierung


Deine Qualifikation


Erfahrung oder Studium im Bereich Produktentwicklung im Automotive Bereich
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse
Erweiterte Kenntnisse in Python/Pyspark
Grundkenntnisse bzgl. CAN-Protokoll und Signalinterpretation
Erfahrung im Bereich Brennstoffzellenentwicklung


Interesse?

Dann freuen wir uns auf Deine kurze Onlinebewerbung.

Nachdem wir Deine Bewerbungsunterlagen durchgesehen haben melden wir uns umgehend bei Dir.

Title: Solution Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
About Us

At ATOSS Software SE, we are driving the future of workforce management. With our software solutions, we are helping our customers to work more creatively, intelligently and humanely, revolutionizing and optimizing the interplay between profitability and humanity. With 19 consecutive years of record growth, inclusion in the SDAX and TecDAX, we continue to expand globally.

The Person You are

At ATOSS, we hire for both character and skill, seeking individuals who embody resilience, a pioneering spirit, and the passion to grow.

We Value Those Who

Think like entrepreneurs – taking ownership, pushing boundaries, and driving impact.

Challenge the status quo – bringing fresh ideas and bold execution to the table.

Thrive in change – seeing growth as a lifelong journey, both professionally and personally.

The Role

Are you passionate about bridging the gap between technology and customer needs?

As a Solution Engineer (m/f/d), you'll play a key role in understanding our clients' processes, identifying their unique requirements, and transforming them into our tailored software solutions. You'll work closely with Sales, Product Management, and Consulting teams to deliver value-driven solutions that make a real impact.

Key Responsibilities


Act as the primary contact for technical and functional inquiries, developing innovative solutions for complex customer challenges.
Support the sales process as a trusted advisor, building strong and lasting relationships with prospects and clients.
Conduct high-quality workshops (both virtual and on-site) to analyze customer needs and present tailored software solutions beyond basic feature demonstrations.
Collaborate with Product Management to stay ahead of market trends and ensure our solutions meet evolving customer demands.
Assist in the preparation of RFPs/RFIs and provide expert consultation during proposal processes.
Contribute to the team's success by sharing your expertise and fostering creative solutions.


Key Requirements


Successfully completed degree or vocational training in an IT-related field.
Experience with ATOSS software as a user or key user.
Strong interest in digitalization, software solutions, and process optimization.
Excellent presentation and communication skills in both German and English.
High service orientation and a structured, solution-focused approach to work.
Willingness to travel (approximately 2–3 days per week).


Our Benefits


Competitive Rewards: Including profit-sharing and employee stock program.
Structured Onboarding & Continuous Leadership Development: Clear career paths onboarding through Expert & Leadership Tracks, plus access to ATOSS Academy.
Flexible Work Culture: Hybrid options (remote within the EU), 30 days of vacation, and a strong commitment to diversity & inclusion.
Engaging Team Environment: Seasonal company events, team retreats, and an in-house barista.
Health & Wellbeing: Including regular check-ups, corporate wellness programs, and Wellpass membership.
Stability & Growth: Company listed on SDAX & TecDAX, with 19+ years of record-breaking revenue and a 30%+ EBIT margin. Certified Top Employer© for the 5th year in a row.


At Atoss, great talent knows no limits. We welcome professionals from all backgrounds and empower their growth through an inclusive, skill focused environment.

Join us and be part of a high-growth, future-focused company!

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
About the Job




Want to be part of building the future of Sales for companies everywhere? Where AI Meets Human Communication!

Our client is spearheading a revolution in Sales by empowering sales agents to excel through automated personalized coaching powered by advanced AI technology.

They are on a mission to shape the future of sales for businesses globally, and are looking for talented individuals to join their amazing team of machine learning engineers, data scientists, software developers, designers, and more in their Stockholm office.

The company is transforming sales professionals' lives worldwide—building more connected and efficient teams at the intersection of behavioural science and automation.

The state-of-the-art AI technology is redefining how sales professionals learn to communicate with confidence and precision in every interaction. Monitoring everything down to the customer’s tone of voice, picking up buying signals and offering live advice to agents and managers.

The team previously built and held leadership roles at industry champions like Tink, Spotify, Shopify, Zettle by PayPal, Sana and EF. We’re now building a new category leader in AI, solving an age-old, trillion-dollar problem for businesses globally.

They are located in Stockholm, Sweden, and are backed by a global group of prominent and heavy-hitting tech entrepreneurs and investors.




Role and Challenges 🚀




Design and develop machine learning models to extract insights, predict sales outcomes, and optimize coaching recommendations.
Work with large-scale data sets, ensuring data integrity, feature engineering, and pre-processing pipelines.
Collaborate closely with software engineers and product managers to integrate AI-driven solutions into our core platform.
Deploy and optimize models in production, ensuring efficiency, scalability, and reliability.
Analyse model performance, troubleshoot issues, and iterate on improvements to maximize impact.
Contribute to research and development efforts to push the boundaries of AI in sales automation.
Stay current with industry trends in AI, data science, and machine learning, proposing innovative solutions to enhance our product offerings.




What We're Looking For 🤩




Proven experience as a Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer, with expertise in AI-driven applications.
Strong proficiency in Python and relevant libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, Pandas, NumPy).
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms such as AWS and/or GCP for deploying and managing ML models.
Experience in handling and analysing large datasets, developing data pipelines, and implementing feature engineering techniques.
Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business challenges into data-driven solutions.
Familiarity with NLP, time-series forecasting, or recommender systems is a plus.
Experience in mentoring junior data scientists or leading projects is highly desirable.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively in a cross-functional team.
A proactive, self-driven mindset with a passion for continuous learning and improvement.




What’s On Offer? 👀




Competitive salary & equity package
Mobile phone reimbursement
Six weeks annual paid vacation
Wellness budget
Learning & development budget




This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you intellectually curious and passionate about driving change in a pillar of Swedish society?

In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:


Drive analytical projects using industry-leading methods to get the most out of the rich data contained within Swedbank.
Establish and maintain process knowledge, perform controls, proactively identify areas for improvement and actively contribute to continuous improvement of processes.
Maintain and develop the current internal anomaly behaviour model.
Collaborate with other teams who may need to change processes in line with analytical results.
Support department heads and stakeholders with specialist knowledge and provide input to various development and improvement activities.
Contribute to the wider organization by proactively sharing best practices, always communicating transparently and openly, and helping to make Swedbank a fun place to work.



What is needed in this role:


Structured and analytical thinking, loving to solve challenging problems.
Intellectually curious and able to approach problems conceptually.
Attention to details and a commitment to delivering with high quality.
Ability to interpret requests and communicate results with business owners or other data scientists.
M.Sc. or higher in a quantitative subject (e.g. math, physics, computer science, engineering).
Sound understanding of programming and proficiency in Python and SQL.
Experience in practical applications of advanced Machine Learning techniques.



With us, you can experience:


Personal and professional growth through self-leadership and continuous development.
Meaningful work that positively impacts our workplace, our customers, and society.
An open and collaborative culture that encourages cross-functional teamwork and provides networking opportunities.
A supportive and inclusive environment that promotes a balanced and sustainable work-life, with flexible working conditions when suitable for the role.
Benefits such as our share based reward program Eken, company pension plan, employee offer for banking products, health insurance.



"Join our team and...


Learn from experienced professionals how to use data and analytics to build a modern digital business” Shengwen Luo, your future manager



We look forward to receiving your application by 06.04.2025. We work with continuous selection, which means that the position may be filled before the application deadline.

Location: Sundbyberg

Recruiting manager: Shengwen Luo, +46 730 676 106

We may begin the selection during the application period, so we welcome your application as soon as possible.

We have made our choice regarding recruitment media and therefore kindly decline contact with ad sellers or sellers of other recruitment services.

Swedbank does not discriminate anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability – everybody is welcome.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Role Description

This is a full-time hybrid role for a Data Scientist with HQ in Stockholm. The Data Scientist will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting large datasets to identify patterns and trends. Day-to-day tasks include performing data analysis, creating data visualizations, and using statistical methods to solve business problems. The Data Scientist will also collaborate with other team members to develop and implement data-driven solutions.




Qualifications

Data Science and Data Analytics skills
Experience in Statistics and Data Analysis
Proficiency in Data Visualization techniques
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work effectively in a team environment and collaborate with cross-functional teams
Experience with programming languages such as Python etc
Experience in the technology or finance industry is a plus

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Looking for the freedom of freelancing with the security of a full-time job? At Coody, we offer the best of both worlds—high salary, full benefits, and the flexibility to work remotely on cutting-edge projects.

On average, joining Coody means increasing your salary by 44%.

How do we do it?

The math is simple. We pay you more by cutting unnecessary costs — no overpaid bosses, no luxurious conferences, and no fancy offices. Instead, we invest in what matters: you.

Coody is all about giving you as an individual the chance to have a free and flexible life for your own priorities - Welcome to Gravity Free Consulting.

WHY COODY?


Compensation: Typically a 44% salary increase.
Safety & Comfort: Employment with a generous benefits package.
Freedom & Flexibillity: No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
Shaping the Future: Assignments with industry innovators like Topgolf, Spotify, Tobii, Volumental, Paradox, Volvo Cars, Varjo, and exciting startups and scale-ups.


About Us

Coody is a growing and dynamic group of people who are the tech stars of the future. We consist of about 13 different nationalities and work on assignments for digital game changers across Sweden, Finland, USA and the UK, in industries such as EV, Gaming, AI, MedTech, AR and FinTech.We’re more than a company — we’re a community platform. Our approach is built on trust and autonomy. We cut through bureaucracy to focus on what matters - our consultants. Explore our employee handbook for more insight into a genuine supportive, consultant-first environment.

What You'll Be Doing

As a Data Scientist consultant you'll work on technically, intellectually challenging and fun assignments for companies to strengthen their teams and projects.

You’ll be an integral part of the organisation and expected to contribute in the full stack of data science projects.

You'll need to be adaptable and ready to hit the ground running in new environments. We see new challenges and situations as opportunities for growth. Typically, you'll work on 1-2 different assignments per year for companies in a sector you're passionate about.

What We Are Looking For


5+ years of experience working as a Data Scientist
Deep understanding of one or more technical areas stated below
Fluency in English (verbal and written)
Experience working in an agile environment
A doers mindset with a proven track record of getting things done


WE WOULD LIKE TO SEE THAT YOU HAVE

A good track record working as a Data Scientist

Hands-on experience with at least a couple of production-level data science projects, from prototyping to deploying, maintaining and improving solutions

Deep knowledge of machine learning and statistics

Experience with some of the following: Python, SQL, Numpy, Pandas, R, TensorFlow

A degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field

Excited to take your career to the next level? Apply now, and we'll be in touch within a week if you're a great fit!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for a Data Scientist who is excited about leveraging data to create impactful solutions within the finance industry. If you have a knack for working with Python, SQL, and a strong analytical mindset, we’d love to meet you!




Key Responsibilities:

Analyze and interpret complex data to drive business decisions, with a focus on credit assessments and fraud detection.
Develop and implement predictive models using machine learning techniques.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to provide data-driven insights and solutions.
Ensure data quality and integrity while working within strict compliance standards.




Requirements:

2+ years in Data Science, with a solid understanding of credit assessments or fraud detection.
Proficiency in Python and SQL.
Must be based in the Stockholm area and able to work 100% onsite.
Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, Data Science, or a related field.







Bonus Skills:

Experience in the Finance, FinTech, or Payments sectors.
Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and cloud-based data solutions.

Title: Deep Learning Engineer
Description:
At Univrses we develop computer vision and machine learning technology for smart cities, and self-driving vehicles. Univrses is now looking for a Deep Learning Engineer to join the team in Stockholm!

Our product 3DAI™ revolutionizes urban and highway road management by providing timely, actionable insights about road conditions through AI powered live maps. As a result it empowers businesses, municipalities, and road transport authorities to make data-driven decisions, optimize their operations, and increase urban safety.

The team consists of talented, hard-working, and friendly people from all over the world with diverse backgrounds and expert knowledge in computer vision, robotics, machine learning, physics, math, software development and more. We develop cutting edge technology, particularly in the fields of computer vision and deep learning.

Your role

You will be part of the team responsible for the data curation, computer vision, and deep learning components of 3DAI™.

We are looking for a person who is knowledgeable in the state of the art in deep learning, and has a strong interest in applying their knowledge to real-world problems. They also recognize the importance of data quality and automation in building scalable, reliable systems, and are eager to contribute to the development of high-quality, user-friendly tools for these systems.

Responsibilities


Develop and test deep learning models for object detection, classification, and segmentation.
Streamline the deployment and scaling of computer vision models in production environments.
Design and implement monitoring and logging solutions to track the performance of our system on both controlled test sets and in the wild.
Develop learning based methods to ease data curation and annotation through automation.
Work closely with other teams to develop end to end KPIs for performance monitoring and trouble shooting.
Optimize and scale ML infrastructure to handle large volumes of image data efficiently.


Who You Are


Minimum of a Master's degree in Computer Science, Math, Physics, Robotics, or a related field.
Over 5 years of proven experience in developing computer vision or deep learning technologies.
Proficient in programming, particularly Python, and experienced with ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Strong theoretical foundation in deep learning and best practices.
Solid understanding of version control systems, especially Git.
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to thrive in a team-oriented environment.
Self-motivated with a keen focus on quality and scalability.
Motivated to see your ideas brought to life in production.
Flexible, eager to learn, and excited to take on diverse tech challenges.


Bonus points


Knowledge of classical computer vision and projective geometry.
Experience with data annotation and curation tools such as Labelbox, and Voxel 51.
Experience with AWS and Serverless frameworks, or other cloud platforms.
Experience with containerization and developing CI/CD pipelines.
Experience with Jenkins.


What We Offer


Bright and spacious facilities in the heart of Stockholm
Open and friendly work environment
A diverse, international, and friendly team
Generous employee benefits, such as:
Flexible work hours
5 000 SEK/year in wellness grant
Pension plan
Weekly Lunch and Learns
Possibility to work from home and/or the office in Hammarby Kaj, Stockholm

Next step

If you are passionate about computer vision and deep learning and want to be part of our team, please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience. All application material must be in English!
Show more

Title: Recent Graduated Engineers - Your future challenge starts here!
Description:
Ready to find your path? Try new things. Share experiences. And discover what you truly enjoy.

Saab is growing across the country and is constantly looking for new talent! If you are at the end of your studies or at the beginning of your career and want to continue developing while working to keep people and society safe, you are warmly welcome to apply to us.

Your role

With us, learning is everywhere. A place where each day is a chance to discover something new, share what you know and learn from others. Here, you´ll get inspired by a bunch of smart and experienced people. Ready to dive in? You can explore different areas, find a new passion, and figure out your own path. Plus, we got plenty of courses and training to help you level up your skills. Grow with us, every step of the way.

Saab offers diverse roles and continuous learning opportunities within IT, software development, systems engineering, electronics and mechanical engineering, just to mention a few. Start your journey as an engineer with us and play a key role in developing cutting-edge defense and security systems.

There are several ways to work at Saab as a recent graduate, in a team as a junior engineer or through different introductory and trainee programs.

Your profile

To be a successful employee at Saab, we want you to be a curious person who thrives in a supportive and friendly workplace where teamwork is the core to find smart solutions. You should be in the final stages of your post-secondary studies or a recent graduate.

We believe that you have a Bachelor´s or Master´s degree within one of the following fields:


Information Technology/System Science
Computer Science
Engineering Physics
Electrical Engineering
Mechatronics
Mechanical Engineering



Whether you’re passionate about creating secure and robust systems, developing innovative electrical or mechanical solutions, or engage in complex problem solving, we offer varied roles to match your skills and interest.

This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.

What You Will Be Part Of

Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive troubleshooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.

Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.

Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 22,000 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.

Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here

Does this sound like something you want to hear more about? Submit your application today!

If you are interested in introductory and trainee programs, write a note about it in the application questionnaire. Selection and interviews will be conducted on an ongoing basis.

Title: Junior Data Linguist/Data Scientist - Python Developer
Description:
Redfield is a leading IT consultancy specialising in advanced AI solutions, including chatbots, RAG systems, LLM applications, Natural Language to SQL/Cypher/API applications, Graph Databases. Our dynamic team is dedicated to pushing the boundaries of technology and delivering innovative solutions to our clients.

About Us: Redfield is a leading IT consultancy specialising in advanced AI solutions, including chatbots, RAG systems, and LLM applications. Our dynamic team is dedicated to pushing the boundaries of technology and delivering innovative solutions to our clients (mainly outside of Sweden).

We are looking for a student or a recently graduated individual to join our team as a Junior Data Linguist & Python Developer. This is an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience in NLP, machine learning, and cutting-edge AI technologies. You will collaborate with our engineers and data scientists to build intelligent systems, including chatbots, RAG systems, and LLM-based applications.

This is an hourly-paid position with the potential to convert into a full-time role based on performance and project requirements. We have collective agreement (kollektivavtal) that ensures transparent terms and conditions for all employees.


EU Citizenship is required.
Fully remote within Sweden.
Ability to meet deadlines.
Responsible, reliable and communicative
Excellent problem-solving skills.
Assist in designing, developing, and maintaining NLP pipelines for chatbots, RAG systems, and LLM applications.
Conduct linguistic data analysis and provide insights to improve model accuracy.
Experience with graph databases/vector stores is a plus.
Proficiency in Python with a focus on NLP/LLM and machine learning libraries (e.g., Llamaindex, Langchain, SpaCy, Hugging Face, NLTK, or similar).
Strong communication skills in English (Swedish is not required).


Öppen för alla Vi fokuserar på din kompetens, inte dina övriga förutsättningar. Vi är öppna för att anpassa rollen eller arbetsplatsen efter dina behov.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning engineer
Description:
At Professional Galaxy AB, we combine innovative technology with strategic business insights to drive growth and optimize operations. Our expert team provides tailored IT solutions and consultancy services designed to streamline your processes and elevate your competitive edge.


Innovative recruitment agency based in Sweden.
Assisting companies in recruiting the right talent at the right time, minimizing costs.
Submitting qualified candidates based on daily requirements.


Job Description

The primary tasks as a Machine Learning Engineer are:


Develop AI/ML software products including but not limited to explore large data set, try out new algorithms, feature engineering, test and evaluate model output, deploy the solution for production usage and scale out to the comprehensive fashion network of the company.
Design, develop and maintain the large-scale data infrastructure required for the AI/ML projects.
Leverage on understanding of software architecture and software design patterns to write scalable, maintainable, well-designed, and future-proof code.
Develop solutions, components, services and frameworks to address common needs in AI/ML projects, like feature reuse, model traceability, A/B test, etc.
Work in cross-functional agile team of highly skilled engineers, data scientists, business stakeholders to build the AI ecosystem within the company.


Required Skills And Experiences


Have a BSc or MSc degree in computer science, engineering or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
Have 4+ years professional experience working in relevant role(s) for a Machine Learning Engineer.
A hands-on person who loves coding, and like applying software engineering practices to machine learning projects.
Have experience in developing software products that have been successfully deployed to production.
Have several years of coding experience in modern programming languages, and strong background in Python programming, i.e. 3+ years.
Have great experience with cloud technologies for ML development, preferably Google Cloud.
Have solid experience in MLOps practices, developing ML pipelines, and deploying ML applications to production.
Have a strong working knowledge of a variety of AI/ML techniques and experience working with different frameworks.
Have experience handling high volume heterogeneous data (both batch and stream) and a solid understanding of data structures, databases, and data storage technologies.
Familiar with agile ways of working team collaboration, data-driven development, reliable and responsible experimentation.


Remote: 50%

Assignment Period: 2024.10.21 - 2025.03.31

Submission deadline: 2024-10-20
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Company Description




TheAlgoCave is a consulting firm specialising in digital transformation and innovation, helping organisations leverage data for business and technology integration. The company prioritises delivering commercial value from data products and guiding clients through every step of the data journey with industry and academic expertise.




Role Description

We are looking for an experienced ML engineer to help support a new business unit (startup within the Energy tech). It is a remote contract role but could also consider a full-time position for the right candidate. Below are the few responsibilities for this profile.




Perform data analysis and frame ML problem statements from business requirements.
Perform time-series analysis and develop forecasting models.
Develop and implement mathematical optimisation solutions.
Develop anomaly detection, predictive maintenance tools and other advanced ML/AI solutions.
Deploy solutions to cloud infrastructure for near real-time predictions. (MLOps)




Qualifications

Minimum 5 years of industry experience with hands-on ML solution development.
Strong background in Statistics.
Experience with deep learning solutions for time series problems. (RL is a plus)
Experience with deploying models in cloud infrastructure.
Phthon, PyTorch & GCP/AWS.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.




Unfortunately, we do not offer sponsorship for this role.

The candidate must reside in Sweden.

Start ASAP.

Title: Data Scientist Intern – Electricity Markets (Forecasting)
Description:
Montel, an independent and rapidly growing provider of energy information, specialising in news, data, and analytics. We are a trusted information source to all key stakeholders in the energy sector, we strive for integrity, accuracy and a human approach in all we do.

Montel plays a key role by equipping companies with essential decision-making tools tailored for the dynamic energy markets as they make the transition to greener energy. Our clientele encompasses a wide range of entities including large energy consumers, producers, regulators, traders, consultants, authorities, media, and more.

💡 What You’ll Do


Develop and improve models for forecasting short-term markets with major focus on Nordic balancing market and ancillary services markets.
Work with large datasets from market operators, weather services, and grid operators.
Apply machine learning, statistical modelling, and time series analysis techniques.
Collaborate with a team of data scientists, engineers, and energy market analysts.
Communicate insights through dashboards, reports, and presentations.
Help with developing our platforms for analysis.


📚 What We’re Looking For


Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or a related field.
Strong Python skills.
Experience with time series forecasting techniques.
Familiarity with electricity markets, energy trading, or renewable energy forecasting is a plus.
Strong analytical, problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Innovative, curious, and collaborative mindset.


🚀 Why Join Us?


Gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing sector.
Work on real-world challenges that impact the energy transition.
Mentorship from industry experts.
There is potential for future employment in Montel for those that excel

Title: Scientist
Description:
Overview

My client is a pioneering Swedish biotech company focused on immunotherapy medicines including rare disease, vaccines and cancer who are seeking a passionate, dedicated Scientist to join our dynamic team in Stockholm. Structured around a strong business model and ambitious senior management team, my client is look for a self-proclaimed "lab rat" who thrives on generating data and enjoys generating data. You will become an integral part of a specialized 5-scientist team working toward groundbreaking RNA therapeutics. Over the next 18 months, you will play a crucial role as part of the team in identifying lead candidates before progressing toward IND filing and clinical trials. This position offers a unique opportunity to contribute to cutting-edge research that has the potential to transform patient outcomes in rare diseases. There is potential based on positive results in the next months that the team will double in size before the end of the year, so a great opportunity for an enthusiastic scientist to join an ambitious and expanding team with good career progression opportunity through organic growth.




Requirements

The ideal candidate will possess:

MSc in Immunology, Molecular Biology, or related life sciences field
Experience working with rare disease models in vivo
Proficiency in classical scientific lab techniques including:
Western blotting and other protein analysis methods
Cell culture and manipulation of immune cells, particularly T cells
RNA isolation, characterization, and modification techniques
PCR, qPCR, and other nucleic acid analysis methods
Experience with mouse models and downstream analysis
Experience collaborating with CROs on preclinical studies
Knowledge of NHP models would be highly advantageous
Strong background in immunology, especially T cell biology
Experience in biotech environment preferred
Excellent documentation skills and ability to design and execute experiments independently
Proven track record of delivering results in a fast-paced research environment




Cultural Fit




My client values scientists who embrace challenges and take quick, responsive action to scientific obstacles. The ideal team member is someone who approaches hypothesis generation and experimental design with creativity and enthusiasm. They are looking for curious, hungry scientists who aren't afraid to roll up their sleeves and perform mission-critical work—whether that means running 10 Western blots in a row or tackling other intensive laboratory tasks to generate the necessary data (hypothetically speaking, it’s all about drive and passion for problem solving).




The successful candidate will demonstrate resilience, adaptability, and a genuine passion for advancing immunological therapeutics. You should be comfortable in a fast-paced environment where priorities may shift as the science evolves.




References will be required for this role and the interview process will include a technical assessment, cultural fit and senior leadership discussion.
This is a lab-based role.
This role comes with a competitive remuneration policy based on experience.
The interview process is expected to be 3 stages based on internal/external availability.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
As a Machine Learning Engineer at Fortum, you will develop cutting-edge AI solutions and contribute to a clean energy future. This is your chance to be part of a dynamic team that is passionate about leveraging data to drive innovations in sustainable energy. You will work on new projects, utilizing advanced analytics to solve complex problems and optimize energy solutions. Your work will directly impact our mission to create a cleaner world, and you will play a key role in shaping the future of energy. Join us and be part of something bigger.

About The Role

At Fortum, we value creativity, collaboration, and the power of data-driven decision-making. You will have the opportunity to develop your skills in a supportive environment, with access to the latest tools and technologies. We offer competitive compensation packages, professional growth opportunities, and the satisfaction of knowing your efforts are contributing to a sustainable future for generations to come. If you are ready to make a difference and embrace the challenge of transforming the energy landscape, Fortum is the place for you. Join Fortum’s Data Science & Optimization team to play a key role in our digitalization and AI journey. Together with a multi-disciplinary team of designers, developers, data scientists and testers, you will work with rapid digital experimentation to prove technical feasibility and usability of new AI use cases.

Main responsibilities will include but not be limited to:



Design and implement AI and ML solutions in Fortum’s cloud environments (both Azure and AWS) that are robust, scalable, secure and cost-efficient
Design and automate stable MLOps pipelines with model re-training
Contribute to best practices development in AI solutions and MLOps
Communicate with diverse stakeholders and understand the business needs
Discuss and design interfaces with backend and frontend teams
Discuss requirements for storage and data maintenance protocols with DevOps, CloudOps, EA architecture and cybersecurity functions
Coach the team and be open to learn about the energy domain



The position can either be based in Sweden and Solna or Finland and Espoo.

About You

To thrive in this role, you should have an MSc degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent work experience. A strong background in Machine Learning and MLOps is essential, with at least three years of solid experience in software engineering using Python. You must also be proficient in statistics and data science, having spent a minimum of two years honing these skills. Experience working with cloud solutions, particularly Azure and/or AWS, for over two years is necessary. You should also have a keen interest in the latest AI developments.



Experience with GenAI, cloud AI services, and different solution concepts (e.g. RAG, model fine-tuning, prompt engineering).
Familiarity with GitHub Actions service deployment, containers and DevOps practices.
Excellent communication skills and interest to learn about the energy domain.
Full professional proficiency in written and oral English.



Preferred additional experience includes:



Data engineering; architecture development and deployment.
IT security, high availability, cybersecurity, maintenance and support.
Data storage and data maintenance methods.
Familiarity with message brokers and microservice architectures.
Basic knowledge of OCPP, MQTT, and IOT devices.
Experience in working in an Agile environment.



We offer you

At Fortum, we believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.

More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.

Interested?

Please submit your application by 2025-03-23 at the latest. We will process the applications continually, and the position will be filled as soon as the right candidate is found, which may be before the last application deadline, so please apply as soon as possible.If you have any questions regarding the process or the position, please contact Kristofer Jakobsson, Head of Data Science & Optimization, kristofer.jakobson@fortum.com.

To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance, as well as a health examination which may include a drug test.

We are Fortum

Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

  • Data storage and data maintenance methods.
  • Familiarity with message brokers and microservice architectures.
  • Basic knowledge of OCPP, MQTT, and IOT devices.
  • Experience in working in an Agile environment.


We offer you

At Fortum, we believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.

More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.

Interested?

Please submit your application by 2025-03-23 at the latest. We will process the applications continually, and the position will be filled as soon as the right candidate is found, which may be before the last application deadline, so please apply as soon as possible.If you have any questions regarding the process or the position, please contact Kristofer Jakobsson, Head of Data Science & Optimization, kristofer.jakobson@fortum.com.

To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance, as well as a health examination which may include a drug test.

We are Fortum

Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

Title: Data Scientist till Data och Analys
Description:
Var med och driv innovation och frigör kraften i SJs data. Genom traditionell BI, avancerad analys, maskininlärning och AI kan du skapa betydande affärsvärde och forma framtiden för SJ!




Vi söker dig som brinner för att förvandla data till insikter och möjligheter. Hos oss får du chansen att forma framtiden som en del av vår resa mot att bli ännu mer datadrivna. Du kommer att utforska, identifiera och frigöra potentialen i SJs data över hela verksamheten med hjälp av traditionell BI, avancerad analys, maskininlärning och AI. Rollen är en nyckel i att skapa värde och innovation som verkligen gör skillnad – både för SJ och våra kunder.




SJs övergripande mål är att bidra till Skandinaviens tillväxt- och klimatmål genom att leverera 50% mer resor till 2030. För att kunna realisera denna tillväxtresa gör vi historiska investeringar på 19 miljarder i nya snabbtåg, nya regionaltåg och uppgraderingar av vår befintliga fordonsflotta.

Som en viktig del av vår spännande resa satsar vi också på vår förmåga att skapa värde genom användning av data och analys. Enheten Data & Analys etablerades 2023 och ska nu skala upp förmågan för att kunna leverera brett inom koncernen. Förmågan är viktig för att framtidssäkra verksamheten och maximera nyttan från större investeringar, inte bara på fordonssidan, utan även i nya IT-system för bland annat boknings- och säljsystem, personalplanering, operativ trafikledning och intelligent fordonsunderhåll.







Din kommande roll

Som Data Scientist blir du en central del av vårt nybildade team Data & Analys. Här får du möjlighet att utvecklas i en roll där du kommer att:




Driva spännande projekt från idéstadiet till färdig lösning, med direkt påverkan på företagets framgång
Arbeta med hela datahanteringsprocessen, inklusive insamling, förberedelse, modellering och visualisering av data
Implementera innovativa lösningar i produktionsmiljöer och hantera stora datamängder för att upptäcka värdefulla insikter
Kommunicera dina fynd till olika intressenter och hjälpa till att omvandla tekniska insikter till konkreta affärsstrategier
Utforska och experimentera med modern teknik för att förbättra våra processer. Du kommer balansera snabb experimentell utveckling med skapandet av strukturerad och underhållsbar kod för produktion




Enheten Data & Analys är en del av Ekonomifunktionen och arbetar tillsammans med IT-divisionen, samt nära med Strategi & Verksamhetsutveckling och Business Control som båda återfinns inom Ekonomi.




Förväntningar på den vi söker

En akademisk examen inom datavetenskap, statistik, matematik, fysik eller liknande område
Stark programmeringskompetens i Python och SQL
Erfarenhet av molnbaserade miljöer; kunskap om Azure Databricks är ett stort plus
Förståelse för agila arbetsmetoder och moderna utvecklingsprinciper som DevOps och CI/CD
En analytisk och nyfiken natur, med en passion för att lösa komplexa problem
Utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter och förmåga att göra tekniska koncept begripliga för icke-tekniska intressenter
Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift
Meriterande är erfarenheter av prediktivt underhåll







Ansökan och information

I den här rekryteringen samarbetar SJ med Jefferson Wells och Experis. Vid frågor är du välkommen att kontakta ansvariga rekryteringskonsulter Malin Magnusson, 076-7806864, malin.magnusson@jeffersonwells.se, och Anki Snis, 0703-775969, anki.snis@se.experis.com.




Urval sker löpande så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, dock senast den 15 mars 2025.







Om SJ AB

SJ är ett svenskt reseföretag som erbjuder hållbara tågresor i egen regi och i samarbete med andra. SJ är ett av Sveriges grönaste varumärken och en del av lösningen för att klimatmålen ska nås. Koncernens drygt 6 600 medarbetare i Sverige och Norge bidrar alla till ökat tågresande – SJ för Sverige framåt.

Title: AI Developer – Machine Learning & Image Analysis
Description:
Company Description

Ecobloom is at the forefront of AI-driven agricultural innovation. We develop intelligent monitoring solutions for controlled-environment agriculture, empowering growers with real-time insights into crop health, climate conditions, and predictive analytics. Our flagship product, EcoSense, leverages AI, machine learning, and advanced data processing to optimize yields and resource efficiency.




As we scale our technology, we are looking for an AI Developer to join our team and help drive innovation in predictive modeling, data analysis, and image-based crop monitoring. If you have a passion for AI and sustainable agriculture, this role is for you!




Role & Responsibilities

As an AI Developer at Ecobloom, you will:




✅ Develop and optimize machine learning models for predictive analytics in controlled-environment agriculture.

✅ Work on image processing and computer vision models to analyze plant health, growth patterns, and environmental conditions.

✅ Design and implement scalable data pipelines for collecting and processing sensor data from greenhouses.

✅ Deploy and maintain AI models using cloud platforms and cloud-based infrastructure.

✅ Collaborate with our software and hardware teams to integrate AI solutions into our core platform.

✅ Stay updated on the latest advancements in AI and agritech, ensuring we leverage state-of-the-art techniques.




Qualifications & Skills

We are looking for someone with:




🔹 Strong proficiency in Python and experience with Django for backend development.

🔹 Extensive experience with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn.

🔹 Hands-on experience with image analysis and computer vision (e.g., OpenCV, CNNs, segmentation models).

🔹 Solid knowledge of data science principles, predictive modeling, and time-series forecasting.

🔹 Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and cloud-based AI deployments.

🔹 Experience with database management (PostgreSQL, Firebase, or similar).

🔹 Bonus: Knowledge of IoT, sensor data processing, or reinforcement learning is a plus.




Why Join Ecobloom?




🌍 Impact: Work on cutting-edge AI solutions that improve sustainability in food production.

🚀 Innovation: Be part of a fast-growing company shaping the future of AI in agriculture.

🤝 Collaboration: Join a passionate and driven team working at the intersection of AI and agritech.

🏡 Flexibility: Hybrid/remote-friendly work culture.

Show more

Title: Junior Data Scientist - Marketing Technology
Description:
Are you able to transform raw data into valuable insights, have a strong business understanding, and enjoy solving challenging problems? Then this is an excellent opportunity to join our Data Science Team at our Stockholm office!




About the role

As a Junior Data Scientist at NoA Connect, you will help develop our data science offering by collaborating with internal and external stakeholders, identifying new business opportunities, and finding innovative solutions to complex problems. These solutions could range from classic data science problems, to building AI solutions, to constructing data pipelines.

You will be exploring, planning, and building solutions for internal cross-functional teams and clients. We strongly believe in being part of the client’s team and daily operations to be able to make the biggest impact possible.




Your background

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience
Experience in AI/ML
Experience in Python programming and SQL
Experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow and PyTorch) and deep learning techniques




It’s a plus if you also have…

Experience working with and managing stakeholders in complex projects. Preferably as a consultant
Have at least one certificate for GCP or Azure at professional level
Experience of Marketing Mix Modeling, predictive CLV and audience segmentation
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills




About us

NoA Connect is a part of The North Alliance – one of Scandinavia’s largest agency networks in design, media, and marketing. At NoA we believe that we are stronger together than as standalone agencies and that collaboration is the way to growth.




At NoA Connect, we help companies grow their business and people by transforming sales and marketing capabilities. Noa Connect has three business areas - Advisory, Performance (Bluebird) and Data & Analytics. We believe that a workplace should be a space where everyone feels welcome, no matter their background or unique perspectives. Simply put, we want people to enjoy working with us.




Our recruitment process

No need for a personal letter or a CV-document. Just provide us with the link to your LinkedIn profile and answer a few initial questions - that's it. Looking forward hearing from you!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Vill du vara med och forma framtidens AI-lösningar och driva innovation inom avancerad analys? Vi söker nu en Data Scientist som vill ta en central roll i att utveckla och implementera prediktiva modeller och algoritmer – från idé till produktion.

Om jobbet

Som en del av vårt dynamiska team kommer du att samarbeta med tvärfunktionella grupper för att förstå affärsbehov och skapa lösningar grundade i data och avancerad analys. Du får möjligheten att visualisera och kommunicera insikter på ett sätt som gör skillnad, samtidigt som du coachar och vägleder kollegor inom maskininlärning och AI. Vi befinner oss i en spännande fas där AI spelar en allt större roll i vår verksamhet, och vi behöver dig för att ta våra lösningar till nästa nivå!

Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:


Utveckla och implementera prediktiva modeller och algoritmer – från idé till produktion
Samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team för att förstå affärsbehov och skapa data-drivna lösningar
Visualisera och kommunicera insikter och analysresultat på ett tydligt sätt för olika intressenter
Vägleda och coacha kollegor Inom maskininlärning och AI samt förbättra utvecklingsprocesser
Hålla dig uppdaterad med de senaste trenderna inom AI och aktivt tillämpa nya insikter


Vem är du?

För att lyckas i den här rollen tror vi att du har en stark analytisk förmåga, är nyfiken och har ett brinnande intresse för AI, data och maskininlärning. Du trivs i en innovativ miljö där vi testar oss fram och bygger lösningar från grunden.

För att bli framgångsrik i denna roll ser vi att du har:


Erfarenhet av att sätta maskininlärningsmodeller i produktion samt av hela livscykeln; idé/experiment, produktionssättning, underhåll och monitorering
Gedigen kunskap i Python och SQL
Erfarenhet av försäkringsbranschen och förståelse för affären
Erfarenhet av MLOps och ETL-processer
En relevant utbildning inom Datateknik, Data Science, Matematik eller liknande


Det är även meriterande om du har:


Erfarenhet av MLFlow, Docker och molnbaserade lösningar (gärna Azure)
Förmåga att leda projekt inom AI och Data Science
Erfarenhet av att arbeta med API:er och strömmande data


Om oss

Välkommen till Sak på Länsförsäkringar AB, vi stolta över att vara i centrum av vår teknologiska utveckling. Vi levererar innovativa IT-lösningar som driver vår verksamhet framåt och säkerställer att vi alltid ligger steget före. Vårt team av dedikerade experter arbetar tillsammans för att skapa en IT-miljö som är både säker och skalbar, vilket möjliggör för våra affärsenheter att nå nya höjder. Vi är här för att göra skillnad, varje dag.

Vi är ett innovativt team på 14 personer som brinner för samarbete, kunskapsdelning och ny teknik. Majoriteten är data scientists, men teamet växer med AI Engineers, arkitekter och DevOps- Engineers. Vi leder AI-utvecklingen inom Länsförsäkring AB och skapar lösningar som gör skillnad. Hos oss blir du en nyckelspelare i en spännande resa där vi formar framtidens AI – vill du vara med? Sök idag!

Mer information

Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.

Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-03-28

Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-03-28

Title: Data Scientist, Sweden - BCG X
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our Data Scientists and Senior Data Scientist are part of our rapidly growing team to apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across industries to drive significant business impact. You'll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions.

Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders who are biased toward action, creative, and communicative.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Comfortable in a client-facing role with the ambition to lead teams
Likes to distill complex results or processes into simple, clear visualizations
Explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner
Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)
Significant experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data
Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and can translate this into business implications for our clients
Have strong project management skills


What You'll Bring

Technologies

Programming Languages: Python

#BCGXjob

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.
Show more
HTML:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our Data Scientists and Senior Data Scientist are part of our rapidly growing team to apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across industries to drive significant business impact. You'll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions.

Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders who are biased toward action, creative, and communicative.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following

  • Comfortable in a client-facing role with the ambition to lead teams
  • Likes to distill complex results or processes into simple, clear visualizations
  • Explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner
  • Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)
  • Significant experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data
  • Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and can translate this into business implications for our clients
  • Have strong project management skills

What You'll Bring

Technologies

Programming Languages: Python

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Leverage the power of machine learning to revolutionize sustainable shopping for millions of customers.




"We value your ideas and curiosity since they are key enablers to keep up with the ever-changing machine learning field." - Therese, Head of Machine Learning.




Sellpy’s vision is to empower everyone to live circularly. We see a tremendous financial, social and environmental value in making sure unused items are put to use again. We are looking for colleagues who share this vision, and who are ready to see their work contribute to a sustainable future.




Machine Learning at Sellpy

We look for you who want to be part of our journey to make sustainable shopping the first-hand choice by building great product recommendations, using computer vision to make the item handling process smoother and other user-friendly solutions. We want to provide the best customer experience and that’s why we need you on board.




This job will suit you if you’re excited to build solutions leveraging the latest machine learning models and build custom models to solve unique challenges together with a team of highly motivated engineers.




In short, you will

Build machine learning models with a major impact on our product
Simplify, build and improve our already existing models
Build solutions leveraging the latest machine learning development
Enjoy personal growth during our level-up days once a month
Keep up with ML development with the team on weekly deep dives
Make use of your skills in Tensorflow and Python




Requirements

B.S or M.S. degree in Computer Science or related field
Strong proficiency in Python
Experience with ML frameworks such as Tensorflow or PyTorch
Experience with AWS or similar cloud service providers
Written and spoken fluency in English




We’d be impressed if you have

Previous experience with recommender systems
Knowledge about how to build efficient data pipelines
Experience in setting up ML systems in production
Knowledge of relational databases and SQL




You’ll get to

Be part of a tech-minded company that's driving the change towards a sustainable lifestyle. In return, you will get direction, energy, and work on meaningful challenges on a daily basis.
Benefit from hybrid work from our offices at Medborgarplatsen, and from home.
Work with highly skilled and motivated colleagues.
Gain new skills with unlimited access to a learning platform
Spend time on personal development during monthly level-up days.
Enjoy Sellpy credits and staff discounts at Sellpy and the H&M brands (Arket, COS, Other Stories, Weekday and more).
Save up with a monthly pension plan.
Engagement in Sellpy’s social traditions with game nights, interactive planning days, guest speakers and other activities.




Location

You are welcome to do all these things at our office at Medborgarplatsen in Stockholm, and from home.




Form of employment: Full-time

Start: As agreed upon

Show more

Title: Älskar du Python & Django? Ansök via SSH!
Description:
Vill du jobba med Python och Django? Älskar du open source? Då vill vi gärna jobba med dig.

Ansök direkt i terminalen genom att SSH:a till join.5monkeys.se!

Från våra kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg och från våra distanskontor (remote!) tar vi fram storskaliga digitala tjänster åt våra kunder.

Vi har utvecklat några av Sveriges allra största Python/Django-baserade digitala tjänster. Genom att all utveckling sker tillsammans i team kan vi upprätthålla en mycket hög gemensam kunskaps- och kvalitetsnivå där vi lär oss av varandra.

Vi gillar modern testdriven utveckling med byggstenar såsom Docker, CI-verktyg och hög coverage.

Vi bidrar aktivt till flera open source-projekt. Du hittar några av våra projekt på GitHub: https://github.com/5monkeys

Du ansöker enklast direkt i terminalen genom att SSH:a till join.5monkeys.se. Välkommen!
Show more
