Title: AI Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Your Role In Our Mission

We are looking for an AI Engineer to help us take systems that understand large technical documents and turn them into code. This is a job of excitement and exploration, requiring AI expertise and software engineering skills to build complex systems. Knowledge of semiconductors is a plus.

At Normal Computing, you will contribute to cutting-edge machine learning applications across various aspects of our business, working on solutions from the early stages of research and development to production deployment for our customers.

Responsibilities


Contribute to AI projects from concept to production deployment
Design and build systems using large language models to process complex technical documents
Develop solutions for multi-modal data handling (PDFs, logs, tables)
Solve challenging AI and software engineering problems
Work with other teams to integrate AI into our products
Create robust AI evaluation frameworks
Develop strategies to manage AI-specific challenges (latency, variance, errors)
Keep up with AI advancements, especially in language models and multi-modal AI


What Makes You A Great Fit


Experience with engineering projects, ideally related to ML or AI
Strong software engineering skills, especially with distributed systems
Proficiency in Python and ML frameworks (PyTorch, Hugging Face)
Experience with prompt engineering and deploying language models
Ability to handle and preprocess large, diverse datasets
Understanding of AI safety and responsible development
Knowledge of AI evaluation and benchmarking
Clear communication of complex AI concepts


Bonus Points For


Experience deploying AI in production environments
Cloud platform knowledge for AI deployment
Familiarity with advanced AI techniques (few-shot learning, meta-learning)
Open-source AI contributions or relevant publications
Ability to balance AI innovation with production-ready systems
Adaptability in a fast-paced, evolving AI landscape


Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

Normal Computing is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

Accessibility Accommodations

Normal Computing is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please let us know at accomodations@normalcomputing.ai.

Privacy Notice

By submitting your application, you agree that Normal Computing may collect, use, and store your personal information for employment-related purposes in accordance with our Privacy Policy.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
We’re looking for a curious, solution-driven Senior Data Scientist to join our Core AI Team in the CTO Office, where we steer AI and data innovation across the company. With 2+ billion data points collected daily, you’ll have an enormous playground to build, experiment, and deploy advanced models that solve critical problems. Working alongside a team of experienced data professionals and software engineers, you’ll contribute to turning raw data into intelligent solutions that transform the construction industry.


Your contributions will be vital to our AI strategy, enhancing the ways we leverage data to facilitate effective decision-making. Whether you prefer working from one of our hubs in Copenhagen, Kolding, Aarhus, or Aalborg, or remotely from anywhere in Denmark, we offer a flexible setup designed for innovation. No relocation assistance is provided, but if you’re already here, this is your chance to work on one of the most exciting AI challenges in the industry.

What’s in it for you?
Join a cross-functional and collaborative team consisting of other data scientists, as well as data engineers, and software developers.
International environment with regular check-ins and social events across teams, departments and borders.
We take your personal and professional development goals seriously and we support them through training, coaching and mindfulness as well as with a clear feedback culture to assist you in identifying your strengths and opportunities. We do this by touching upon your impact on our triple focus: impacting yourself, impacting teams/relations and impacting the organisation/strategy.
Flexibility and hybrid working is not just a cliché to us or something we state in a job posting. We do offer you a flexible setup and believe that you best can structure how your routines look like. And once you have chosen how you work best, let us know what you need: we got you covered with the IT equipment you need for your work.
Turning the Tide. At Trackunit, we aim to create and contribute to an inclusive workplace. And this priority starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit. Learn more about TIDE and other DE&I initiatives here. 
Who are you ideally?
You have a couple of years of experience in applying data science and analytics techniques to solve product or business problems.
You have proficient programming skills in Python (Pandas, Scikit-learn, etc.).
You have experience working with SQL, cloud platforms, and big data frameworks (Spark, etc.).
With a blend of curiosity and creativity, you devise solutions that are applicable in real-life contexts.
Experience with Generative AI is a plus.

Don't meet every single requirement? No worries - this is what we're looking for ideally, but if you're truly interested in this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification, we encourage you to apply.


Primary responsibilities:
Design, develop, and implement data-driven solutions for Trackunit’s platform and software products.
Apply machine learning, statistical modeling, and data analytics to solve real world business challenges for our customers.
Work with large-scale datasets to generate insights and detect anomalies for fleet optimization.
Collaborate with engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders to define requirements and integrate data solutions into our applications.
Our hiring process

Don't waste your time on writing the perfect cover letter for the job. We want you to create an impact that matters, and that's not in the cover letter.


Virtual meet and greet. Meet with Sr Director of AI Leonhard Fricke, the leader of this position.
Personality-based interview. You will be asked to fill out an online personality assessment using use Hogan prior to the interview. Our Hogan assessment enables us to understand your abilities and how you align with our team culture. Instead of seeking 'appropriate' responses, the priority is to develop a meaningful exchange that illustrates your synergy with the Trackunit team.
Assignment-specific interview. We want you to get an insight into some of the concrete responsibilities related to the role. You will be given a case to prepare prior to the interview, and at the interview, you will present the case to relevant colleagues from across Trackunit, who you’ll also work closely with in the job.
If needed, throughout the process we will obtain references from former employers and do background checks for level specific, if you have not provided these yourself.
Offer presentation and walk-through. We’re lucky to have you!
Coming Together To Connect Construction

We’re committed to construction - a significant industry in the world. Over the past two decades, Trackunit has been pioneering technological progress within construction. Today, we are not only a leading IoT provider but a thought leader, supporting and promoting the agenda for an entire industry on a global scale.


We believe in taking a people approach in everything we do. Being human-centric is not restricted to our products – it’s a way of life at Trackunit. We’re proud to be a truly global team. Our colleagues get together in hubs spread across the globe, but we embrace the idea of working remotely and in environments that inspire you. Everything we do, we do it to eliminate downtime and build the most useful industry for the world.


The question is: Are you in?
Show more

The question is: Are you in?

Title: Data Scientist, Additive Manufacturing
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you passionate about Additive Manufacturing (AM) technologies and eager to work with large data quantities, process optimization and quality assurance?

Then this is a unique opportunity to bring your strong data science capabilities, programming skills and learning attitude into play to help us implementing new AM technologies for large-scale production in the LEGO Group!


Core Responsibilities

In this new position as Data Scientist, you will be responsible for correlating machine performance and process data with the purpose of improving AM part quality. More specifically, you will





Data Cleaning and Preprocessing Responsible for the preparation of collected data by cleaning, organizing, and redefining it into a suitable format for visualization and analysis. Assess large data quantities and ensure the dimensional reduction of these data is handled in a way that minimize the consequences of this reduction
Process Optimization Collaborate with engineers and production teams to optimize additive manufacturing processes based on data-driven insights, aiming to understand and improve process stability and part quality, as well as enable faster technology development cycles
Quality Assurance Drive the implementation of quality control algorithms and anomaly detection methods to supervise the Additive Manufacturing process and identify deviations or defects
Predictive Modeling Drive the development of models to predict process quality, potential defects, and forecast maintenance schedules using techniques like statistical analysis and machine learning
Communication and Visualization Ensure effective communication of findings and insights through data visualization and reports to multi-functional teams, customers and external partners to develop additive manufacturing solutions
Root Cause Analysis Engage in investigating and identifying the root causes of manufacturing process issues or failures by analyzing historical data, helping in continuous improvement efforts
Capabilities Building Support in building capabilities within the LEGO Group to develop and enhance data science skills, knowledge and expertise to expand our AM program and meeting organizational goals
Data Collection Support in setting up data extractions methods to gather data from various sources within the additive manufacturing process, including sensor data, machine logs, and quality control measurements




Play your part in our team succeeding

Additive Design & Manufacturing (AD&M) department is developing and maturing AM technologies in the LEGO Group. The department is doing research and development of design methodologies and technologies, production technologies, materials and applications. The focus is on both polymer and metal AM technologies and applications, in close collaboration with partners, with the aim to push and drive the AM industry and its technologies towards true large-scale manufacturing.

The AD&M Technology Maturing & Analytics team, are taking promising AM technologies and processes advancing them to a stage of high maturity and readiness for industrial implementation. The work includes optimizing and fine-tuning the technologies, conducting extensive testing and validation, and addressing any remaining technical challenges or limitations. You will collaborate closely with multi-functional teams, including engineers, data scientists, material experts and manufacturing technicians, to refine the processes, improve material properties, enhance system performance, and ensure reliability and repeatability. Further, you will also contribute to documentation, quality control procedures, and knowledge transfer to facilitate the successful integration of AM technologies and processes into an industrial production environment.

Do you have what it takes?

The ideal candidate comes with 2+ years of proven experience working with data analysis, modeling, statistics or similar, and have an education within Engineering, Data Science, Mathematics, Physics or equivalent. In addition, you have





Strong analytical skills being able to understand, analyze, and illustrate data
Proven experience with programming languages such as Python, R, etc.
Solid experience with data visualization platforms e.g. Microsoft Power BI
Knowledge about cloud services such as Microsoft Azure, and data engineering platforms such as Databricks
Understanding of different data infrastructures and data extraction methods and tools
A great teammate that strives to succeed in a constantly evolving and ambitious environment
Organized and structured, determined, proactive and out-going attitude
Excellent communication, partner management and organizational skills
Proficiency in English both verbally and written




It will be an advantage, but not a requirement, if you have





Experience with Big Data
Ability to construct Machine Learning models
Knowledge of AM technologies
Flair for innovation, development and creative thinking




The position is based in Billund, DK and relocation support is not offered for this role.

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.


Show more

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.

Title: Machine Learning Researcher
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Imagine working with cutting-edge machine learning models, crunching high frequency data sets and sparring with exceptional and fun colleagues, all while taking part in scaling our business even further.

Does this sound highly appealing to you? Then you might be our new Machine Learning Researcher at Alipes Capital.




At Alipes Capital, we have been the market leader in automating the financial markets since we started back in 2008, shaping a fully automatic natural language processing system for reading and interpreting financial news.




To accomplish our mission of being the best at what we do, we understand the importance of elevating our predictive modeling standards to the highest levels. Your work will involve leading the efforts in creating a world class modeling workflow, enabling the team to seamlessly turn massive data sets of financial information into mathematical models that accurately predict movements in the financial markets.




In doing so, you will get a chance to tackle a variety of software infrastructure challenges, such as:

Development and optimization of calibration and benchmarking frameworks
Building out and implementing best practices for data preparation and dataset generation pipelines
Prototyping and releasing novel predictive architectures, especially with respect to time-series models.




You will get instant validation of your work and experience short feedback cycles, where going from inception to deployment can be a matter of hours. There will be no red tape to cut and no sales people to consult.




About the team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued, and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with fourteen passionate quantitative researchers covering 6 nationalities – eleven PhD’s and three MSc’s with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning. We enjoy collaboration and are always willing to lend a helping hand. We are working alongside two other teams of software developers and traders that implement and conceive the mathematical models together with us. What makes this constellation work great is that all of the individual team members write code and understand that a seemingly trivial change can actually require a lot of work, and vice versa.




About you

Fluency within mathematics and statistics
Experience working with the full Machine Learning stack from data generation through model calibration and real-life validation and monitoring
Programming experience with Python, in particular data-wrangling and numerical programming
Proficiency with computer science fundamentals
A scientific and inquisitive mind




Nice to have

Experience working with ‘out-of-core’ datasets
Experience working with tools like PyTorch, Tensorflow, XGBoost and/or Catboost
Programming experience with languages like C# and C/C++
PhD or MSc degree in engineering, physics, computer science, mathematics or economics




What we can offer you

Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy
Exciting problems to solve
Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people
Nice office in central Copenhagen with a hybrid work model
Pension, Health Insurance and 30 days of vacation




Practicalities

To apply, please send us your CV and a cover letter telling us why you think this role is a great fit for you. If your profile looks like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.

If you have questions, you are welcome to write to us at quant_jobs@alipescapital.com. Please do not submit your application to this email address as our hiring team will not have visibility.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning/AI konsulenter
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Er du konsulent med erfaring i Machine Learning/AI, og er du bosiddende i Danmark, med minimum 5 års professionel erfaring fra IT relaterede projekter ude hos kunder, og har du ikke før haft kontakt med os, så kunne et partnerskab med emagine måske være interessant for dig?

emagine er et high-end konsulenthus med hovedkvarter i København, der leverer skræddersyede ydelser og ekspertise ved brug af et netværk af ekspertkonsulenter.

Som freelance konsulent kan du blive inddraget i opgaver, enten som ekspertrådgiver, som en del af et emagine team, eller som en betroet konsulent ude på opgave i en af vores kunders organisation.

I Danmark har vi kontorer i København, Aarhus og Aalborg, med over 900 konsulenter ude på opgaver lige nu. I Europa har vi over 5.000 konsulenter på opgave.

Tilmeld dig vores database og få muligheden for at arbejde med nogle af de mest innovative virksomheder i branchen.

At blive medlem af vores konsulentdatabase har mange fordele, herunder:


Adgang til en bred vifte af projekter med internationale virksomheder, så du kan anvende dine færdigheder og ekspertise til projekter, der betyder noget.
Opgaver, der matcher dine færdigheder og ekspertise, hvilket sikrer, at du arbejder på projekter, der stemmer overens med dine styrker.
Kurser og kompetenceudvikling på alle niveauer med særlig erfaring inden for undervisning i projekt- program- og porteføljeledelse.
Muligheder for at udvide din portefølje af projekter og fremme din karriere


Som konsulent med Machine Learning/AI kompetencer, bør du have erfaring med en del af følgende:


Artifical Intelligence (AI)
Machine Learning (ML)
Retrieval-augmented generation (RAG)
Python
Deep Learning
SQL
Neurale Netværk
Large Language Model (LLM)
Microsoft Azure AI Studio
AutoGen
Docker
R
Algoritmer
NLP Engineering
Kubernetes
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
KAYAK, part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG), is the world’s leading travel search engine. With billions of queries across our platforms, we help people find their perfect flight, stay, rental car and vacation package. We’re also transforming business travel with a new corporate travel solution, KAYAK for Business.

As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a travel company that operates a portfolio of global metasearch brands including momondo, Cheapflights and HotelsCombined, among others. From start-up to industry leader, innovation is in our DNA and every employee has an opportunity to make their mark. Our focus is on building the best travel search engine to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.

The Marketing Measurement team's mission is to improve KAYAK's ability to measure the efficiency of marketing efforts. This role works closely with marketing leaders to make better data-informed strategic marketing decisions.

As a Senior Data Scientist on this team, you will have the opportunity to develop the frameworks and roadmaps to tackle marketing measurement challenges in an efficient way, work with the stakeholders to align on priorities, and closely work your team to build the robust measurement and experimentation solutions!

In this role, you will:



Manage into end to end experimentation from formulating hypotheses, experiment design to collecting right data, doing power analysis to finally then implementing and analyzing experiment results
Support in the initiatives towards building a robust framework for efficiently creating and evaluating creative, bidding and landing page experiments
Develop new models and advanced analytics techniques to measure and optimize the marketing spend in a robust manner
Support the development of less senior scientists, collaborates with team members to assure timely delivery of high-quality work
Build standardized and scalable solutions, and lead from front in setting up the best practices



Please apply if you have:



Advanced degree (Masters, PhD) in Data Science, Statistics or a related field.
Extensive experience with data manipulation and extraction using relational databases (SQL)
Ability to write high quality, scalable, maintainable code (Python, R)
Strong story-telling and presentation skills to understand and communicate in the language of business partners, mostly within Marketing
Strong foundation in experimentation methods and causal inference techniques
Experienced in marketing science measurement methodologies like Causal impact, geo-lift on Google, and Marketing mix models
Proactive work style, needing minimal guidance and demonstrating good judgment
Has a keen sense of success criteria and demonstrates success through end-to-end QA. Independently adheres to strong testing and validation principles
Passionate about large data sets in marketing, finance, and economics. Skilled in paid marketing data, time-series analysis, econometrics, and regression models



Benefits:



Work from (almost) anywhere for up to 20 days per year
Focus on mental health and well-being:

Company-paid therapy sessions through SpringHealth
Company-paid subscription to HeadSpace
Company-wide week off a year - the whole team fully recharges (and returns without a pile-up of work!)
No meeting Fridays

Paid parental leave
Generous paid vacation + time off for your birthday
Paid volunteer time
Focus on your career growth:

Development Dollars
Leadership development
Access to thousand of on-demand e-learnings

Travel Discounts
Employee Resource Groups
6 weeks paid vacation
Pension plan contributions
Private health & life insurance
Lunch provided five days per week & breakfast once a week
Professional espresso machine
Awesome office in the city centre of Copenhagen
Monthly social events, yoga, Thursday bars


Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At OpenTable/KAYAK, we aspire to be a workplace that fosters inclusion and reflects the diverse communities we serve. Hiring people with different backgrounds and perspectives is critical to innovation and to how we deliver great experiences for our users, partners, and teams. We strive to be an open and welcoming environment so that no matter who you are, you can be yourself.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform job responsibilities, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation(s).

Title: Responsible AI Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you excited about using AI to improve patients' lives? Do you thrive on crafting and delivering high-quality solutions? Do you enjoy collaborating in a dynamic, multinational environment with experts from across various domains? Then you might be interested in joining the Responsible AI Team at Novo Nordisk as a technical expert on subject matters related to responsible AI (e.g., xAI, bias/fairness assessments, adversarial training, robust machine learning, validation strategies, model monitoring, and more). This is a full-time position, primarily located in Ørestaden, with flexible working options.

Behind the title
As an AI Scientist in the Responsible AI Team, you will help ensure that Novo Nordisk is at the forefront when it comes to good machine learning practices that set patient safety and privacy at the center. As a technical subject matter expert, you will help translate legal and regulatory requirements into technical solutions, including ensuring that there are well-established technical guidelines at Novo Nordisk for how to responsibly develop and use AI. You will have a pivotal role in ensuring that the company guidelines translate into operational actions on AI/ML solutions, as well as implementing responsible AI solutions and methods on both a use-case and toolbox level. Novo Nordisk has an established process for addressing legal requirements, and you will additionally take part in some of the focus groups and expert panels that are addressing regulatory requirements around AI/ML.

Your technical expertise will be a key aspect of developing compliant, robust, and effective AI/ML products and solutions throughout Novo Nordisk.

Your key responsibilities will be:



Assist AI teams across the entire Novo Nordisk value chain with developing and implementing responsible AI techniques and/or methods in specific use cases.
Participate in developing Novo Nordisk's Responsible AI toolbox with a collection of useful techniques and tools for responsible AI practices.
Write technical guidelines for how to develop responsible and compliant AI and foster adoption throughout Novo Nordisk.
Provide technical input and expertise in the design and execution of AI Governance at Novo Nordisk, especially in the context of the EU AI Act, FDA, and EMA.
Follow research developments within the sub-fields of responsible AI.
Publish open-access research on methods or subjects within responsible AI.
Participate in conferences, activities, and talks around the topic of responsible AI both internally and externally.
You will be working with cutting-edge technology across the Novo Nordisk value chain, from new and innovative drug research to clinical trial optimization, all the way to optimizing production facilities.




Which competencies to bring?
To succeed in this role, we imagine you tick most of the following:



A master's degree with 2+ years' relevant experience, or a PhD within computer science, applied mathematics, machine learning, or a similar field.
Hands-on experience with and a strong understanding of AI technologies and their practical implications.
Technical experience within at least one sub-field of responsible AI methods and knowledge of other sub-areas.
A strong interest in how to develop robust and effective machine learning products.
An understanding of, or willingness to learn about, data privacy and AI compliance and regulation. Experience in the pharmaceutical industry is a plus.
Ability to translate complex technical and regulatory concepts into clear and actionable guidance.




You are driven by a passion to help others, and you want responsibility and freedom. You are a team player and a great listener who thrives on complicated problems.

About The Department

The Responsible AI Team at Novo Nordisk is at the heart of AI governance and compliance, ensuring that AI technologies are used ethically, transparently, and in alignment with global regulations. Our team works closely with data scientists, AI engineers, legal experts, and regulatory professionals to establish governance frameworks, technical guidelines, and best practices that safeguard AI-driven innovation across Novo Nordisk.

By joining our team, you will play a pivotal role in shaping AI policies, driving regulatory discussions, and helping Novo Nordisk maintain its position as a leader in responsible AI within the pharmaceutical industry

Working at Novo Nordisk
Novo Nordisk is a global healthcare company headquartered in Denmark. For 100 years, we have been driving change to defeat diabetes and other serious chronic diseases. As a result, our treatments today benefit millions of people living with diabetes, obesity, and rare blood and endocrine diseases. We are proud of that.

We are proud of our people too, and we employ more than 67,000 bright and diverse minds in 80 offices worldwide. With us, your bright mind and commitment help us change lives for people worldwide. In exchange, we offer you a seat in a rewarding and purpose-driven culture where your professional and personal development is highly valued. That said, opportunities are many in Novo Nordisk. Discover the cutting-edge technologies behind Novo Nordisk's life-changing innovations.

Not the right job for you? Explore other digital areas within Novo Nordisk.
Even if this job is not the right match for you, Novo Nordisk might still have something to offer. Our many digital teams work in various areas of technology every day – from front-end to back-end, from artificial intelligence to machine learning, and from cloud systems to quantum computing. Our digital expert make a tangible impact on lives worldwide. Want to learn more about how we do this? Go explore on Tech.life at Novo Nordisk

Contact
For further information please contact Thomas Henckel at tyyh@novonordisk.com

Deadline
3 April 2025

Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, so you are encouraged to apply as soon as possible. You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.

Title: Data Scientist, Lystrup
Description:
Do you want to push the boundaries of AI and Machine Learning, building intelligent solutions that make a real impact for the Defense Industry?




Terma is at the forefront of an exciting journey, marked by growth, innovation, and the delivery of mission-critical solutions for the defense and aerospace industries. Our technologies provide safety and security for people on land, at sea, and in the air. In space, we contribute to pioneering missions that address emerging global challenges.




To support this mission, we are seeking a Data Scientist to join our Advanced Analytics team. This is more than just a job – it’s an opportunity to shape the future of defense technology and contribute to a safer world.




Your role in our team




Since early 2022, the global security landscape has evolved rapidly. Denmark, together with its NATO allies, is facing increasing challenges that demand innovative solutions. In this dynamic environment, the ability to deliver cutting-edge technology swiftly is essential. At Terma’s Advanced Analytics team, we develop and maintain AI-driven solutions that support decision-making and enhance situational awareness.




We are a passionate and dedicated team that takes full ownership of our AI products – from ideation to delivery and maintenance. Our work goes beyond coding; we collaborate closely with our customers to understand their needs, ensuring that our solutions make a real impact. This means you will engage directly with end users, gaining insights that go far beyond the traditional developer role.




You will be part of a team that values innovation, diversity, and psychological safety. We support and challenge each other, fostering an environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to meaningful solutions.




How you will make a meaningful contribution




As a Data Scientist at Terma, you will:

Develop advanced AI solutions – Work with sometimes large and sometimes small amount of data, leveraging deep learning models to push the boundaries of what’s possible.
Take ownership for data and AI modeling for key projects – Take responsibility for AI solutions that address real-world challenges in multi-domain operations (maritime, land, air, space, and cyberspace).
Ensure top-tier quality and security – You’ll be handling classified information and mission-critical systems, requiring both innovation and adherence to military-grade security standards.
Collaborate and engage with end users – Your work will directly impact defense operations, so understanding real-world applications is crucial.




This role is perfect for someone who is eager to take on responsibility, think outside the box, and be part of a team that values both skill and dedication.




Bring your world class expertise into play




Mindset and Team Culture:

You believe in teamwork and thrive in an environment built on mutual trust and collaboration.
You take ownership of your work, embracing challenges with a problem-solving mindset.
You are motivated by the impact of your work and excited about developing solutions that truly matter.
You enjoy an informal but professional work culture where ideas are shared, and learning is continuous.




Education & Experience:

A degree in Engineering, Physics, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
Strong technical skills, including proficiency in statistical analysis, machine learning algorithms, and AI/ML frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Experience with AI/ML deployment, programming (Python), data manipulation, and visualization tools.
Familiarity with Linux environments and containerization tools such as Docker.




Most importantly, we value passion and creativity – if you have funny hobby projects or unique experiences, we want to hear about them!




At Terma, you will be part of a company that not only pushes technological boundaries but also values its people. We are committed to creating an inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and empowered to contribute. If you are ready to take on exciting challenges, grow professionally, and be part of a team that makes a difference, we encourage you to apply.

Let’s build the future of defense technology together!

__________________________________________________________________________________




Benefits at Terma

At Terma, we prioritize the well-being of our employees, ensuring they are well taken care of. Joining our team comes with a multitude of perks designed to enhance your social life, cultural experiences, and health.

Development Opportunities: Benefit from a personalized development plan, access to our e-learning program, and specific career courses.

International Environment: Explore career opportunities with colleagues around the world.

Flexible Working Hours: Enjoy the opportunity to work flexible and the option to work from home up to two days per week. Internet connection at home is paid by Terma.

Comprehensive Benefits Package: Receive a 10% paid pension along with a beneficial health care and insurance package. Enjoy discounts from various business partners.

Well-being Perks: Opportunity to enroll in our on-site massage-offer

Social and Professional Events: Participate in various events including sports and talks, and join our book club, bicycle club, student network, wine club, motorcycle club, and more.

Competence networking across professional experts in Terma: Professional presentations and knowledge sharing across the organization

__________________________________________________________________________________




We encourage all individuals to apply for our job openings, as we are dedicated to fostering a diverse, equitable, inclusive, and welcoming workplace. Our commitment to these DEIB principles means we value and celebrate the unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences of each team member. We strive to ensure that every employee has equal opportunities to succeed, feels respected and valued, and experiences a strong sense of belonging within our organization.

We encourage you to leave out photo, age, and name.

We do not expect you to write an application, but please send us a motivated resume. To ensure that your application will reach us and is properly processed, we only accept applications via www.terma.com. Applications will be processed continuously.

__________________________________________________________________________________




Any unanswered questions?

Feel free to contact Hiring Manager on this e-mail: MJLA@terma.com in case of any further questions regarding this position.




Bear in mind that candidates for this position must be able to obtain a security clearance by the Danish Defense Intelligence Service. This entails that candidate, as a minimum, have stayed within NATO/EU for the last 7 years only interrupted by short stays abroad.




The Denmark based high-tech Terma Group develops products and systems for defense and non-defense security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry. TERMA | Allies in innovation

Title: Machine Learning Engineer, Computer Vision
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Machine Learning Engineer in our Computer Vision section, you will be a key part in delivery of the solutions into production. You will participate in the full lifecycle of the ML systems we build, while spearheading the model deployment, performance monitoring and maintenance, to ensure the reproducibility of our experiments and traceability of our pipelines in production. As part of the R&D team, you will be expected to keep up to date with the state-of-the-art in the ML/CV area as well as new techniques and processes.

Your background

We believe you…


Have 3+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, MLOps Engineer, or similar.
Have a proven track record of bringing machine learning models to production.
Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...


Python
PyTorch
C++
OpenCV
AWS
MLFlow
Kubernetes


We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...


Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
You’ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
Strong focus on diversity and inclusion – your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.


Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We’re looking for a curious, solution-driven Senior Data Scientist to join our Core AI Team in the CTO Office, where we steer AI and data innovation across the company. With 2+ billion data points collected daily, you’ll have an enormous playground to build, experiment, and deploy advanced models that solve critical problems. Working alongside a team of experienced data professionals and software engineers, you’ll contribute to turning raw data into intelligent solutions that transform the construction industry.




Your contributions will be vital to our AI strategy, enhancing the ways we leverage data to facilitate effective decision-making. Whether you prefer working from one of our hubs in Copenhagen, Kolding, Aarhus, or Aalborg, or remotely from anywhere in Denmark, we offer a flexible setup designed for innovation. No relocation assistance is provided, but if you’re already here, this is your chance to work on one of the most exciting AI challenges in the industry.




What’s in it for you?

Join a cross-functional and collaborative team consisting of other data scientists, as well as data engineers, and software developers.
International environment with regular check-ins and social events across teams, departments and borders.
We take your personal and professional development goals seriously and we support them through training, coaching and mindfulness as well as with a clear feedback culture to assist you in identifying your strengths and opportunities. We do this by touching upon your impact on our triple focus: impacting yourself, impacting teams/relations and impacting the organisation/strategy.
Flexibility and hybrid working is not just a cliché to us or something we state in a job posting. We do offer you a flexible setup and believe that you best can structure how your routines look like. And once you have chosen how you work best, let us know what you need: we got you covered with the IT equipment you need for your work.
Turning the Tide. At Trackunit, we aim to create and contribute to an inclusive workplace. And this priority starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit. Learn more about TIDE and other DE&I initiatives here.




Who are you ideally?

You have a couple of years of experience in applying data science and analytics techniques to solve product or business problems.
You have proficient programming skills in Python (Pandas, Scikit-learn, etc.).
You have experience working with SQL, cloud platforms, and big data frameworks (Spark, etc.).
With a blend of curiosity and creativity, you devise solutions that are applicable in real-life contexts.
Experience with Generative AI is a plus.




Don't meet every single requirement? No worries - this is what we're looking for ideally, but if you're truly interested in this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification, we encourage you to apply.




Primary responsibilities:

Design, develop, and implement data-driven solutions for Trackunit’s platform and software products.
Apply machine learning, statistical modeling, and data analytics to solve real world business challenges for our customers.
Work with large-scale datasets to generate insights and detect anomalies for fleet optimization.
Collaborate with engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders to define requirements and integrate data solutions into our applications.




Our hiring process

Don't waste your time on writing the perfect cover letter for the job. We want you to create an impact that matters, and that's not in the cover letter.




Virtual meet and greet. Meet with Sr Director of AI Leonhard Fricke, the leader of this position.
Personality-based interview. You will be asked to fill out an online personality assessment using use Hogan prior to the interview. Our Hogan assessment enables us to understand your abilities and how you align with our team culture. Instead of seeking 'appropriate' responses, the priority is to develop a meaningful exchange that illustrates your synergy with the Trackunit team.
Assignment-specific interview. We want you to get an insight into some of the concrete responsibilities related to the role. You will be given a case to prepare prior to the interview, and at the interview, you will present the case to relevant colleagues from across Trackunit, who you’ll also work closely with in the job.
If needed, throughout the process we will obtain references from former employers and do background checks for level specific, if you have not provided these yourself.
Offer presentation and walk-through. We’re lucky to have you!




Coming Together To Connect Construction

We’re committed to construction - a significant industry in the world. Over the past two decades, Trackunit has been pioneering technological progress within construction. Today, we are not only a leading IoT provider but a thought leader, supporting and promoting the agenda for an entire industry on a global scale.




We believe in taking a people approach in everything we do. Being human-centric is not restricted to our products – it’s a way of life at Trackunit. We’re proud to be a truly global team. Our colleagues get together in hubs spread across the globe, but we embrace the idea of working remotely and in environments that inspire you. Everything we do, we do it to eliminate downtime and build the most useful industry for the world.




The question is: Are you in?

Title: Data Scientist, Computer Vision
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Data Scientist in our Computer Vision section, you will develop and deploy deep learning models to improve the understanding, alignment and correspondence between 3D models of the construction site and video data gathered using our vSLAM system. As part of an R&D team, you will work on discovery of new solutions through research and rapid prototyping, and translating the findings into delivery of high quality solutions to complex computer vision problems.

Your background

We believe you…


Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
Have a hands-on experience with software development using C++, Python or C#. It is important that you have reached solid coding standards and strive for continuous improvement.
Have a machine learning experience or trained in the area. Hands-on experience with PyTorch and MLFlow is a plus.
Have computer vision experience or trained in the area. Hands-on experience with OpenCV is a plus.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...


C++
OpenGL
Python
PyTorch
MLFlow
Kubernetes


We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing
Show more
HTML:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Data Scientist in our Computer Vision section, you will develop and deploy deep learning models to improve the understanding, alignment and correspondence between 3D models of the construction site and video data gathered using our vSLAM system. As part of an R&D team, you will work on discovery of new solutions through research and rapid prototyping, and translating the findings into delivery of high quality solutions to complex computer vision problems.

Your background

We believe you…

  • Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
  • Have a hands-on experience with software development using C++, Python or C#. It is important that you have reached solid coding standards and strive for continuous improvement.
  • Have a machine learning experience or trained in the area. Hands-on experience with PyTorch and MLFlow is a plus.
  • Have computer vision experience or trained in the area. Hands-on experience with OpenCV is a plus.
  • Can work both independently and as part of a team.

Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...

  • C++
  • OpenGL
  • Python
  • PyTorch
  • MLFlow
  • Kubernetes

We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...

  • Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
  • An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
  • Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
  • You’ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
  • Strong focus on diversity and inclusion – your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
  • Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
  • Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.

Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Hørsholm, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to join the digitization journey of an international global cooperation? Do you want to use your experience in exciting projects within AI and machine learning? Then we might be looking for you!

What You Will Do

You will join Data & Analytics where you will work side by side with skilled Data Scientists and Data Engineers. The team is part of the global department IT & Digital Enablement (IT&DE) supporting the entire VELUX Group.

In the role, you will be working on exciting projects with high ambitions and visibility. You will do this in collaboration with colleagues within the team as well as colleagues and stakeholders from other functions in VELUX.

As Senior Data Scientist part of your responsibilities will be to mentor and guide more junior colleagues and to promote a culture of knowledge sharing within the team.

Your work and responsibilities will include:


Development of AI & GenAI platform
Development and implementation of advanced machine learning models for use in production processes (e.g., working with image recognition and explainable AI at scale)
Specific LLM initiatives (incl. agents) for automation purposes
Data pipeline development and optimization
Model monitoring and performance analysis (ML Ops)
Cross-functional collaboration on AI projects across business domains


You will be part of a global organisation and an international team and will be based at our Head Office in Hørsholm, Denmark. We utilise our available technology to work virtually and flexible but you can expect some travelling.

Who You Are

We are seeking candidates with solid experience in data science with great programming, as well as communication and collaboration skills. You have a high level of responsibility for individual work and teamwork and you are able to manage your own projects efficiently.

It is a requirement that you are fluent in English (spoken and written).

To meet the demands of the position, we are looking for you who have experience with the following technologies:


Python
TensorFlow / PyTorch
SQL
Docker
Kubernetes
Git
CI/CD pipelines


It is a benefit, but is not a requirement if you also know Snowflake & dbt, Azure, MLOps frameworks and Kafka or other streaming technologies

What We Offer

At the VELUX Group, we give you the chance to grow. To shape your own career. To work in an international environment. We offer you a world of opportunities – if you have the ability and the motivation to take them.

Our culture is characterised by an informal tone and respect for each other both as part of the team and as individuals. What is more, by joining us, you will be stepping into a truly international organisation with colleagues from a great variety of nationalities and backgrounds.

We offer a flexible work life, as we know there is more to life than work.

Application and contact

Read more about the VELUX Group at www.velux.com, where you can also learn more about working at our company and what to expect in our recruitment process.

We are looking forward to receiving your application and CV as soon as possible. We are reviewing candidates and inviting people for interviews on an ongoing basis.

All enquiries will be treated confidentially.

About VELUX

In the VELUX Group, we offer you a world of opportunities and the chance to create a bright future. From the forefront of the sustainable indoor living industry, we enable those who live, work and play under the roof transform their spaces and live a healthier everyday life with more daylight and fresh air.

The VELUX Group is an international, family-owned business with strong financial roots and each year we are able to create real impact by reinvesting in society, our employees and planet through our foundations.

Alongside the rest of our values, “courage” and “mutual respect” define our actions every day and how we wish to contribute to the world.

Equal Opportunity Employer

VELUX Residential is fully committed to the concept and practice of equal opportunity in all aspects of employment. To further our goal of equal employment opportunity for all employees and prospective employees, it is the policy of VELUX Residential to recruit, hire, train, and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, protected veteran status, national origin, sexual orientation, or any other basis prohibited by applicable law. All employment decisions shall be consistent with the principle of equal employment opportunity and only job-related qualifications will be required.

Title: Senior AI Engineer
Place: Kolding, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We’re looking for a curious, solution-driven Senior AI Engineer to join our Core AI Team in the CTO Office, where we steer AI and data innovation across the company. With 2+ billion data points collected daily, you’ll have an enormous playground to build, experiment, and deploy advanced models that solve critical problems. Working alongside a team of experienced data professionals and software engineers, you’ll contribute to turning raw data into intelligent solutions that transform the construction industry.


Your contributions will be vital to our AI strategy, enhancing the ways we leverage data to facilitate effective decision-making. Whether you prefer working from one of our hubs in Copenhagen, Kolding, Aarhus, or Aalborg, or remotely from anywhere in Denmark, we offer a flexible setup designed for innovation. No relocation assistance is provided, but if you’re already here, this is your chance to work on one of the most exciting AI challenges in the industry.

What’s in it for you?
Join a cross-functional and collaborative team consisting of other data scientists, as well as data engineers, and software developers
International environment with regular check-ins and social events across teams, departments and borders.
We take your personal and professional development goals seriously and we support them through training, coaching and mindfulness as well as with a clear feedback culture to assist you in identifying your abilities and opportunities. We do this by touching upon your impact on our triple focus: impacting yourself, impacting teams/relations and impacting the organisation/strategy.
Flexibility and hybrid working is not just a cliché to us or something we state in a job posting. We do offer you a flexible setup and believe that you best can structure how your routines look like. And once you have chosen how you work best, let us know what you need: we got you covered with the IT equipment you need for your work.
Turning the Tide. At Trackunit, we are committed to creating and contributing to an inclusive workplace. And this strategy starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit. Learn more about TIDE and other DE&I initiatives here.
Who are you ideally?
You have 5+ years of work experience applying data science and analytics techniques to solve product or business problems.
You are experienced in managing end-to-end model development, from research and prototyping to deployment and monitoring
You have practical experience with Generative AI, including agent solutions, LLM fine-tuning, prompt engineering, and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG)
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a passion for improving AI-driven user experiences
With a blend of curiosity and creativity, you devise solutions that are applicable in real-life contexts.

Don't meet every single requirement? No worries - this is what we're looking for ideally, but if you're super interested in this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification, we encourage you to apply.


Primary responsibilities:
Design, develop, and implement Generative AI solutions for Trackunit’s platform and software products
Work on composite AI by bringing together large-scale datasets and generative AI to enable fleet insights and optimization
Apply generative AI and machine learning to solve real world business challenges for our customers
Collaborate with engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders to define requirements and integrate AI solutions into our applications
Stay ahead of AI trends, contributing to Trackunit’s AI strategy and technology roadmap
Our hiring process

Don't waste your time on writing the perfect cover letter for the job. We want you to create an impact that matters, and that's not in the cover letter.

Virtual meet and greet. Meet with Sr Director of AI Leonhard Fricke, the leader of this position.
Personality-based interview. You will be asked to fill out an online personality assessment using use Hogan prior to the interview. Our Hogan assessment enables us to understand your abilities and how you align with our team culture. Instead of seeking 'appropriate' responses, the priority is to develop a meaningful exchange that illustrates your synergy with the Trackunit team.
Assignment-specific interview. We want you to get an insight into some of the concrete responsibilities related to the role. You will be given a case to prepare prior to the interview, and at the interview, you will present the case to relevant colleagues from across Trackunit, who you’ll also work closely with in the job.
If needed, throughout the process we will obtain references from former employers and do background checks for level specific, if you have not provided these yourself.
Offer presentation and walk-through. We’re lucky to have you!
Coming Together To Connect Construction

We’re committed to construction - an industry with a significant global influence. Over the past two decades, Trackunit has been pioneering technological progress within construction. Today, we are not only a leading IoT provider but a thought leader, supporting and promoting the agenda for an entire industry on a global scale.


We believe in taking a people approach in everything we do. Being human-centric is not restricted to our products – it’s a way of life at Trackunit. We’re proud to be a truly global team. Our colleagues get together in hubs spread across the globe, but we embrace the idea of working remotely and in environments that inspire you. Everything we do, we do it to eliminate downtime and build the most useful industry for the world.


The question is: Are you in?

Title: Machine Learning Infrastructure Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Imagine working with cutting-edge machine learning models, designing robust and scalable software infrastructure, and collaborating with dedicated colleagues — all while playing a key role in scaling our business even further.

Does this sound exciting? Then you might be our new Machine Learning Infrastructure Engineer at Alipes Capital.

At Alipes Capital, we have been a market leader in automating financial markets since our inception in 2008, pioneering fully automated natural language processing systems to read and interpret financial news.

To accomplish our goal of being the best at what we do, we are focused on building a world-class ML engineering workflow, ensuring seamless training, deployment and monitoring of our predictive models. Your work will be instrumental in further developing the infrastructure that transforms massive unstructured financial data sets into production-ready inference models that drive real-time trading decisions.

In doing so, you will get a chance to help develop scalable, high-performance ML systems, ensuring a seamless pipeline from dataset generation through model prototyping to production deployment.

Key responsibilities include:

Designing and optimizing infrastructure to support distributed model training and experiment tracking
Building and automating robust data pipelines for dataset generation and feature engineering, while enabling data version control
Developing software for rapid experimentation and deployment, including automated testing, continuous integration, and delivery
Implementing best practices in software development, ensuring maintainability, scalability, and efficiency of ML systems through automated testing and real-time monitoring,
Improving model deployment workflows, focusing on minimizing latency, ensuring reproducibility, and enabling fast iterations

You will get instant validation of your work and experience short feedback cycles, where going from inception to deployment can be a matter of hours. There will be no red tape to cut and no sales people to consult.

About the team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued, and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with passionate quantitative researchers covering 8 nationalities – fourteen PhD’s and three MSc’s with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning. We enjoy collaboration and are always willing to lend a helping hand. We are working alongside two other teams of software developers and traders that implement and conceive the mathematical models together with us. What makes this constellation work great is that all of the individual team members write code and are willing to engage on a deep, technical level of understanding.

About you

Fluency with computer science fundamentals – data structures and algorithms
Experience working with ‘out-of-core’ datasets and training distributed models
Experience with Python, in particular the data preprocessing, ETL pipelines and distributed systems
Familiarity with strongly typed languages like C# or C/C++ or Rust
A few years of experience in production-grade environments working with the full Machine Learning stack from dataset generation through model training and real-life validation and monitoring
Experience with distributed computing frameworks (for example Spark, Ray or Dask)
Familiarity with containerization technologies (for example Docker Compose or Kubernetes)

Nice to have

A scientific and inquisitive mind
Experience working with tools like PyTorch, Tensorflow, XGBoost and/or Catboost
Familiarity with algorithmic trading concepts
PhD or MSc degree in engineering, computer science, mathematics or physics

What we can offer you

Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy
Exciting problems to solve
Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people
Nice office in Nordhavn with a hybrid work model
Pension, Health Insurance and 30 days of vacation

Practicalities

To apply, please send us your CV and a cover letter telling us why you think this role is a great fit for you. If your profile looks like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.

If you have specific questions about the role, you are welcome to email us at quant_jobs@alipescapital.com. Please do not send in your applications to this email address, as our interview team will not have visibility to review.

Title: Expert Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID: 27380

Are you ready to help shape the future of AI & Generative AI at Scandinavia’s largest bank, working alongside a dynamic, fast-paced team?

The Group AI Center of Excellence is an established unit within Group Data Management focusing on delivering and enabling generative AI use cases across the organisation. The unit provides reusable AI Assets that are developed in conjunction with business stakeholders to be leveraged by a wide variety of use cases.

We are now looking for an Expert Data Scientist who is interested in working in the field of Generative AI with use-cases across the bank. You will work closely with data scientists, ML engineers, and business stakeholders to take AI and Generative AI applications from concept to production, ensuring they are developed in an ethical, safe, and sustainable way.

About This Opportunity

Welcome to the Applied Data Science team. Your passion for working with people from both a technical and a business background, coupled with your curiosity for AI and new innovations like Generative AI, makes you well-suited for this position. As Nordea pioneers its way into an AI and Gen AI driven future, you will thrive by embracing a dynamic environment, fostering collaboration, and maintaining an open and adaptable mindset.

What you will be doing:


Design and build scalable, reliable AI solutions, using existing assets or creating something new from scratch
Ensure our Generative AI applications are developed from idea to production, meeting all necessary requirements for smooth and successful deployment
Design and build internal and reusable AI Assets and Services to leverage in multiple use case development projects, accelerating its time to market
Integrate our systems with external tools, like vector databases, LLMs, and AI services. Your work will make sure everything plays nicely together!
Stay on top of cutting-edge technologies by exploring and recommending the latest and greatest AI tools and services. Your insights will keep us ahead of the curve!


Our AI team culture is built on collaboration, continuous learning and innovation. We foster an open environment where diverse ideas thrive, encouraging everyone to push the boundaries of technology while supporting each other´s growth. With a strong focus on well-being, we prioritize work-life balance and encourage open communication.

At Nordea, inclusion and diversity are at the heart of our values. We believe that a diverse workforce drives innovation, fosters creativity and creates a more supportive workplace for all. The role is based in Høje Taastrup, Helsinki, or Stockholm.

Who You Are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:


Embrace a growth mindset, where you enjoy taking initiative and bringing solutions
Enjoy problem solving, and tackling challenges
Are an awesome team member and you have a strong ability to inspire people to take action


Your experience and background:


BSc, MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Engineering Physics, relevant technical field
10+ years of experience in testing, maintaining, launching AI/ML products, working with MLOps best practices and DevOps environment (CI/CD pipelines, Docker, container orchestration)
Experience in training, evaluation, fine-tuning and deployment of predictive models; including feature selection, hyper-parameter tuning, error analysis and data visualisation
Experience in Generative AI (Large Language Models, Embeddings Models, building RAG and agentic solutions)
Experience working with public cloud providers (AWS, Azure or GCP), especially their serverless, generative AI (e.g., AWS Bedrock), ML (e.g., AWS SageMaker), or data storage services as well as Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
Skilled at transforming complex ideas into clear, engaging explanations—whether you're presenting to a technical team or breaking things down for non-experts


If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Next steps

We kindly ask you to submit your application as soon as possible, but no later than 23/03/2025 . We will ongoingly be reviewing applications and conducting interviews as we receive them, and might close the recruitment process before the posting end date. Any applications or CVs sent by email, direct messages, or any other channel than our application forms, will not be accepted or considered.

If you have any questions about the role or this recruitment process, please reach out to our tech recruiter and main point of contact Anna Dahlström, anna.dahlstrom@consult.nordea.com .

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

Only for candidates in Sweden: For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.com or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com .
