Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist & Developer to rock AI within Process Automation

Are you passioned about AI and developing software solutions that are implemented on a global scale and are you eager for new challenges? Would you enjoy working in an agile team that makes a huge difference in AI based automation projects? Then we have the job for you!

We invite you to join the Grundfos intelligent automation journey and bring your talent, innovation, curiosity and automation savviness to us to support digitalization in Grundfos.

What do we offer?

You will join our Intelligent Automation department that strive to optimize operational and core processes in Grundfos across different business functions through AI & Automation. The department is currently growing to be able to meet the increasing demand for AI and Automation in Grundfos. Your expert knowledge on how to leverage AI and Automation for business decision making and optimization is therefore needed. Our primary tech stack is within Azure, (Azure AI), Python programming and Blue Prism for RPA. The team works relentlessly to deliver production ready code, maintain high uptime and designing the future AI solutions to maximize the automation ratio in the business.

You will be part of a department that consists of 15+ developers, Data Scientists, Data Pipeline Engineers, Business Analysts, Product Owners, Scrum Masters etc. living and working from 5 different countries in Europe. You therefore get a very international and diverse working environment and a well-established virtual collaboration culture. If you are based in Denmark, you can meet face to face several times a week at the office in Bjerringbro with the Danish based colleagues. Travel is to be expected 1-2 times during the year to meet and collaborate with colleagues based in other countries.

What is the job about?

Your tasks will vary, and you can influence your task and involvement in projects according to your abilities and aspirations. Overall, your day-to-day tasks will evolve around:


Develop, maintain and deliver AI Automation Solutions, AI Agents and Automation services to Grundfos business functions
Develop software according to specified software development process (e.g. IT security, testability governance, Object oriented, template specific etc.).
Take ownership of technical deliveries according to system and solutions architecture, incl. documentation.
Drive software solution architecture within limited scope
Pioneer new technologies and Trends within AI Automations
Ensure system performance optimization.
Work effectively in a CI/CD pipeline
Participate in advisory services, application delivery, design, Development, implementation, maintenance, support, consultancy, and application integration with a solution area.
Optional: UI development
Optional: Data visualization in Power BI


What do you need to apply?

To succeed in this role, you need to have the ability to manage somewhat a high uncertainty and system complexity. We also expect a great deal of openness to learning and exploring new technologies and concepts while still delivering automations flows to the business. It is also important that you enjoy and are curious of agile ways of working.

Aside from this, we also make our evaluation based on the following:


Solid experience building and configuring solutions with AI (ML modelling, Deep Learning, LLM, tagging & labelling, retraining loops etc.)
Preferably, you have worked on a production ready software products with several AI components and task/process flows.
Experience with Python or similar
Experience with Azure (Azure AI Services, Logic Apps, azure functions etc.)
Experience with SQL
Experience with Data engineering or AI is considered an advantage
Experience with Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment
Good communicational skills in English in both speech and writing since this is our corporate language
Excellent analytical skills, qualifying you to understand your stakeholders' needs and thereby deliver the right solution


Why Grundfos

At Grundfos, we dare to do things that others cannot or dare not do. Our skills commit us to pioneer solutions to the world’s water and climate challenges and improve the quality of life for people. We believe innovation is not only a business opportunity, but an obligation. And what really matters to us is not short-term profit, but the impact we make. By becoming part of our united powerful team, you too can drive this change no matter your role.

Furthermore, we offer:


Flexible working hours and a wide range of employee benefits; up to 3 days’ paid leave for volunteering work.
Access to health and wellbeing initiatives, including events and leisure activities
Access to internal training and great opportunities for individual development


Additional Information

If you have questions or want to know more about the position, please contact the Head of Intelligent Automation, Ghita Sloth Poulsen on +45 3055 7699.

If this job sounds appealing to you, please send us your resume by clicking on ‘Apply for this job’.

If you want to dig deeper into the Grundfos universe, please visit us on LinkedIn or Youtube

We look forward to hearing from you.
Show more

Title: Applied Research Scientist - Digital Enterprise Transformation
Place: Hedehusene, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Req Number: 89881

Time Type: Full Time

Do you want to push the boundaries of machine learning and scale it to users across the world? Do you wish for a product centric work environment, where machine learning and analytics drive action – not just insight?

With a strong focus on the applied machine learning research discipline, you will take part in innovation and design of new products, as well as tweak and mature existing ones. You will join a team of highly talented data scientists and collaborate with several product teams consisting of product owners, backend- and frontend developers and DevSecOps specialists. You will be pushing the applied research agenda, aiming to create and continuously innovate the ML systems of tomorrow.

Join a department focused on our most valuable digital products

You will join the Research and AI Lab team in the Digital Enterprise Transformation department. Our new Research and AI Lab unit is characterized by having an intrapreneurial mindset, and is collaborating holistically with established MLOps, DevSecOps and

Data Science teams that have had ML systems in production on a global scale for several years. We strive to base our work on knowledge and insight rather than hierarchical structures, and we make sure that our decisions are based on conversations between people with different competencies rather than one individual.

Examples of what we have worked on in 2024:



Trained, tuned, and served large generative language models for document processing and for conversation using both text and multimodal data.
Designed a new large machine learning system set for release in early 2025.
Implemented and deployed an ‘attention-free’ transformer model, including functionality for large-scale model training and inference.



Current plans set for 2025:



Establish an industrial research presence, including publishing our work in relevant ML journals/conferences and collaboration with academic research institutions.
Become creators rather than consumers in GenAI and multimodal machine learning.
And more!



You thrive when solving highly complex challenges

The use cases we handle tend to have a high degree of complexity, requiring non-deterministic problem solving (i.e., the use of ML/AI), near real-time data processing, a need for high availability, vertical and horizontal scalability, and a very high volume of transactions. Solving complex problems with the use of machine learning, you need an open and analytical mind, finding pragmatic solutions that balance between the theoretical standpoint and what is possible .

Be the driver of our AI/ML and GenAI journey

As our Applied Research Scientist, your work will be multifaceted. We will work on our research agenda and push for new machine learning applications and methods, while ensuring this work is well-adopted by the existing teams for use in downstream products that will directly impact DSV’s divisions. You will have a mix of independent work and participate in existing project-focused teams.

Responsibilities:



Advance GenAI and multimodal research and development: Spearhead applied research in GenAI and multimodal machine learning, encompassing image, layout, and text/language modeling.
Drive applied research that can be applied to DSV’s product development. Drive cross-project innovation to tackle complex challenges and real-world problems to gain new insights and apply findings to enhance model performance and outcomes.
Foundational model development: Independently architect, train, and evaluate foundational models to advance GenAI LLMs and multimodal systems in DSV’s field of work.



Skills and experience we value and would love you to have already:



Educational Background: Preferably a PhD or master's degree in CS, CE, ML or a related field, with proven research experience.
Strong Theoretical Foundation: A comprehensive skill set in mathematics, statistics, and algorithms is essential for implementing research ideas, building upon existing research to create new, and adapting established work to our domain.
Software Development: A good understanding of core programming and development concepts: data structures, algorithms, and object-oriented programming. You will both be performing rapid prototyping and contribute to large collaborative machine learning codebases. We primarily use Python due to the high availability of machine learning frameworks.
Publications and Open-Source Contributions: Proven track record of first-author peer-reviewed publications that demonstrate your ability to lead research projects and navigate the publication process, along with contributions to open-source projects.
Model Development and Architecture: Proficiency in building from scratch, modifying and optimizing existing models and in advanced model architectures, particularly for GenAI and multimodal applications .
Accelerated and Distributed Compute: Proficiency in accelerated parallel computing, including scalable data processing and leveraging of GPU technology for enhanced performance and model training scalability. We use frameworks such as: PyTorch, Kedro, Apache Beam, and more.
Continuous Learning: Commitment to staying current with the latest advancements in machine learning and applying new academic insights to solve complex business challenges.
Practical Experience: Hands-on experience with large-scale, real-world machine learning projects.
Self-Starter & Ownership: We're looking for someone who is proactive, takes initiative, and can drive projects independently. You should be comfortable taking ownership of objectives and pushing things forward.



We understand that no candidate may meet every single requirement listed here. If you meet some of the qualifications, but not all, we still encourage you to apply! We're looking for passionate individuals who are eager to grow and contribute to our team.

What we offer to you:



Direct Communication: We engage directly with VP and C-level stakeholders, ensuring your insights and contributions are heard at the highest levels.
Influence on MLOps: Play a key role in shaping our mature, in-house MLOps platform, working with a dynamic and growing team.
Global Scale Experience: Leverage our extensive experience with ML systems in production on a global scale, benefiting from our experience in development and operations processes for large-scale machine learning systems.
A proven team: A group which is already self-financed based on realized returns of machine learning business cases.
Research and AI Lab: Be part of our new Research and AI Lab initiative, where you can influence methodologies, the direction, and the research agenda.



If you want to apply

We will be happy to answer any questions you may have regarding the position and about your options in DSV. You are welcome to call Ramus Kær Jørgensen on +45 25452587.

We look forward to receiving your application as soon as possible. We will process the applications as we receive them.

DSV – Global Transport and Logistics

DSV is a dynamic workplace that fosters inclusivity and diversity. We conduct our business with integrity, respecting different cultures and the dignity and rights of individuals. When you join DSV, you are working for one of the very best performing companies in the transport and logistics industry. You’ll join a talented team of approximately 75,000 employees in over 80 countries, working passionately to deliver great customer experiences and high-quality services. DSV aspires to lead the way towards a more sustainable future for our industry and are committed to trading on nature’s terms.

We promote collaboration and transparency and strive to attract, motivate and retain talented people in a culture of respect. If you are driven, talented and wish to be part of a progressive and versatile organisation, we’ll support you and your need to achieve your potential and forward your career.

Visit dsv.com and follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter.
Show more
HTML:
Job Req Number: 89881

Time Type: Full Time

Do you want to push the boundaries of machine learning and scale it to users across the world? Do you wish for a product centric work environment, where machine learning and analytics drive action – not just insight?

With a strong focus on the applied machine learning research discipline, you will take part in innovation and design of new products, as well as tweak and mature existing ones. You will join a team of highly talented data scientists and collaborate with several product teams consisting of product owners, backend- and frontend developers and DevSecOps specialists. You will be pushing the applied research agenda, aiming to create and continuously innovate the ML systems of tomorrow.

Join a department focused on our most valuable digital products

You will join the Research and AI Lab team in the Digital Enterprise Transformation department. Our new Research and AI Lab unit is characterized by having an intrapreneurial mindset, and is collaborating holistically with established MLOps, DevSecOps and

Data Science teams that have had ML systems in production on a global scale for several years. We strive to base our work on knowledge and insight rather than hierarchical structures, and we make sure that our decisions are based on conversations between people with different competencies rather than one individual.

Examples of what we have worked on in 2024:


  • Trained, tuned, and served large generative language models for document processing and for conversation using both text and multimodal data.
  • Designed a new large machine learning system set for release in early 2025.
  • Implemented and deployed an ‘attention-free’ transformer model, including functionality for large-scale model training and inference.


Current plans set for 2025:


  • Establish an industrial research presence, including publishing our work in relevant ML journals/conferences and collaboration with academic research institutions.
  • Become creators rather than consumers in GenAI and multimodal machine learning.
  • And more!


You thrive when solving highly complex challenges

The use cases we handle tend to have a high degree of complexity, requiring non-deterministic problem solving (i.e., the use of ML/AI), near real-time data processing, a need for high availability, vertical and horizontal scalability, and a very high volume of transactions. Solving complex problems with the use of machine learning, you need an open and analytical mind, finding pragmatic solutions that balance between the theoretical standpoint and what is possible .

Be the driver of our AI/ML and GenAI journey

As our Applied Research Scientist, your work will be multifaceted. We will work on our research agenda and push for new machine learning applications and methods, while ensuring this work is well-adopted by the existing teams for use in downstream products that will directly impact DSV’s divisions. You will have a mix of independent work and participate in existing project-focused teams.

Responsibilities:


  • Advance GenAI and multimodal research and development: Spearhead applied research in GenAI and multimodal machine learning, encompassing image, layout, and text/language modeling.
  • Drive applied research that can be applied to DSV’s product development. Drive cross-project innovation to tackle complex challenges and real-world problems to gain new insights and apply findings to enhance model performance and outcomes.
  • Foundational model development: Independently architect, train, and evaluate foundational models to advance GenAI LLMs and multimodal systems in DSV’s field of work.


Skills and experience we value and would love you to have already:


  • Educational Background: Preferably a PhD or master's degree in CS, CE, ML or a related field, with proven research experience.
  • Strong Theoretical Foundation: A comprehensive skill set in mathematics, statistics, and algorithms is essential for implementing research ideas, building upon existing research to create new, and adapting established work to our domain.
  • Software Development: A good understanding of core programming and development concepts: data structures, algorithms, and object-oriented programming. You will both be performing rapid prototyping and contribute to large collaborative machine learning codebases. We primarily use Python due to the high availability of machine learning frameworks.
  • Publications and Open-Source Contributions: Proven track record of first-author peer-reviewed publications that demonstrate your ability to lead research projects and navigate the publication process, along with contributions to open-source projects.
  • Model Development and Architecture: Proficiency in building from scratch, modifying and optimizing existing models and in advanced model architectures, particularly for GenAI and multimodal applications .
  • Accelerated and Distributed Compute: Proficiency in accelerated parallel computing, including scalable data processing and leveraging of GPU technology for enhanced performance and model training scalability. We use frameworks such as: PyTorch, Kedro, Apache Beam, and more.
  • Continuous Learning: Commitment to staying current with the latest advancements in machine learning and applying new academic insights to solve complex business challenges.
  • Practical Experience: Hands-on experience with large-scale, real-world machine learning projects.
  • Self-Starter & Ownership: We're looking for someone who is proactive, takes initiative, and can drive projects independently. You should be comfortable taking ownership of objectives and pushing things forward.


We understand that no candidate may meet every single requirement listed here. If you meet some of the qualifications, but not all, we still encourage you to apply! We're looking for passionate individuals who are eager to grow and contribute to our team.

What we offer to you:


  • Direct Communication: We engage directly with VP and C-level stakeholders, ensuring your insights and contributions are heard at the highest levels.
  • Influence on MLOps: Play a key role in shaping our mature, in-house MLOps platform, working with a dynamic and growing team.
  • Global Scale Experience: Leverage our extensive experience with ML systems in production on a global scale, benefiting from our experience in development and operations processes for large-scale machine learning systems.
  • A proven team: A group which is already self-financed based on realized returns of machine learning business cases.
  • Research and AI Lab: Be part of our new Research and AI Lab initiative, where you can influence methodologies, the direction, and the research agenda.


If you want to apply

We will be happy to answer any questions you may have regarding the position and about your options in DSV. You are welcome to call Ramus Kær Jørgensen on +45 25452587.

We look forward to receiving your application as soon as possible. We will process the applications as we receive them.

DSV – Global Transport and Logistics

DSV is a dynamic workplace that fosters inclusivity and diversity. We conduct our business with integrity, respecting different cultures and the dignity and rights of individuals. When you join DSV, you are working for one of the very best performing companies in the transport and logistics industry. You’ll join a talented team of approximately 75,000 employees in over 80 countries, working passionately to deliver great customer experiences and high-quality services. DSV aspires to lead the way towards a more sustainable future for our industry and are committed to trading on nature’s terms.

We promote collaboration and transparency and strive to attract, motivate and retain talented people in a culture of respect. If you are driven, talented and wish to be part of a progressive and versatile organisation, we’ll support you and your need to achieve your potential and forward your career.

Visit dsv.com and follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter.

Title: MLOps Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Pandora is the World’s largest jewellery brand, known for affordable luxury, innovative design and our high-quality craftsmanship. Founded in 1982 in Copenhagen, Denmark, by Per Enevoldsen and his wife Winnie, Pandora started as a small jewelry shop and has since grown into the globally recognized brand it is today.

At Pandora, we are transforming the retail experience by leveraging our vast data combined with cutting-edge technology. Our mission is to provide an exceptional shopping experience to our customers by leveraging data-driven insights and innovative solutions across our business. We are looking for a talented MLOps Engineer to join our dynamic team and help us shape the future of retail.

Job Summary:

As an MLOps Engineer at Pandora, you will play a play a critical role in deploying, monitoring, and optimizing machine learning models in production environments. The ideal candidate will bridge the gap between our AI Team and our Data Platform engineers, ensuring the seamless integration of ML models into scalable and reliable systems. In this role you will design and implement robust MLOps pipelines, automate model training and deployment processes, and monitor the performance of ML systems, including systems for GenAI. Your expertise in cloud platforms, containerization, and CI/CD tools will drive the operational efficiency of our AI and machine learning initiatives. We encourage creative problem-solving, continuous learning, and work-life balance in a supportive environment.

Key Responsibilities:


Design, develop and maintain end-to-end MLOps pipelines for model deployment, monitoring, maintenance, and scalability.
Automate the retraining, testing, and validation processes for ML models.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data science, software engineering and DevOps, to integrate ML models into production systems.
Monitor model performance, diagnose issues, and implement improvements.
Ensure scalability, reliability, and compliance of ML systems in production.
Optimize infrastructure costs while maintaining high system performance.
Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in MLOps, machine learning and AI, and apply new techniques to improve existing models and processes.



Qualifications:


Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or a related field.
Experience:
Solid experience as a MLOps Engineer, Machine Learning Engineer, DevOps Engineer, or similar role.
Experience in the retail industry or e-commerce is highly desirable.
Technical Skills:
Strong experience with Infrastructure as Code frameworks and languages (Terraform, Bicep or ARM)
Strong programming skills in Python and experience with ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.).
Hands-on experience with containerization (Docker) and orchestration tools (Kubernetes).
Proficiency in CI/CD tools and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud).
Knowledge of model monitoring and evaluation metrics.
Familiarity with version control systems, such as Git, and model versioning tools like MLflow or DVC.
Experience with Generative AI product deployment is desirable.
Experience with big data using Databricks, Snowflake, Apache Spark or Hadoop is desirable.
System level architecture understanding including scaling, MLOps, model/data monitoring, and ensuring a deterministic pipeline.
Soft Skills:
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
A proactive attitude and a passion for continuous learning and innovation.

Our Pandora Values:

We dream, are visionary and go beyond the obvious. 

We dare to pursue bold ambitions with courage and speed. 

We care deeply about each other, our customers and the planet we all share. Every day we strive to be a fulfilling workplace, where each of us can thrive and contribute, where talents can grow, and 

We deliver on our promises to colleagues, customers, partners and stakeholders.

We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you’re excited about this role, but do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply.

Did we get your attention

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Established in 1982, Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished jewellery made from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora’s products are available in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 6,500 points of sale, including around 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery at two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023. 

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery at two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023. 

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

Title: Integration Specialist
Description:
Integration Specialist søges til Cernel.ai

Er du vores nye kollega? Vi er på udkig efter en Integration Specialist, der kan være bindeled mellem kunder og udvikling. Som Integration Specialist hos Cernel bliver du en del af udviklingsteamet, hvor du skal være med til at definere og implementere kunders krav, levere robuste API-løsninger og drifte systemer.




Timer: Fuldtid

Tiltrædelse: Hurtigst muligt

Arbejdssted: Aarhus




Dine ansvarsområder vil være:

Planlægge og koordinere de tekniske dele af projektet for kunder, gennem kommunikation internt og med kunden.
Definere funktionelle og tekniske krav fra opstart til drift af integrationer
Indgå i udviklingen af interne og eksterne API’er.
Indgå i den løbende vedligeholdelse og drift af API’er og integrationer.
Undersøge muligheder for standardisering af integrationer på tværs af projekter, samt definere og dokumentere den tekniske proces for integrationer.




Hvad vi forventer af dig:

Du kan tale, læse og skrive dansk og engelsk på højt niveau.
En kodningsbaggrund er afgørende! En uddannelse er et plus, men vi værdsætter praktisk erfaring højere.
Du kommer med relevant og god erfaring med indenfor et moderne programmeringssprog som Python, Go eller C#. Erfaring med API-udvikling eller lignende er et plus.
Du er imødekommende og trives i daglig kommunikation med mennesker.




Om Cernel og teamkulturen

Cernel er på en mission om at automatisere gentagne opgaver for e-commerce virksomheder, ved hjælp af AI-agenter drevet af data. Du vil hjælpe med at aktivere e-commerce automatisering i stor skala, ved at implementere løsninger, der lader kunder overvåge, orkestrere og handle på deres egne data. Vi arbejder med mellemstore til store e-commerce virksomheder.




Vi værdsætter ærlighed, datadrevne beslutninger og ejerskab! Vores team samarbejder og trives med åben kommunikation. Du bør nyde ansvaret og autonomien ved at arbejde i en startup, da du vil blive en nøgleressource i opbygningen af ​systemet, der muliggør yderligere realisering af Cernels mission.




Du bliver en del af en ambitiøs start-up, hvor ideer hurtigt bevæger sig fra koncepter til designs. Ved at tillade os selv at eksperimentere og lave fejl, lærer vi hurtigt, og vi sikrer, at vi altid leverer den mest værdifulde løsning til vores kunder. Vores kultur er defineret af en fælles passion for teknologi og at give kunderne håndgribelig, meningsfuld værdi.




Test i rekrutteringsprocessenI

rekrutteringsprocessen bruger vi talenttest. Du vil derfor i løbet af processen modtage et link til testen.




Testen handler det ikke om at svare rigtigt eller forkert, men om at afdække hvorvidt din naturlige adfærd og styrker matcher den kontekst du skal arbejde i.K

an du genkende dig selv i opslaget? Så ser vi frem til at høre fra dig!




For mere information eller spørgsmål kontakt venligst mfe@cernel.ai eller på tlf. +45 42 28 24 16

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Who We Are

Zeta Global (NYSE: ZETA) is the AI-Powered Marketing Cloud that leverages advanced artificial intelligence (AI) and trillions of consumer signals to make it easier for marketers to acquire, grow, and retain customers more efficiently. Through the Zeta Marketing Platform (ZMP), our vision is to make sophisticated marketing simple by unifying identity, intelligence, and omnichannel activation into a single platform – powered by one of the industry’s largest proprietary databases and AI. Our enterprise customers across multiple verticals are empowered to personalize experiences with consumers at an individual level across every channel, delivering better results for marketing programs. Zeta was founded in 2007 by David A. Steinberg and John Sculley and is headquartered in New York City with offices around the world. To learn more, go to www.zetaglobal.com.

THE ROLE

Zeta Global is seeking a talented and versatile Machine Learning Engineer to join our newly formed Exchange team within our highly skilled development office in Copenhagen. This team plays a critical role in developing and deploying Zeta’s next-generation data science and engineering technology, collaborating closely with our global teams in New York, Berlin, and Prague. The Copenhagen office boasts a dynamic and focused environment, comprising a core group of start-up veterans and approximately 30 highly skilled professionals.

As a member of the Exchange team, you will contribute to the analysis, development and maintenance of our complex AI-powered ad-exchange platform, a sophisticated ecosystem of interconnected systems. This newly established team will tackle a continuous stream of challenging projects originating from across the organization, demanding a high degree of expertise and innovation. We are seeking candidates with a strong foundation in data science, machine learning engineering, and data analysis, and a demonstrated interest in exploring the intersections between these disciplines. As we are building production machine learning systems, experience or interest in software development principles, data engineering, and MLOps practices are highly desirable.

Responsibilities

The ideal candidate for the Machine Learning Engineer position at Zeta Global Copenhagen is a highly motivated and analytical individual with a passion for understanding complex systems. You are adept at using data to identify issues, formulate solutions, and develop robust algorithms and software. You thrive in an environment that offers significant autonomy in planning and executing your work, yet you are also a strong collaborator, readily engaging with fellow developers and international product stakeholders.

You will be involved in every stage of the development process, from initial brainstorming to ongoing maintenance, with a primary emphasis on analysis, prototyping, and development. Our development process is a dynamic blend of agile and rapid prototyping methodologies, designed to foster a culture of "flexibility under responsibility." We prioritize focused development time and believe in the power of collaborative problem-solving, encouraging team members to both seek and offer assistance readily.

Requirements

We welcome candidates with a solid background in data analysis or software development, seeking professionals with proven experience rather than recent graduates. Regardless of your background, a crucial element is your intellectual curiosity, self-motivation, and a demonstrable ability to translate real-world challenges into mathematical models, statistical analyses, algorithms, and ultimately, functional code. A strong interest in machine learning and/or the adtech domain, along with its associated technologies, is highly desirable, as well as knowledge of object-oriented programming languages, particularly Scala.


A strong academic background in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, or related disciplines).
Experience in developing and deploying machine learning models in production.
Proficiency in Python or Scala for machine learning and data processing.
Strong data analysis and feature engineering skills.
Experience with MLOps and building scalable ML pipelines.


Desired Qualifications


Demonstrated experience with Scala or Python for production-ready ML applications.
Software engineering experience, including best practices for code optimization and maintainability.
Knowledge of distributed computing frameworks like Spark for large-scale data processing.
Experience with model optimization techniques and hyperparameter tuning.
Familiarity with auction mechanisms and real-time bidding models.
Experience in market segmentation and audience targeting.
Experience using Airflow for ML pipeline orchestration.
AWS cloud expertise, including SageMaker and other ML-related services.


You approach problems with an analytical mindset and a pragmatic approach to solution development. You are a creative thinker, capable of identifying opportunities and weaknesses in proposed solutions, and constructively contributing your own ideas. You thrive in a dynamic environment, adept at juggling multiple projects and connecting them with underlying data. You recognize that exploring new facets of data often yields greater insights than fine-tuning algorithmic parameters. You are equally comfortable implementing and optimizing solutions, and you are eager to tackle new challenges.

What We Offer

Join our dynamic team, largely comprised of Masters and PhDs in fields like Physics, Math, and Computer Science, and play a key role in shaping the future of our technology. You will collaborate with highly skilled professionals in a stimulating environment that fosters both learning and individual initiative. While we are passionate about exploring cutting-edge technologies and algorithms, we maintain a practical approach to implementing solutions.

We believe in empowering our employees with autonomy and flexibility. We offer flexible work arrangements, including adjustable office hours and the possibility of occasional remote work, provided commitments are consistently fulfilled. You will have the freedom to select your preferred operating system (Linux, Mac, Windows) and development tools, with the expectation of independent maintenance and troubleshooting. We encourage the introduction of new technologies, contingent upon demonstrating their value and gaining team buy-in.

Our international presence provides ample opportunities for cross-departmental collaboration and potential career advancement in locations like Berlin, San Francisco or New York. This full-time position (37 hours per week) is based at our Copenhagen office, located at Bernstorffsgade 21. A competitive benefits package is provided, including lunch, telephone/internet, and health insurance. The ideal candidate will be available to start as soon as possible.

Interested candidates are encouraged to apply via LinkedIn, submitting a cover letter along with their application. Interviews will be scheduled on a continuous basis.

This is a hybrid role based out of Copenhagen.

PEOPLE & CULTURE AT ZETA

Zeta considers applicants for employment without regard to, and does not discriminate on the basis of an individual’s sex, race, color, religion, age, disability, status as a veteran, or national or ethnic origin; nor does Zeta discriminate on the basis of sexual orientation, gender identity or expression.

We’re committed to building a workplace culture of trust and belonging, so everyone feels invited to bring their whole selves to work. We provide a forum for employees to celebrate, support and advocate for one another. Learn more about our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion here: https://zetaglobal.com/blog/a-look-into-zetas-ergs/

ZETA IN THE NEWS!

https://zetaglobal.com/press/?cat=press-releases


Show more
HTML:
Who We Are

Zeta Global (NYSE: ZETA) is the AI-Powered Marketing Cloud that leverages advanced artificial intelligence (AI) and trillions of consumer signals to make it easier for marketers to acquire, grow, and retain customers more efficiently. Through the Zeta Marketing Platform (ZMP), our vision is to make sophisticated marketing simple by unifying identity, intelligence, and omnichannel activation into a single platform – powered by one of the industry’s largest proprietary databases and AI. Our enterprise customers across multiple verticals are empowered to personalize experiences with consumers at an individual level across every channel, delivering better results for marketing programs. Zeta was founded in 2007 by David A. Steinberg and John Sculley and is headquartered in New York City with offices around the world. To learn more, go to www.zetaglobal.com.

THE ROLE

Zeta Global is seeking a talented and versatile Machine Learning Engineer to join our newly formed Exchange team within our highly skilled development office in Copenhagen. This team plays a critical role in developing and deploying Zeta’s next-generation data science and engineering technology, collaborating closely with our global teams in New York, Berlin, and Prague. The Copenhagen office boasts a dynamic and focused environment, comprising a core group of start-up veterans and approximately 30 highly skilled professionals.

As a member of the Exchange team, you will contribute to the analysis, development and maintenance of our complex AI-powered ad-exchange platform, a sophisticated ecosystem of interconnected systems. This newly established team will tackle a continuous stream of challenging projects originating from across the organization, demanding a high degree of expertise and innovation. We are seeking candidates with a strong foundation in data science, machine learning engineering, and data analysis, and a demonstrated interest in exploring the intersections between these disciplines. As we are building production machine learning systems, experience or interest in software development principles, data engineering, and MLOps practices are highly desirable.

Responsibilities

The ideal candidate for the Machine Learning Engineer position at Zeta Global Copenhagen is a highly motivated and analytical individual with a passion for understanding complex systems. You are adept at using data to identify issues, formulate solutions, and develop robust algorithms and software. You thrive in an environment that offers significant autonomy in planning and executing your work, yet you are also a strong collaborator, readily engaging with fellow developers and international product stakeholders.

You will be involved in every stage of the development process, from initial brainstorming to ongoing maintenance, with a primary emphasis on analysis, prototyping, and development. Our development process is a dynamic blend of agile and rapid prototyping methodologies, designed to foster a culture of "flexibility under responsibility." We prioritize focused development time and believe in the power of collaborative problem-solving, encouraging team members to both seek and offer assistance readily.

Requirements

We welcome candidates with a solid background in data analysis or software development, seeking professionals with proven experience rather than recent graduates. Regardless of your background, a crucial element is your intellectual curiosity, self-motivation, and a demonstrable ability to translate real-world challenges into mathematical models, statistical analyses, algorithms, and ultimately, functional code. A strong interest in machine learning and/or the adtech domain, along with its associated technologies, is highly desirable, as well as knowledge of object-oriented programming languages, particularly Scala.

  • A strong academic background in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, or related disciplines).
  • Experience in developing and deploying machine learning models in production.
  • Proficiency in Python or Scala for machine learning and data processing.
  • Strong data analysis and feature engineering skills.
  • Experience with MLOps and building scalable ML pipelines.

Desired Qualifications

  • Demonstrated experience with Scala or Python for production-ready ML applications.
  • Software engineering experience, including best practices for code optimization and maintainability.
  • Knowledge of distributed computing frameworks like Spark for large-scale data processing.
  • Experience with model optimization techniques and hyperparameter tuning.
  • Familiarity with auction mechanisms and real-time bidding models.
  • Experience in market segmentation and audience targeting.
  • Experience using Airflow for ML pipeline orchestration.
  • AWS cloud expertise, including SageMaker and other ML-related services.

You approach problems with an analytical mindset and a pragmatic approach to solution development. You are a creative thinker, capable of identifying opportunities and weaknesses in proposed solutions, and constructively contributing your own ideas. You thrive in a dynamic environment, adept at juggling multiple projects and connecting them with underlying data. You recognize that exploring new facets of data often yields greater insights than fine-tuning algorithmic parameters. You are equally comfortable implementing and optimizing solutions, and you are eager to tackle new challenges.

What We Offer

Join our dynamic team, largely comprised of Masters and PhDs in fields like Physics, Math, and Computer Science, and play a key role in shaping the future of our technology. You will collaborate with highly skilled professionals in a stimulating environment that fosters both learning and individual initiative. While we are passionate about exploring cutting-edge technologies and algorithms, we maintain a practical approach to implementing solutions.

We believe in empowering our employees with autonomy and flexibility. We offer flexible work arrangements, including adjustable office hours and the possibility of occasional remote work, provided commitments are consistently fulfilled. You will have the freedom to select your preferred operating system (Linux, Mac, Windows) and development tools, with the expectation of independent maintenance and troubleshooting. We encourage the introduction of new technologies, contingent upon demonstrating their value and gaining team buy-in.

Our international presence provides ample opportunities for cross-departmental collaboration and potential career advancement in locations like Berlin, San Francisco or New York. This full-time position (37 hours per week) is based at our Copenhagen office, located at Bernstorffsgade 21. A competitive benefits package is provided, including lunch, telephone/internet, and health insurance. The ideal candidate will be available to start as soon as possible.

Interested candidates are encouraged to apply via LinkedIn, submitting a cover letter along with their application. Interviews will be scheduled on a continuous basis.

This is a hybrid role based out of Copenhagen.

PEOPLE & CULTURE AT ZETA

Zeta considers applicants for employment without regard to, and does not discriminate on the basis of an individual’s sex, race, color, religion, age, disability, status as a veteran, or national or ethnic origin; nor does Zeta discriminate on the basis of sexual orientation, gender identity or expression.

We’re committed to building a workplace culture of trust and belonging, so everyone feels invited to bring their whole selves to work. We provide a forum for employees to celebrate, support and advocate for one another. Learn more about our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion here: https://zetaglobal.com/blog/a-look-into-zetas-ergs/

ZETA IN THE NEWS!

https://zetaglobal.com/press/?cat=press-releases

Title: AI Engineer, Denmark - BCG X
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our AI Software Engineers and Senior AI Software Engineers are part of our rapidly growing engineering team and help to build the next generation of AI solutions. You’ll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions. Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Software Development, Large-scale Data Analytics And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Apply software development practices and standards to develop robust and maintainable software
Actively involved in every part of the software development process
Experienced at guiding non-technical teams and consultants in and best practices for robust software development
Optimize and enhance computational efficiency of algorithms and software design
Motivated by a fast-paced, service-oriented environment and interacting directly with clients on new features for future product releases
Enjoy collaborating in teams to share software design and solution ideas
A natural problem-solver and intellectually curious across a breadth of industries and topics


#BCGXjob

What You'll Bring

Technologies

Programming Languages: Python

#BCGXjob

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

Title: Junior Consultant - AI & Automation
Description:
The life sciences industry plays a significant role in advancing healthcare and improving the quality of life - in many cases, saving millions of lives globally. At BASE life science, this is the motivation for everything we do, aimed at pushing boundaries, seeking excellence, and making a lasting difference through consulting expertise and data-driven solutions.




Who is BASE life science?

Founded in 2007, BASE life science is a business and technology consulting enterprise working exclusively in the life sciences industry.




From our headquarters in Denmark and offices in France, Germany, Italy, Spain, Switzerland, the United Kingdom, and the United States of America, we serve customers across the globe. With a deep understanding of the life sciences industry, we work hand in hand with customers to identify, develop, and implement strategic initiatives that drive growth, efficiency, and overall success through tailored solutions.




Our partnership with industry-leading solution providers, including Veeva, Salesforce, IQVIA, Benchling, and MediSpend ensures that our clients harness the full potential of the most innovative solutions on the market.




About the role

Are you a passionate student in STEM eager to apply your skills in solving real-world challenges?




BASE life science is looking for 3-4 driven STEM students, currently in their 3rd year of undergraduate or 1st year of a master’s program, to join our AI and automation team on a part-time basis. This is a unique opportunity to work on innovative proof-of-concept projects within the life science industry, dedicating 12-20 hours per week with flexible scheduling around your exams. We are looking for the team to span the capabilities of a data scientist, data engineer and software developer.




As part of a small, dedicated unit, you will gain hands-on experience with a multitude of different technologies. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to interact with project managers, life science consultants, data scientists, cloud engineers, and software engineers across the globe, accelerating the development of state-of-the-art proof of concepts for the Life Science industry.




The right candidate will also get the opportunity to work directly on customer projects. This is a great opportunity to gain practical experience in cutting-edge technology and contribute to innovative projects in the Life Science field.




As a Junior Consultant your responsibilities include:

Develop and improve AI solutions and products we deploy at our customers.
Design and develop new innovative solutions together with our Life Science consultants that bring value to the Life Science Industry.
Collaborate with our Cloud and Software Engineering teams to set up cloud services and develop production-grade solutions.




We offer this position in Copenhagen, Denmark.




What makes you the best person for this job?




To be successful in this role, you have the following competences:

Experience developing software or performing data science tasks in Python.
Experience with other programming languages (e.g., Java and bash).
Experience or a keen interest in working with LLMs (OpenAI/Google) and generative AI.
Great problem-solving skills.
Work with complex problems in a structured way and being a part of a team.
Ability to communicate complex problems in a concise manner.
Strong verbal and written communication skills in English.




What makes us the best employer for you?

BASE life science has been recognized as an outstanding workplace, earning us the Great Place To Work certification in Denmark, France, Germany, Italy, Spain, Switzerland, and the United Kingdom.




We are proud to represent 35+ nationalities among our colleagues, and firmly believe in the power of diverse perspectives and characteristics to drive truly innovative solutions and achieving excellence.




At the heart of our organization lies a foundation grounded in five core values: team spirit, trust, openness, ambition, and execution. We cultivate an environment that champions flexibility, placing confidence in our employees to successfully complete tasks while upholding a healthy work-life balance. Additionally, we place significance in cross-functional collaboration, where niche skills and specialisms are valued and challenging the status quo is encouraged.




Additionally, we offer you:

Health insurance.

Remote work friendliness.

Ongoing learning and development.

Flexible schedules to fit your work to your routine.

Contributions to physical, social, and emotional health.

Home office setup with laptop and other electronic devices.

The chance to help make a difference for patients around the world.




Interested?

If you find this position intriguing, don't delay—submit your application in English at your earliest convenience. We are continuously reviewing and assessing all incoming candidates and eagerly await your application.




By submitting your application, you consent to the processing of your personal data by BASE life science for the purposes of recruitment and selection. This includes the collection, storage, and use of your personal data as outlined in our Privacy Policy.

Show more

Title: Backend Engineer, TypeScript/Node.js
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
It’s an exciting time to join Tactile. We're a diverse team of storytellers, puzzle enthusiasts and casual mobile game creators. Our story began in 2008 in the heart of beautiful Copenhagen, and since then we have experienced continuous growth, establishing ourselves as one of the largest gaming companies in Denmark. In more recent years, we have been scaling fast, in big part thanks to the success of a little game called Lily’s Garden. Now we’re on a mission to solidify our position as one of the leaders in creating out-of-the-ordinary casual puzzle games.







🚀 Your role & impact




We are currently growing our Core Team and are on the search for an experienced Backend Engineer to join the team of talented engineers supporting our live game operations (LiveOps).




The Core team at Tactile is responsible for building our entire backend infrastructure - all the tools, platforms and systems which are used to manage our game, data and marketing operations. As a Backend Engineer within our Core LiveOps team, you will be working on the business critical LiveOps dashboard, which is used by different teams within the business to evaluate and improve their day-to-day operations. You will also be creating new features and functionalities on our Game Web Services, which are important for improving players' in-game experiences, as well as working on our Build Server, the internal CI/CD solution for deploying our games.




We use a variety of technologies for our backend services. Our platform is written in TypeScript and Node.js, with MongoDB and BigQuery as the storage components. We use React to build our client side front-end. Strong knowledge of these technologies along with others that are similar is a great asset to this role.




📍 This role is based in our Copenhagen office. Please note that we cannot offer relocation support or visa sponsorship for this role.







Okay, let’s get a little bit more specific.

Here’s what you’ll be doing on the day-to-day as a Backend Engineer on our Core team:

Building new features and functionalities for for the tools and systems supporting our game development processes
Building and automating new games related systems
Improving, extending and monitoring back and front-end tools
Gaining a thorough understanding of the different shared backend technologies, and how they interact
Contributing to our data warehouse and analytics systems




To keep it short & sweet, as a part of our Core team, you'll be working with a modern stack:

TypeScript, Node.js & Express.js (as our main language and frameworks)
REST APIs
GCP
Docker
Kubernetes
CircleCI
MongoDB & Redis
BigQuery (for our big data pipelines)
DataDog (monitoring system)
Airflow
React.js
... and more! We do not expect you to know everything about this stack (we're not looking for unicorns), what matters most is that you enjoy working with and learning new technologies.




Practices & principles we cannot live without:

Clean coding practices
Code reviews
OOP
SOLID principles
Test driven development (TDD) & unit testing
Dependency Injection




What we're looking for:

🔥 Extensive experience (5+ years) in backend development with TypeScript and Node.js
Experience in working with high-load traffic systems
Experience in working within a bigger development team (4+ developers)
It's great if you also have experience with or an interest in working with front-end




What’s in it for you?

🌆 Beautiful office space with probably the best view in Copenhagen

🩺 Pension and private health insurance

💻 A chance to work with the latest tools and technology

📚 Opportunities for individual growth with development talks as well as workshops, books and courses

🌮 Daily, healthy organic breakfast and lunch prepared by our professional chefs in-house

🥳 Social activities, including game nights, book club, Friday bar and more

🔍 Free Danish lessons with our in-house Danish teacher







We look forward to receiving your application! 👋

Show more

🔍 Free Danish lessons with our in-house Danish teacher

Title: AI Solutions Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you an experienced professional, passionate about LLMs and NLP? Can you build production ready tools that bring value to decision-makers? If so, this is the perfect opportunity you.

What We Do

ADC is a Data & AI Consultancy committed to the responsible adoption of data and AI, driving real impact for organizations that matter. We help clients achieve their goals through data-driven solutions, with deep industry expertise.

What makes ADC unique is our impact-driven and collaborative approach. Our team is composed of top talent dedicated to leveraging their advanced data and AI expertise for the greater good. We work with our clients, not just for them, empowering pragmatic and comprehensive consultants through inclusivity, trust, and ownership. We aim to grow across Europe creating the leading data and AI consultancy. Join us on our growth journey!

What You Do


Deliver value to our clients by helping them develop the best data-driven solutions. These solutions can be strategic (e.g. companies that want to become more data-driven) and/or implementation-oriented (e.g. building AI agents, integrating AI models with clients’ systems, using AI for commercial excellence).
Translate complex business requirements into technical solutions. Align ML strategies with business objectives. Maintain strong client relationships and provide sparring on choice of solutions.
Work hands-on in the cloud: configuring/provisioning infrastructure, building CI/CD pipelines, and ensuring observability.
Collaborate with a team of professionals with whom you are building a fast-growing company.
Develop and challenge yourself during internal and external knowledge-sharing and training sessions.
Be a brand ambassador by embracing our company values: comprehensive, pragmatic, trust and ownership.


Requirements

What you bring:  


3-5 years of working experience in areas such as Data Science, Machine Learning, Advanced Analytics or Artificial Intelligence,
A quantitative degree (e.g., Physics, Mathematics, Econometrics, Data Science, AI, Computer Science)
Hands-on experience and understanding of processing unstructured (text) data, using NLP algorithms or LLMs
Software development skills and hands-on experience deploying to the cloud (e.g. provisioning infrastructure, CI/CD pipelines, monitoring)
Expertise in programming in Python
Consultancy experience is a big plus
Excellent command of the English language and communication skills (Danish is a big plus)


What We Offer


A steep learning curve through taking on responsibility from day one
Projects in which you can immerse yourself in challenges to make a positive impact
Freedom to realize your own initiatives and implement your ideas
A training programme focusing on your self-development, designed to transform people into trusted advisors, specialists, and ADC leaders
A knowledge-sharing culture in the form of peer groups, project presentations
Our Collective Week, a workcation with the entirety of ADC during which we work on pro bono projects and make unforgettable memories
A welcoming office space in the center of Copenhagen, with daily lunches provided by a nearby restaurant
Various social events, including Friday drinks, events, sports activities, etc.


What To Do Next

If you are inspired by this opportunity, apply at the link below! For questions, please contact us at recruitment@adc-consulting.com


ADC is an equal-opportunity employer. We value diversity and promote equality to shape a better future. No characteristics are discriminated against, as indicated in Directive 2000/78/EC. We encourage and welcome all applications. Additional arrangements or adjustments to support your application can be discussed further.
Show more
HTML:
Job Description

Are you an experienced professional, passionate about LLMs and NLP? Can you build production ready tools that bring value to decision-makers? If so, this is the perfect opportunity you.

What We Do

ADC is a Data & AI Consultancy committed to the responsible adoption of data and AI, driving real impact for organizations that matter. We help clients achieve their goals through data-driven solutions, with deep industry expertise.

What makes ADC unique is our impact-driven and collaborative approach. Our team is composed of top talent dedicated to leveraging their advanced data and AI expertise for the greater good. We work with our clients, not just for them, empowering pragmatic and comprehensive consultants through inclusivity, trust, and ownership. We aim to grow across Europe creating the leading data and AI consultancy. Join us on our growth journey!

What You Do

  • Deliver value to our clients by helping them develop the best data-driven solutions. These solutions can be strategic (e.g. companies that want to become more data-driven) and/or implementation-oriented (e.g. building AI agents, integrating AI models with clients’ systems, using AI for commercial excellence).
  • Translate complex business requirements into technical solutions. Align ML strategies with business objectives. Maintain strong client relationships and provide sparring on choice of solutions.
  • Work hands-on in the cloud: configuring/provisioning infrastructure, building CI/CD pipelines, and ensuring observability.
  • Collaborate with a team of professionals with whom you are building a fast-growing company.
  • Develop and challenge yourself during internal and external knowledge-sharing and training sessions.
  • Be a brand ambassador by embracing our company values: comprehensive, pragmatic, trust and ownership.

Requirements

What you bring:  

  • 3-5 years of working experience in areas such as Data Science, Machine Learning, Advanced Analytics or Artificial Intelligence,
  • A quantitative degree (e.g., Physics, Mathematics, Econometrics, Data Science, AI, Computer Science)
  • Hands-on experience and understanding of processing unstructured (text) data, using NLP algorithms or LLMs
  • Software development skills and hands-on experience deploying to the cloud (e.g. provisioning infrastructure, CI/CD pipelines, monitoring)
  • Expertise in programming in Python
  • Consultancy experience is a big plus
  • Excellent command of the English language and communication skills (Danish is a big plus)

What We Offer

  • A steep learning curve through taking on responsibility from day one
  • Projects in which you can immerse yourself in challenges to make a positive impact
  • Freedom to realize your own initiatives and implement your ideas
  • A training programme focusing on your self-development, designed to transform people into trusted advisors, specialists, and ADC leaders
  • A knowledge-sharing culture in the form of peer groups, project presentations
  • Our Collective Week, a workcation with the entirety of ADC during which we work on pro bono projects and make unforgettable memories
  • A welcoming office space in the center of Copenhagen, with daily lunches provided by a nearby restaurant
  • Various social events, including Friday drinks, events, sports activities, etc.

What To Do Next

If you are inspired by this opportunity, apply at the link below! For questions, please contact us at recruitment@adc-consulting.com

  • ADC is an equal-opportunity employer. We value diversity and promote equality to shape a better future. No characteristics are discriminated against, as indicated in Directive 2000/78/EC. We encourage and welcome all applications. Additional arrangements or adjustments to support your application can be discussed further.

Title: Data Engineer for ML Ops Area
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

In Data Science Platform Squad, we Build and maintain a generic, scalable and govern platform for Data Science model of online models to enable an automated, compliant and efficient Model Life Cycle process. We use technologies like Open-Shift to build Containerized platform for Hosting Model execution & Deployment.

Our squad is responsible for:


Hosting Python statistical and machine learning models. The solution is primarily serving the Data Science communities who develop the models, on behalf of the many enterprise domains in the bank.
AAPF (Advanced Analytical Platform for Fraud) is a platform in conjunction with CMDEP (Containerized Management Deployment and Execution platform) is designed to execute machine learning models to score payment transactions for fraud. Payment transactions include e-banking domestic/ international & District International models deployed in CMDEP.
Shaping the current On-Prem infrastructure into a Cloud-Native platform.


As a MLOps Data Engineer, you will work closely with the Product Owner and Chapter Lead in a "2 in a box" model, using agile methodologies. You will be responsible to develop and maintain scalable ML pipelines on futured MLOps platform built on AWS and Databricks. You will be tasked with ensuring seamless and automated transition of models from development to production using CICD workflows, implement the infrastructure as code. You will ensure that our machine learning models operate reliably, efficiently and at scale.

You will:


Design and implement automated pipelines for model training , validation and inference
Build and maintain CI/CD workflows using Github actions to ensure model code is versioned and seamlessly deployed to production
Utilize tools like MLflow for model tracking, versioning and ensuring reproducibility and compliance across the ML lifecycle
Use terraform to provision and manage scalable secure infrastructure required for ML workloads
Leverage docker containers to build, deploy and manage containerized ML services for both batch and real time inference
Work closely with data scientist, product owner and chapter lead with inn your tribe to understand model requirement and integrate the feedback into continuous MLOps pipelines
Follow the MLOps best practices and focused on automating ML workflows, troubleshooting production issues and optimizing the resources usage


About you:


Minimum of 2+ years of practical experience in MLOps, DevOps and Data Engineering role with focus on ML
In-depth knowledge of AWS services and Databricks, with a background in creating and managing ML pipelines
Proficiency in Python, Pyspark and strong SQL skills
Experience in CI/CD tools terraform and container orchestration
Problem solving and debugging skills
Solid understanding and practical experience with PubSub and Kafka streaming services
Upper-Intermediate English skills


“We believe that the most valuable asset is human potential.”

We offer:

If you are hired in Lithuania, the applicable salary range will be from 3120 EUR to 4680 EUR gross (based on your competencies relevant for the job).

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package which includes:


Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.
Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; additional health insurance; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.
Hybrid working conditions: Work from home up to two days a week; home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.
Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.
Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; IIIrd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.


See all the benefits HERE.

Your title in job contract will be IT Platform Engineer.

If you're interested in this role and joining my team, feel free to contact me - Dinesh Chaudhari via LinkedIn or email dinc@danskebank.dk, and I will answer your questions!

#DK

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Title: Data Enablement Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Role Overview

As a Data Enablement Engineer in the Data Engineering team, you'll play a crucial role in building and evolving our streaming-first, self-service data platform, enabling software developers, data scientists, analysts, and product teams to efficiently address complex operational and analytical challenges. Your contributions will directly influence data-driven decision-making and product innovation across the organization.

Specifically you will support internal teams’ adoption of the platform, creating reusable patterns, documentation, and providing consultative support for complex use-cases. You should expect that the role will involve a lot of hands-on data engineering (co-engineering/peer programming) initially.




About Us

At Ønskeskyen / GoWish, we are witnessing substantial growth with our innovative digital wish list application, which is gaining popularity both in Denmark and globally.




Location

Our office is located in the vibrant district of Nordhavn, Copenhagen, Denmark, where we foster an energetic work atmosphere. Our benefits include daily lunches, comprehensive health insurance, lively social events, and much more. This position is not remote. Relocation packages are not offerred.




Key Responsibilities

Initially, handle building the first set of stream/batch processing pipelines and reusable patterns to bootstrap self-service adoption.
Develop documentation, templates, blueprints, examples, and reference implementations for analysts and developers.
Conduct onboarding, training sessions, workshops, and ongoing enablement.
Support software developers and analysts when they face complex scenarios or edge cases.
Gradually shift from initial ownership to advisory/support as internal users gain maturity and autonomy.




Technical Experience

Stream Processing & Data Engineering:
Apache Flink, Apache Spark, Apache Beam
Experience in building and optimizing streaming/batch pipelines (transformations, aggregations, joins, enrichments).
Data Modeling & Schema Management:
Schema Registry, Avro, Protobuf, JSON Schema, schema evolution practices.
Data modelling (star-schema, OBT, semantic)
Analytical & Operational Use-Cases:
Understanding of analytical data use-cases, real-time dashboards, or operational applications.
Exposure to SQL and analytical tools (Databricks SQL, Snowflake, BigQuery, Looker, Tableau).
Exposure to DBT
Documentation & Communication:
Experience producing technical documentation, user guides, tutorials.
Strong ability to explain technical concepts clearly and concisely to varied audiences (analysts, engineers, managers).




Nice-to-Have

Proactive, customer-centric mindset—actively identifying user needs and gaps.
Excellent interpersonal skills to collaborate closely with internal users.
Experience delivering training sessions, workshops, or technical presentations.
Comfortable providing guidance and mentorship in complex situations.




Preferred Qualifications

3+ years of experience in Data Engineering, Analytics Engineering, or Developer Advocacy roles.
Past experience in an enablement, consulting, or advisory position strongly preferred.
Demonstrated track record of improving adoption and maturity of self-service data platforms.
