Title: Senior AI Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We’re looking for a curious, solution-driven Senior AI Engineer to join our Core AI Team in the CTO Office, where we steer AI and data innovation across the company. With 2+ billion data points collected daily, you’ll have an enormous playground to build, experiment, and deploy advanced models that solve critical problems. Working alongside a team of experienced data professionals and software engineers, you’ll contribute to turning raw data into intelligent solutions that transform the construction industry.




Your contributions will be vital to our AI strategy, enhancing the ways we leverage data to facilitate effective decision-making. Whether you prefer working from one of our hubs in Copenhagen, Kolding, Aarhus, or Aalborg, or remotely from anywhere in Denmark, we offer a flexible setup designed for innovation. No relocation assistance is provided, but if you’re already here, this is your chance to work on one of the most exciting AI challenges in the industry.




What’s in it for you?

Join a cross-functional and collaborative team consisting of other data scientists, as well as data engineers, and software developers.
International environment with regular check-ins and social events across teams, departments and borders.
We take your personal and professional development goals seriously and we support them through training, coaching and mindfulness as well as with a clear feedback culture to assist you in identifying your strengths and opportunities. We do this by touching upon your impact on our triple focus: impacting yourself, impacting teams/relations and impacting the organisation/strategy.
Flexibility and hybrid working is not just a cliché to us or something we state in a job posting. We do offer you a flexible setup and believe that you best can structure how your routines look like. And once you have chosen how you work best, let us know what you need: we got you covered with the IT equipment you need for your work.
Turning the Tide. At Trackunit, we aim to create and contribute to an inclusive workplace. And this priority starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit. Learn more about TIDE and other DE&I initiatives here.




Who are you ideally?

You have 5+ years of work experience applying data science and analytics techniques to solve product or business problems.
You are experienced in managing end-to-end model development, from research and prototyping to deployment and monitoring
You have practical experience with Generative AI, including agent solutions, LLM fine-tuning, prompt engineering, and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG)
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a passion for improving AI-driven user experiences
With a blend of curiosity and creativity, you devise solutions that are applicable in real-life contexts.




Don't meet every single requirement? No worries - this is what we're looking for ideally, but if you're super interested in this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification, we encourage you to apply.




Primary responsibilities:

Design, develop, and implement Generative AI solutions for Trackunit’s platform and software products
Work on composite AI by bringing together large-scale datasets and generative AI to enable fleet insights and optimization
Apply generative AI and machine learning to solve real world business challenges for our customers
Collaborate with engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders to define requirements and integrate AI solutions into our applications
Stay ahead of AI trends, contributing to Trackunit’s AI strategy and technology roadmap




Our hiring process

Don't waste your time on writing the perfect cover letter for the job. We want you to create an impact that matters, and that's not in the cover letter.




Virtual meet and greet. Meet with Sr Director of AI Leonhard Fricke, the leader of this position.
Personality-based interview. You will be asked to fill out an online personality assessment using use Hogan prior to the interview. Our Hogan assessment enables us to understand your abilities and how you align with our team culture. Instead of seeking 'appropriate' responses, the priority is to develop a meaningful exchange that illustrates your synergy with the Trackunit team.
Assignment-specific interview. We want you to get an insight into some of the concrete responsibilities related to the role. You will be given a case to prepare prior to the interview, and at the interview, you will present the case to relevant colleagues from across Trackunit, who you’ll also work closely with in the job.
If needed, throughout the process we will obtain references from former employers and do background checks for level specific, if you have not provided these yourself.
Offer presentation and walk-through. We’re lucky to have you!




Coming Together To Connect Construction

We’re committed to construction - a significant industry in the world. Over the past two decades, Trackunit has been pioneering technological progress within construction. Today, we are not only a leading IoT provider but a thought leader, supporting and promoting the agenda for an entire industry on a global scale.




We believe in taking a people approach in everything we do. Being human-centric is not restricted to our products – it’s a way of life at Trackunit. We’re proud to be a truly global team. Our colleagues get together in hubs spread across the globe, but we embrace the idea of working remotely and in environments that inspire you. Everything we do, we do it to eliminate downtime and build the most useful industry for the world.




The question is: Are you in?

Our colleagues get together in hubs spread across the globe, but we embrace the idea of working remotely and in environments that inspire you. The question is: Are you in?

Title: Softwareudvikler
Description:
Vil du være med til at drive den grønne omstilling i forsyningsbranchen?

Hos Systemate bidrager vi til en mere bæredygtig fremtid ved at udvikle innovative løsninger til forsyningsbranchen – én linje kode ad gangen. Vi har brug for din ekspertise for at fortsætte denne rejse.




Bliv en del af vores innovative produkt

Som en del af vores team får du muligheden for at arbejde med Settl – en moderne og fleksibel afregningsløsning, der er skræddersyet til energi- og forsyningsbranchen. Med Settl ønsker vi hos Systemate at hæve baren for et standardprodukt med en løsning, der er designet til at optimere vores kunders forretning gennem automatiserede processer, data, kvalitet og fleksibilitet. Vores mål er derfor at tilbyde kunderne den bedste afregningsløsning på markedet og samtidig bidrage til digitaliseringen af hele energi- og forsyningsbranchen.




Med et system, der konstant udvikles, vil du spille en central rolle i at forme produktet, så det tilpasses de skiftende krav i en branche i konstant udvikling. Du vil have indflydelse på produktets videreudvikling og være med til at skabe værdi for vores kunder.




Hvorfor Systemate er det rette valg for dig

Hos Systemate har vi skabt en kultur, hvor kvalitet er en integreret del af hele softwareudviklingsprocessen. Vi sikrer kvaliteten med over 30.000 automatiserede tests, der validerer hver eneste ændring i softwaren, inklusiv mange End-to-End scenarier.




Vi tror på, at software skal designes med fleksibilitet i tankerne, så det løbende kan tilpasses – fra arkitektur og teknologier til de funktioner, slutbrugeren benytter. Dette kræver et konstant fokus på regelmæssig levering af velfungerende software.




Vi anvender Continuous Delivery og releaser til vores kunder flere gange ugentligt for at minimere spild og justere retningen hurtigt gennem tidlig feedback fra brugerne.




Vi er overbeviste om, at de bedste løsninger skabes, når dem, der udvikler softwaren, tager ansvar. Derfor følger vores teams hele processen fra idé til produktion, og det er deres ansvar at sikre, at løsningen fungerer optimalt hos kunden.




Tech stak

Du kommer til at indgå i en teknologiportføjle, der består af:




Moderne .NET (.NET 6 og nyere) backend
React baseret frontend
En mikroservice arkitektur med REST APIer, Event Sourcing og CQRS
MongoDB som primær database-teknologi, men også event bus systemer, SQL databaser og andet
Driftsplatform i Azure
Domain Driven Design
Gitlab som CI platform
Octopus Deploy som leveranceplatform.




Dine opgaver

Udvikle og vedligeholde vores produkt, Settl i C# og .NET
Designe og udvikle mikroservices med fokus på fleksibilitet, skalerbarhed og pålidelighed
Arbejde med UX/UI-design i React
Samarbejde med teamet om opgaveløsning og bidrage til alle faser i udviklingsprocessen
Deltage i code reviews og være med til at sikre, at vi leverer det bedste produkt på markedet
Opbygge en forståelse for forsyningsbrancen, idet de bedste løsninger skabes, når udviklerne kender domænet og forstår kundernes behov.




Hvem du er

Vi forestiller os, at du har minimum 5 års erfaring med softwareudvikling.
Du har stærke kompetencer i C# og .NET – eller har mod på at lære det hurtig.
Du elsker at arbejde i teams, hvor vi hjælper hinanden med at finde de bedste løsninger.
Kendskab til REST-services og event-drevne systemer er et plus, men ikke et krav.
Ansvar og ejerskab er naturligt for dig.
Du er nysgerrig og klar til at tilegne dig ny viden, samt dele den med teamet – vi lærer alle hele tiden noget nyt.




Hvad vi tilbyder

En arbejdsplads i Aarhus Nord, hvor ambitionerne er høje, men tonen er jordnær. Du bliver en del af et team, der prioriterer godt håndværk, fordybelse i koden og ikke mindst kollegialt sammenhold.




Og så tilbyder vi selvfølgelig:

Fast løn- og pensionspakke med sundhedsforsikring.
Lækker frokostordning, frisk frugt, nødder og smoothies – samt en slikskuffe, der er svær at holde sig fra.
Fri kaffe, te og læskedrikke – så du aldrig løber tør midt i en god idé.
En aktiv personaleforening, der arrangerer alt fra LAN-parties og padel til firmafester og rejser.




Hvem vi er

Vi er en flok på mere end 60 passionerede udviklere og IT-entusiaster, der dagligt har dedikeret os til udelukkende at levere software til energi- og forsyningsbranchen.




Vi er ikke kun passionerede omkring det, vi laver, men også stolte over det fællesskab, vi har skabt, hvor vores kollegaer og den stærke kultur gør Systemate til en arbejdsplads, man ser frem til at være en del af hver dag.




Send din ansøgning i dag og bliv en del af vores team!

Hvis ovenstående lyder som noget for dig, så send os en ansøgning – eller giv Produktchef Lotte Foged Pedersen et kald på 41 11 56 05. Hun er altid klar til en uformel snak.




Vi indkalder løbende til samtaler, så vent ikke for længe – vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Show more
HTML:
Vil du være med til at drive den grønne omstilling i forsyningsbranchen?

Hos Systemate bidrager vi til en mere bæredygtig fremtid ved at udvikle innovative løsninger til forsyningsbranchen – én linje kode ad gangen. Vi har brug for din ekspertise for at fortsætte denne rejse.


Bliv en del af vores innovative produkt

Som en del af vores team får du muligheden for at arbejde med Settl – en moderne og fleksibel afregningsløsning, der er skræddersyet til energi- og forsyningsbranchen. Med Settl ønsker vi hos Systemate at hæve baren for et standardprodukt med en løsning, der er designet til at optimere vores kunders forretning gennem automatiserede processer, data, kvalitet og fleksibilitet. Vores mål er derfor at tilbyde kunderne den bedste afregningsløsning på markedet og samtidig bidrage til digitaliseringen af hele energi- og forsyningsbranchen.


Med et system, der konstant udvikles, vil du spille en central rolle i at forme produktet, så det tilpasses de skiftende krav i en branche i konstant udvikling. Du vil have indflydelse på produktets videreudvikling og være med til at skabe værdi for vores kunder.


Hvorfor Systemate er det rette valg for dig

Hos Systemate har vi skabt en kultur, hvor kvalitet er en integreret del af hele softwareudviklingsprocessen. Vi sikrer kvaliteten med over 30.000 automatiserede tests, der validerer hver eneste ændring i softwaren, inklusiv mange End-to-End scenarier.


Vi tror på, at software skal designes med fleksibilitet i tankerne, så det løbende kan tilpasses – fra arkitektur og teknologier til de funktioner, slutbrugeren benytter. Dette kræver et konstant fokus på regelmæssig levering af velfungerende software.


Vi anvender Continuous Delivery og releaser til vores kunder flere gange ugentligt for at minimere spild og justere retningen hurtigt gennem tidlig feedback fra brugerne.


Vi er overbeviste om, at de bedste løsninger skabes, når dem, der udvikler softwaren, tager ansvar. Derfor følger vores teams hele processen fra idé til produktion, og det er deres ansvar at sikre, at løsningen fungerer optimalt hos kunden.


Tech stak

Du kommer til at indgå i en teknologiportføjle, der består af:


  • Moderne .NET (.NET 6 og nyere) backend
  • React baseret frontend
  • En mikroservice arkitektur med REST APIer, Event Sourcing og CQRS
  • MongoDB som primær database-teknologi, men også event bus systemer, SQL databaser og andet
  • Driftsplatform i Azure
  • Domain Driven Design
  • Gitlab som CI platform
  • Octopus Deploy som leveranceplatform.


Dine opgaver

  • Udvikle og vedligeholde vores produkt, Settl i C# og .NET
  • Designe og udvikle mikroservices med fokus på fleksibilitet, skalerbarhed og pålidelighed
  • Arbejde med UX/UI-design i React
  • Samarbejde med teamet om opgaveløsning og bidrage til alle faser i udviklingsprocessen
  • Deltage i code reviews og være med til at sikre, at vi leverer det bedste produkt på markedet
  • Opbygge en forståelse for forsyningsbrancen, idet de bedste løsninger skabes, når udviklerne kender domænet og forstår kundernes behov.


Hvem du er

  • Vi forestiller os, at du har minimum 5 års erfaring med softwareudvikling.
  • Du har stærke kompetencer i C# og .NET – eller har mod på at lære det hurtig.
  • Du elsker at arbejde i teams, hvor vi hjælper hinanden med at finde de bedste løsninger.
  • Kendskab til REST-services og event-drevne systemer er et plus, men ikke et krav.
  • Ansvar og ejerskab er naturligt for dig.
  • Du er nysgerrig og klar til at tilegne dig ny viden, samt dele den med teamet – vi lærer alle hele tiden noget nyt.


Hvad vi tilbyder

En arbejdsplads i Aarhus Nord, hvor ambitionerne er høje, men tonen er jordnær. Du bliver en del af et team, der prioriterer godt håndværk, fordybelse i koden og ikke mindst kollegialt sammenhold.


Og så tilbyder vi selvfølgelig:

  • Fast løn- og pensionspakke med sundhedsforsikring.
  • Lækker frokostordning, frisk frugt, nødder og smoothies – samt en slikskuffe, der er svær at holde sig fra.
  • Fri kaffe, te og læskedrikke – så du aldrig løber tør midt i en god idé.
  • En aktiv personaleforening, der arrangerer alt fra LAN-parties og padel til firmafester og rejser.


Hvem vi er

Vi er en flok på mere end 60 passionerede udviklere og IT-entusiaster, der dagligt har dedikeret os til udelukkende at levere software til energi- og forsyningsbranchen.


Vi er ikke kun passionerede omkring det, vi laver, men også stolte over det fællesskab, vi har skabt, hvor vores kollegaer og den stærke kultur gør Systemate til en arbejdsplads, man ser frem til at være en del af hver dag.


Send din ansøgning i dag og bliv en del af vores team!

Hvis ovenstående lyder som noget for dig, så send os en ansøgning – eller giv Produktchef Lotte Foged Pedersen et kald på 41 11 56 05. Hun er altid klar til en uformel snak.


Vi indkalder løbende til samtaler, så vent ikke for længe – vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Title: Associate R&D Scientist - Material Development & Biomedical Interactions
Place: Humlebæk, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you ready to take the first steps in your career and gain all-round knowledge of and experience with polymer materials and biomedical interaction?

This is your chance to take up a graduate position specifically designed to develop your talent. We call it our 2-year Early Career Position. You will obtain both theoretical and hands-on experience in 2 international teams, working closely together to make a difference to people with intimate health care needs. After this period, we will guide you on how to make your next career step

Learn from experts in their field

At our HQ in Humlebæk, you will join our Adhesive & Sensor Technologies team of 12 colleagues your first year and our Preclinical team, consisting of 19 colleagues, your second year. Our two teams work closely together to develop the best products within Continence Care, Ostomy Care, Bowel Care, and Advanced wound dressing.

We pride ourselves on having a strong commitment to caring for each other, and we are looking forward to welcoming you into our community.

”Both teams are very international and diverse. We have a strong tradition for knowledge sharing, and you will learn from colleagues with a high degree of expertise,” says Lotte Klein, Head of Adhesive and Sensor Technologies.

2 years of learning – combining theory and hands-on tasks

You will spend your first year working on the formulation of pressure sensitive adhesives and material properties. Here, you will get to develop and test your own adhesive formulation. In the second year you will transfer to the Pre-Clinical department where you will learn what to take into consideration when evaluating skin adhesives in the biomedical interface, both in lab setting but also in clinical setting.

Specifically, during your 2 years, you will


Study literature on polymer materials and skin health
Carry out pre-testing of different materials in lab settings
Develop new adhesive recipes with different formulations
Do lab testing of adhesion and moisture-handling performance of the new adhesive recipes
Carry out preclinical lab testing of new adhesive recipes, e.g. on pig skin
Do clinical testing of new recipes on healthy volunteers




“Be ready to learn a lot and develop your skills as we guide you through theory as well as hands-on tasks. It’ll give you a good idea of the different ways of working – and the experience you need to make choices for your career going forward,” explains Lene Feldskov, Director of Pre-Clinical.

Have you recently graduated as a bio/chemical/polymer/medical engineer/scientist?

In this role, you need to be ready to work in a structured and data driven manner, allowing you to document your work. We have a culture where trial and error are a part of the way we work, so it is important that you are curious, ready to learn, and not afraid to try new things. Finally, we imagine that you


Have recently graduated as a bio/chemical/polymer/medical engineer/scientist
Are interested in materials/polymer development, and biomedical interface
Want to expand your knowledge and experience within performance testing, surface chemistry, skin properties, enzymes, bacteria, and spectroscopic methods (FTIR, Raman, AFM)
Are fluent in English




Interested?

If you would like to know more about the position, please reach out to Lotte Klein, Head of Adhesive and Sensor Technologies on +45 49 11 25 72 or Director, Pre-Clinical Lene Feldskov on +45 49 11 18 88. We will take candidates into the recruitment process continuously, so do not hesitate to apply. This position will remain open until a suitable candidate has been found.

Pursuing an ambitious growth agenda, Coloplast develops and markets products and services that make life easier for people with intimate healthcare needs. Employing about 16.000 people and with products available in more than 143 countries, we are one of the world´s leading medical device companies. We are constantly growing our business and always looking for new ways to move forward – we explore, learn and look for new ways of doing things.

Coloplast is committed to being an inclusive organization, where people bring their differences to work each day, fulfil their potential and have a strong sense of belonging because – and not despite – of their differences. We therefore encourage all qualified candidates to apply regardless of gender, age, race, nationality, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religious belief or physical ability.

Visit us on Coloplast.com .

Watch the film. Follow us on LinkedIn . Like us on Facebook .

Title: Data Scientist, Lystrup
Description:
Do you want to push the boundaries of AI and Machine Learning, building intelligent solutions that make a real impact for the Defense Industry?




Terma is at the forefront of an exciting journey, marked by growth, innovation, and the delivery of mission-critical solutions for the defense and aerospace industries. Our technologies provide safety and security for people on land, at sea, and in the air. In space, we contribute to pioneering missions that address emerging global challenges.




To support this mission, we are seeking a Data Scientist to join our Advanced Analytics team. This is more than just a job – it’s an opportunity to shape the future of defense technology and contribute to a safer world.




Your role in our team




Since early 2022, the global security landscape has evolved rapidly. Denmark, together with its NATO allies, is facing increasing challenges that demand innovative solutions. In this dynamic environment, the ability to deliver cutting-edge technology swiftly is essential. At Terma’s Advanced Analytics team, we develop and maintain AI-driven solutions that support decision-making and enhance situational awareness.




We are a passionate and dedicated team that takes full ownership of our AI products – from ideation to delivery and maintenance. Our work goes beyond coding; we collaborate closely with our customers to understand their needs, ensuring that our solutions make a real impact. This means you will engage directly with end users, gaining insights that go far beyond the traditional developer role.




You will be part of a team that values innovation, diversity, and psychological safety. We support and challenge each other, fostering an environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to meaningful solutions.




How you will make a meaningful contribution




As a Data Scientist at Terma, you will:

Develop advanced AI solutions – Work with sometimes large and sometimes small amount of data, leveraging deep learning models to push the boundaries of what’s possible.
Take ownership for data and AI modeling for key projects – Take responsibility for AI solutions that address real-world challenges in multi-domain operations (maritime, land, air, space, and cyberspace).
Ensure top-tier quality and security – You’ll be handling classified information and mission-critical systems, requiring both innovation and adherence to military-grade security standards.
Collaborate and engage with end users – Your work will directly impact defense operations, so understanding real-world applications is crucial.




This role is perfect for someone who is eager to take on responsibility, think outside the box, and be part of a team that values both skill and dedication.




Bring your world class expertise into play




Mindset and Team Culture:

You believe in teamwork and thrive in an environment built on mutual trust and collaboration.
You take ownership of your work, embracing challenges with a problem-solving mindset.
You are motivated by the impact of your work and excited about developing solutions that truly matter.
You enjoy an informal but professional work culture where ideas are shared, and learning is continuous.




Education & Experience:

A degree in Engineering, Physics, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
Strong technical skills, including proficiency in statistical analysis, machine learning algorithms, and AI/ML frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Experience with AI/ML deployment, programming (Python), data manipulation, and visualization tools.
Familiarity with Linux environments and containerization tools such as Docker.




Most importantly, we value passion and creativity – if you have funny hobby projects or unique experiences, we want to hear about them!




At Terma, you will be part of a company that not only pushes technological boundaries but also values its people. We are committed to creating an inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and empowered to contribute. If you are ready to take on exciting challenges, grow professionally, and be part of a team that makes a difference, we encourage you to apply.

Let’s build the future of defense technology together!

__________________________________________________________________________________




Benefits at Terma

At Terma, we prioritize the well-being of our employees, ensuring they are well taken care of. Joining our team comes with a multitude of perks designed to enhance your social life, cultural experiences, and health.

Development Opportunities: Benefit from a personalized development plan, access to our e-learning program, and specific career courses.

International Environment: Explore career opportunities with colleagues around the world.

Flexible Working Hours: Enjoy the opportunity to work flexible and the option to work from home up to two days per week. Internet connection at home is paid by Terma.

Comprehensive Benefits Package: Receive a 10% paid pension along with a beneficial health care and insurance package. Enjoy discounts from various business partners.

Well-being Perks: Opportunity to enroll in our on-site massage-offer

Social and Professional Events: Participate in various events including sports and talks, and join our book club, bicycle club, student network, wine club, motorcycle club, and more.

Competence networking across professional experts in Terma: Professional presentations and knowledge sharing across the organization

__________________________________________________________________________________




We encourage all individuals to apply for our job openings, as we are dedicated to fostering a diverse, equitable, inclusive, and welcoming workplace. Our commitment to these DEIB principles means we value and celebrate the unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences of each team member. We strive to ensure that every employee has equal opportunities to succeed, feels respected and valued, and experiences a strong sense of belonging within our organization.

We encourage you to leave out photo, age, and name.

We do not expect you to write an application, but please send us a motivated resume. To ensure that your application will reach us and is properly processed, we only accept applications via www.terma.com. Applications will be processed continuously.

__________________________________________________________________________________




Any unanswered questions?

Feel free to contact Hiring Manager on this e-mail: MJLA@terma.com in case of any further questions regarding this position.




Bear in mind that candidates for this position must be able to obtain a security clearance by the Danish Defense Intelligence Service. This entails that candidate, as a minimum, have stayed within NATO/EU for the last 7 years only interrupted by short stays abroad.




The Denmark based high-tech Terma Group develops products and systems for defense and non-defense security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry. TERMA | Allies in innovation

Title: Machine Learning Engineer, Computer Vision
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Machine Learning Engineer in our Computer Vision section, you will be a key part in delivery of the solutions into production. You will participate in the full lifecycle of the ML systems we build, while spearheading the model deployment, performance monitoring and maintenance, to ensure the reproducibility of our experiments and traceability of our pipelines in production. As part of the R&D team, you will be expected to keep up to date with the state-of-the-art in the ML/CV area as well as new techniques and processes.

Your background

We believe you…


Have 3+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, MLOps Engineer, or similar.
Have a proven track record of bringing machine learning models to production.
Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...


Python
PyTorch
C++
OpenCV
AWS
MLFlow
Kubernetes


We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...


Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
You’ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
Strong focus on diversity and inclusion – your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.


Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing
Show more
HTML:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Machine Learning Engineer in our Computer Vision section, you will be a key part in delivery of the solutions into production. You will participate in the full lifecycle of the ML systems we build, while spearheading the model deployment, performance monitoring and maintenance, to ensure the reproducibility of our experiments and traceability of our pipelines in production. As part of the R&D team, you will be expected to keep up to date with the state-of-the-art in the ML/CV area as well as new techniques and processes.

Your background

We believe you…

  • Have 3+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, MLOps Engineer, or similar.
  • Have a proven track record of bringing machine learning models to production.
  • Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
  • Can work both independently and as part of a team.

Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...

  • Python
  • PyTorch
  • C++
  • OpenCV
  • AWS
  • MLFlow
  • Kubernetes

We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...

  • Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
  • An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
  • Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
  • You’ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
  • Strong focus on diversity and inclusion – your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
  • Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
  • Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.

Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We’re looking for a curious, solution-driven Senior Data Scientist to join our Core AI Team in the CTO Office, where we steer AI and data innovation across the company. With 2+ billion data points collected daily, you’ll have an enormous playground to build, experiment, and deploy advanced models that solve critical problems. Working alongside a team of experienced data professionals and software engineers, you’ll contribute to turning raw data into intelligent solutions that transform the construction industry.




Your contributions will be vital to our AI strategy, enhancing the ways we leverage data to facilitate effective decision-making. Whether you prefer working from one of our hubs in Copenhagen, Kolding, Aarhus, or Aalborg, or remotely from anywhere in Denmark, we offer a flexible setup designed for innovation. No relocation assistance is provided, but if you’re already here, this is your chance to work on one of the most exciting AI challenges in the industry.




What’s in it for you?

Join a cross-functional and collaborative team consisting of other data scientists, as well as data engineers, and software developers.
International environment with regular check-ins and social events across teams, departments and borders.
We take your personal and professional development goals seriously and we support them through training, coaching and mindfulness as well as with a clear feedback culture to assist you in identifying your strengths and opportunities. We do this by touching upon your impact on our triple focus: impacting yourself, impacting teams/relations and impacting the organisation/strategy.
Flexibility and hybrid working is not just a cliché to us or something we state in a job posting. We do offer you a flexible setup and believe that you best can structure how your routines look like. And once you have chosen how you work best, let us know what you need: we got you covered with the IT equipment you need for your work.
Turning the Tide. At Trackunit, we aim to create and contribute to an inclusive workplace. And this priority starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit. Learn more about TIDE and other DE&I initiatives here.




Who are you ideally?

You have a couple of years of experience in applying data science and analytics techniques to solve product or business problems.
You have proficient programming skills in Python (Pandas, Scikit-learn, etc.).
You have experience working with SQL, cloud platforms, and big data frameworks (Spark, etc.).
With a blend of curiosity and creativity, you devise solutions that are applicable in real-life contexts.
Experience with Generative AI is a plus.




Don't meet every single requirement? No worries - this is what we're looking for ideally, but if you're truly interested in this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification, we encourage you to apply.




Primary responsibilities:

Design, develop, and implement data-driven solutions for Trackunit’s platform and software products.
Apply machine learning, statistical modeling, and data analytics to solve real world business challenges for our customers.
Work with large-scale datasets to generate insights and detect anomalies for fleet optimization.
Collaborate with engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders to define requirements and integrate data solutions into our applications.




Our hiring process

Don't waste your time on writing the perfect cover letter for the job. We want you to create an impact that matters, and that's not in the cover letter.




Virtual meet and greet. Meet with Sr Director of AI Leonhard Fricke, the leader of this position.
Personality-based interview. You will be asked to fill out an online personality assessment using use Hogan prior to the interview. Our Hogan assessment enables us to understand your abilities and how you align with our team culture. Instead of seeking 'appropriate' responses, the priority is to develop a meaningful exchange that illustrates your synergy with the Trackunit team.
Assignment-specific interview. We want you to get an insight into some of the concrete responsibilities related to the role. You will be given a case to prepare prior to the interview, and at the interview, you will present the case to relevant colleagues from across Trackunit, who you’ll also work closely with in the job.
If needed, throughout the process we will obtain references from former employers and do background checks for level specific, if you have not provided these yourself.
Offer presentation and walk-through. We’re lucky to have you!




Coming Together To Connect Construction

We’re committed to construction - a significant industry in the world. Over the past two decades, Trackunit has been pioneering technological progress within construction. Today, we are not only a leading IoT provider but a thought leader, supporting and promoting the agenda for an entire industry on a global scale.




We believe in taking a people approach in everything we do. Being human-centric is not restricted to our products – it’s a way of life at Trackunit. We’re proud to be a truly global team. Our colleagues get together in hubs spread across the globe, but we embrace the idea of working remotely and in environments that inspire you. Everything we do, we do it to eliminate downtime and build the most useful industry for the world.




The question is: Are you in?

Title: Data Scientist, Computer Vision
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Data Scientist in our Computer Vision section, you will develop and deploy deep learning models to improve the understanding, alignment and correspondence between 3D models of the construction site and video data gathered using our vSLAM system. As part of an R&D team, you will work on discovery of new solutions through research and rapid prototyping, and translating the findings into delivery of high quality solutions to complex computer vision problems.

Your background

We believe you…


Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
Have a hands-on experience with software development using C++, Python or C#. It is important that you have reached solid coding standards and strive for continuous improvement.
Have a machine learning experience or trained in the area. Hands-on experience with PyTorch and MLFlow is a plus.
Have computer vision experience or trained in the area. Hands-on experience with OpenCV is a plus.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...


C++
OpenGL
Python
PyTorch
MLFlow
Kubernetes


We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...


Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
You’ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
Strong focus on diversity and inclusion – your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.


Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Description:
We’re looking for a curious, solution-driven Senior AI Engineer to join our Core AI Team in the CTO Office, where we steer AI and data innovation across the company. With 2+ billion data points collected daily, you’ll have an enormous playground to build, experiment, and deploy advanced models that solve critical problems. What’s in it for you?
Join a cross-functional and collaborative team consisting of other data scientists, as well as data engineers, and software developers
International environment with regular check-ins and social events across teams, departments and borders.
We take your personal and professional development goals seriously and we support them through training, coaching and mindfulness as well as with a clear feedback culture to assist you in identifying your abilities and opportunities. Who are you ideally?
You have 5+ years of work experience applying data science and analytics techniques to solve product or business problems.

You have practical experience with Generative AI, including agent solutions, LLM fine-tuning, prompt engineering, and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG)

Don't meet every single requirement? No worries - this is what we're looking for ideally, but if you're super interested in this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification, we encourage you to apply.

Design, develop, and implement Generative AI solutions for Trackunit’s platform and software products
Work on composite AI by bringing together large-scale datasets and generative AI to enable fleet insights and optimization
Apply generative AI and machine learning to solve real world business challenges for our customers
Collaborate with engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders to define requirements and integrate AI solutions into our applications
Stay ahead of AI trends, contributing to Trackunit’s AI strategy and technology roadmap

Title: Growth Hacker
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We’re seeking an individual that’s obsessed about growth hacking, thinks creatively and can execute ideas end-to-end. We imagine this role being a mixture of marketing and sales enablement. We expect you to take the lead on creative initiatives to drive growth.

You’ll work closely with our technical and commercial team, so they can give you all the support you need to succeed.

About Pandektes

The volume of legislation and case law is growing exponentially, and legal professionals are now faced with navigating more data than ever before. At Pandektes, our mission is clear: to be the go-to platform for legal research and analysis.

We aim to empower legal professionals with precise, in-depth, and lightning-fast access to legal knowledge. Our research platform is built to simplify the complexity of legal research using artificial intelligence, intelligent search, and constantly updated legal sources.

How We Work

We’re a tight-knit team of talented software engineers, designers, commercial- and legal professionals that collaborate closely together on everything. We have an open communication culture and treat open and clear communication as absolutely paramount.

We believe that work should be both fun and serious and prioritise a large degree of personal freedom in how we work. This means trusting every team member to deliver fantastic results and communicating clearly.

Our team is based in Copenhagen and the role is in-office first.

About The Role

What you’ll do


Develop and execute growth initiatives on various channels (social media, content marketing, email campaigns, referral programs etc.).
Do Hubspot magic and 10x our current sales ops
Optimize the entire user journey to increase customer acquisition and general engagement
Be data-driven and drive a high performing growth strategy, experiment and do split tests for various hypotheses


Who You Are


Based in/near Copenhagen: This role requires physical presence in our CPH office.
Fluent in English (Danish and German is a big plus)
Proven experience in growth-, digital- or product marketing, preferably SaaS
Creative and not afraid of making mistakes, you would rather move fast and execute while learning
Ability to work independently, make data-driven decisions, and thrive in a fast-paced, scaling environment.


What You’ll Gain


The possibility to work in a high paced entrepreneurial environment with a lot of agency.
Competitive salary a great ESOP-program
Opportunity to grow and have a large impact in a high-growth early stage start-up.
A dynamic, inclusive, and collaborative work environment, where well being and high-energy is in focus. A place where ideas and contributions are valued, and can be implemented without hesitation.


How To Apply

Send your resume and include any ideas /initiatives you’d want to get started on right away.

We’re excited to meet motivated individuals eager to make an impact. Our hiring process consists of an initial screening call, followed up by an interview. We'll call in applicants continuously.

Join us and help revolutionize how legal research is conducted!
Show more
HTML:
We’re seeking an individual that’s obsessed about growth hacking, thinks creatively and can execute ideas end-to-end. We imagine this role being a mixture of marketing and sales enablement. We expect you to take the lead on creative initiatives to drive growth.

You’ll work closely with our technical and commercial team, so they can give you all the support you need to succeed.

About Pandektes

The volume of legislation and case law is growing exponentially, and legal professionals are now faced with navigating more data than ever before. At Pandektes, our mission is clear: to be the go-to platform for legal research and analysis.

We aim to empower legal professionals with precise, in-depth, and lightning-fast access to legal knowledge. Our research platform is built to simplify the complexity of legal research using artificial intelligence, intelligent search, and constantly updated legal sources.

How We Work

We’re a tight-knit team of talented software engineers, designers, commercial- and legal professionals that collaborate closely together on everything. We have an open communication culture and treat open and clear communication as absolutely paramount.

We believe that work should be both fun and serious and prioritise a large degree of personal freedom in how we work. This means trusting every team member to deliver fantastic results and communicating clearly.

Our team is based in Copenhagen and the role is in-office first.

About The Role

What you’ll do

  • Develop and execute growth initiatives on various channels (social media, content marketing, email campaigns, referral programs etc.).
  • Do Hubspot magic and 10x our current sales ops
  • Optimize the entire user journey to increase customer acquisition and general engagement
  • Be data-driven and drive a high performing growth strategy, experiment and do split tests for various hypotheses

Who You Are

  • Based in/near Copenhagen: This role requires physical presence in our CPH office.
  • Fluent in English (Danish and German is a big plus)
  • Proven experience in growth-, digital- or product marketing, preferably SaaS
  • Creative and not afraid of making mistakes, you would rather move fast and execute while learning
  • Ability to work independently, make data-driven decisions, and thrive in a fast-paced, scaling environment.

What You’ll Gain

  • The possibility to work in a high paced entrepreneurial environment with a lot of agency.
  • Competitive salary a great ESOP-program
  • Opportunity to grow and have a large impact in a high-growth early stage start-up.
  • A dynamic, inclusive, and collaborative work environment, where well being and high-energy is in focus. A place where ideas and contributions are valued, and can be implemented without hesitation.

How To Apply

Send your resume and include any ideas /initiatives you’d want to get started on right away.

We’re excited to meet motivated individuals eager to make an impact. Our hiring process consists of an initial screening call, followed up by an interview. We'll call in applicants continuously.

Join us and help revolutionize how legal research is conducted!

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Hørsholm, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to join the digitization journey of an international global cooperation? Do you want to use your experience in exciting projects within AI and machine learning? Then we might be looking for you!

What You Will Do

You will join Data & Analytics where you will work side by side with skilled Data Scientists and Data Engineers. The team is part of the global department IT & Digital Enablement (IT&DE) supporting the entire VELUX Group.

In the role, you will be working on exciting projects with high ambitions and visibility. You will do this in collaboration with colleagues within the team as well as colleagues and stakeholders from other functions in VELUX.

As Senior Data Scientist part of your responsibilities will be to mentor and guide more junior colleagues and to promote a culture of knowledge sharing within the team.

Your work and responsibilities will include:


Development of AI & GenAI platform
Development and implementation of advanced machine learning models for use in production processes (e.g., working with image recognition and explainable AI at scale)
Specific LLM initiatives (incl. agents) for automation purposes
Data pipeline development and optimization
Model monitoring and performance analysis (ML Ops)
Cross-functional collaboration on AI projects across business domains


You will be part of a global organisation and an international team and will be based at our Head Office in Hørsholm, Denmark. We utilise our available technology to work virtually and flexible but you can expect some travelling.

Who You Are

We are seeking candidates with solid experience in data science with great programming, as well as communication and collaboration skills. You have a high level of responsibility for individual work and teamwork and you are able to manage your own projects efficiently.

It is a requirement that you are fluent in English (spoken and written).

To meet the demands of the position, we are looking for you who have experience with the following technologies:


Python
TensorFlow / PyTorch
SQL
Docker
Kubernetes
Git
CI/CD pipelines


It is a benefit, but is not a requirement if you also know Snowflake & dbt, Azure, MLOps frameworks and Kafka or other streaming technologies

What We Offer

At the VELUX Group, we give you the chance to grow. To shape your own career. To work in an international environment. We offer you a world of opportunities – if you have the ability and the motivation to take them.

Our culture is characterised by an informal tone and respect for each other both as part of the team and as individuals. What is more, by joining us, you will be stepping into a truly international organisation with colleagues from a great variety of nationalities and backgrounds.

We offer a flexible work life, as we know there is more to life than work.

Application and contact

Read more about the VELUX Group at www.velux.com, where you can also learn more about working at our company and what to expect in our recruitment process.

We are looking forward to receiving your application and CV as soon as possible. We are reviewing candidates and inviting people for interviews on an ongoing basis.

All enquiries will be treated confidentially.

About VELUX

In the VELUX Group, we offer you a world of opportunities and the chance to create a bright future. From the forefront of the sustainable indoor living industry, we enable those who live, work and play under the roof transform their spaces and live a healthier everyday life with more daylight and fresh air.

The VELUX Group is an international, family-owned business with strong financial roots and each year we are able to create real impact by reinvesting in society, our employees and planet through our foundations.

Alongside the rest of our values, “courage” and “mutual respect” define our actions every day and how we wish to contribute to the world.

Equal Opportunity Employer

VELUX Residential is fully committed to the concept and practice of equal opportunity in all aspects of employment. To further our goal of equal employment opportunity for all employees and prospective employees, it is the policy of VELUX Residential to recruit, hire, train, and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, protected veteran status, national origin, sexual orientation, or any other basis prohibited by applicable law. All employment decisions shall be consistent with the principle of equal employment opportunity and only job-related qualifications will be required.

Title: Senior AI Engineer
Place: Kolding, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We’re looking for a curious, solution-driven Senior AI Engineer to join our Core AI Team in the CTO Office, where we steer AI and data innovation across the company. With 2+ billion data points collected daily, you’ll have an enormous playground to build, experiment, and deploy advanced models that solve critical problems. Working alongside a team of experienced data professionals and software engineers, you’ll contribute to turning raw data into intelligent solutions that transform the construction industry.


Your contributions will be vital to our AI strategy, enhancing the ways we leverage data to facilitate effective decision-making. Whether you prefer working from one of our hubs in Copenhagen, Kolding, Aarhus, or Aalborg, or remotely from anywhere in Denmark, we offer a flexible setup designed for innovation. No relocation assistance is provided, but if you’re already here, this is your chance to work on one of the most exciting AI challenges in the industry.

What’s in it for you?
Join a cross-functional and collaborative team consisting of other data scientists, as well as data engineers, and software developers
International environment with regular check-ins and social events across teams, departments and borders.
We take your personal and professional development goals seriously and we support them through training, coaching and mindfulness as well as with a clear feedback culture to assist you in identifying your abilities and opportunities. We do this by touching upon your impact on our triple focus: impacting yourself, impacting teams/relations and impacting the organisation/strategy.
Flexibility and hybrid working is not just a cliché to us or something we state in a job posting. We do offer you a flexible setup and believe that you best can structure how your routines look like. And once you have chosen how you work best, let us know what you need: we got you covered with the IT equipment you need for your work.
Turning the Tide. At Trackunit, we are committed to creating and contributing to an inclusive workplace. And this strategy starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit. Learn more about TIDE and other DE&I initiatives here.
Who are you ideally?
You have 5+ years of work experience applying data science and analytics techniques to solve product or business problems.
You are experienced in managing end-to-end model development, from research and prototyping to deployment and monitoring
You have practical experience with Generative AI, including agent solutions, LLM fine-tuning, prompt engineering, and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG)
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a passion for improving AI-driven user experiences
With a blend of curiosity and creativity, you devise solutions that are applicable in real-life contexts.

Don't meet every single requirement? No worries - this is what we're looking for ideally, but if you're super interested in this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification, we encourage you to apply.


Primary responsibilities:
Design, develop, and implement Generative AI solutions for Trackunit’s platform and software products
Work on composite AI by bringing together large-scale datasets and generative AI to enable fleet insights and optimization
Apply generative AI and machine learning to solve real world business challenges for our customers
Collaborate with engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders to define requirements and integrate AI solutions into our applications
Stay ahead of AI trends, contributing to Trackunit’s AI strategy and technology roadmap
Our hiring process

Don't waste your time on writing the perfect cover letter for the job. We want you to create an impact that matters, and that's not in the cover letter.

Virtual meet and greet. Meet with Sr Director of AI Leonhard Fricke, the leader of this position.
Personality-based interview. You will be asked to fill out an online personality assessment using use Hogan prior to the interview. Our Hogan assessment enables us to understand your abilities and how you align with our team culture. Instead of seeking 'appropriate' responses, the priority is to develop a meaningful exchange that illustrates your synergy with the Trackunit team.
Assignment-specific interview. We want you to get an insight into some of the concrete responsibilities related to the role. You will be given a case to prepare prior to the interview, and at the interview, you will present the case to relevant colleagues from across Trackunit, who you’ll also work closely with in the job.
If needed, throughout the process we will obtain references from former employers and do background checks for level specific, if you have not provided these yourself.
Offer presentation and walk-through. We’re lucky to have you!
Coming Together To Connect Construction

We’re committed to construction - an industry with a significant global influence. Over the past two decades, Trackunit has been pioneering technological progress within construction. Today, we are not only a leading IoT provider but a thought leader, supporting and promoting the agenda for an entire industry on a global scale.


We believe in taking a people approach in everything we do. Being human-centric is not restricted to our products – it’s a way of life at Trackunit. We’re proud to be a truly global team. Our colleagues get together in hubs spread across the globe, but we embrace the idea of working remotely and in environments that inspire you. Everything we do, we do it to eliminate downtime and build the most useful industry for the world.


The question is: Are you in?
Show more

Title: Backend Engineer, TypeScript/Node.js
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
It’s an exciting time to join Tactile. We're a diverse team of storytellers, puzzle enthusiasts and casual mobile game creators. Our story began in 2008 in the heart of beautiful Copenhagen, and since then we have experienced continuous growth, establishing ourselves as one of the largest gaming companies in Denmark. In more recent years, we have been scaling fast, in big part thanks to the success of a little game called Lily’s Garden. Now we’re on a mission to solidify our position as one of the leaders in creating out-of-the-ordinary casual puzzle games.







🚀 Your role & impact




We are currently growing our Core Team and are on the search for an experienced Backend Engineer to join the team of talented engineers supporting our live game operations (LiveOps).




The Core team at Tactile is responsible for building our entire backend infrastructure - all the tools, platforms and systems which are used to manage our game, data and marketing operations. As a Backend Engineer within our Core LiveOps team, you will be working on the business critical LiveOps dashboard, which is used by different teams within the business to evaluate and improve their day-to-day operations. You will also be creating new features and functionalities on our Game Web Services, which are important for improving players' in-game experiences, as well as working on our Build Server, the internal CI/CD solution for deploying our games.




We use a variety of technologies for our backend services. Our platform is written in TypeScript and Node.js, with MongoDB and BigQuery as the storage components. We use React to build our client side front-end. Strong knowledge of these technologies along with others that are similar is a great asset to this role.




📍 This role is based in our Copenhagen office. Please note that we cannot offer relocation support or visa sponsorship for this role.







Okay, let’s get a little bit more specific.

Here’s what you’ll be doing on the day-to-day as a Backend Engineer on our Core team:

Building new features and functionalities for for the tools and systems supporting our game development processes
Building and automating new games related systems
Improving, extending and monitoring back and front-end tools
Gaining a thorough understanding of the different shared backend technologies, and how they interact
Contributing to our data warehouse and analytics systems




To keep it short & sweet, as a part of our Core team, you'll be working with a modern stack:

TypeScript, Node.js & Express.js (as our main language and frameworks)
REST APIs
GCP
Docker
Kubernetes
CircleCI
MongoDB & Redis
BigQuery (for our big data pipelines)
DataDog (monitoring system)
Airflow
React.js
... and more! We do not expect you to know everything about this stack (we're not looking for unicorns), what matters most is that you enjoy working with and learning new technologies.




Practices & principles we cannot live without:

Clean coding practices
Code reviews
OOP
SOLID principles
Test driven development (TDD) & unit testing
Dependency Injection




What we're looking for:

🔥 Extensive experience (5+ years) in backend development with TypeScript and Node.js
Experience in working with high-load traffic systems
Experience in working within a bigger development team (4+ developers)
It's great if you also have experience with or an interest in working with front-end




What’s in it for you?

🌆 Beautiful office space with probably the best view in Copenhagen

🩺 Pension and private health insurance

💻 A chance to work with the latest tools and technology

📚 Opportunities for individual growth with development talks as well as workshops, books and courses

🌮 Daily, healthy organic breakfast and lunch prepared by our professional chefs in-house

🥳 Social activities, including game nights, book club, Friday bar and more

🔍 Free Danish lessons with our in-house Danish teacher







We look forward to receiving your application! 👋

Title: AI Solutions Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you an experienced professional, passionate about LLMs and NLP? Can you build production ready tools that bring value to decision-makers? If so, this is the perfect opportunity you.

What We Do

ADC is a Data & AI Consultancy committed to the responsible adoption of data and AI, driving real impact for organizations that matter. We help clients achieve their goals through data-driven solutions, with deep industry expertise.

What makes ADC unique is our impact-driven and collaborative approach. Our team is composed of top talent dedicated to leveraging their advanced data and AI expertise for the greater good. We work with our clients, not just for them, empowering pragmatic and comprehensive consultants through inclusivity, trust, and ownership. We aim to grow across Europe creating the leading data and AI consultancy. Join us on our growth journey!

What You Do


Deliver value to our clients by helping them develop the best data-driven solutions. These solutions can be strategic (e.g. companies that want to become more data-driven) and/or implementation-oriented (e.g. building AI agents, integrating AI models with clients’ systems, using AI for commercial excellence).
Translate complex business requirements into technical solutions. Align ML strategies with business objectives. Maintain strong client relationships and provide sparring on choice of solutions.
Work hands-on in the cloud: configuring/provisioning infrastructure, building CI/CD pipelines, and ensuring observability.
Collaborate with a team of professionals with whom you are building a fast-growing company.
Develop and challenge yourself during internal and external knowledge-sharing and training sessions.
Be a brand ambassador by embracing our company values: comprehensive, pragmatic, trust and ownership.


Requirements

What you bring:  


3-5 years of working experience in areas such as Data Science, Machine Learning, Advanced Analytics or Artificial Intelligence,
A quantitative degree (e.g., Physics, Mathematics, Econometrics, Data Science, AI, Computer Science)
Hands-on experience and understanding of processing unstructured (text) data, using NLP algorithms or LLMs
Software development skills and hands-on experience deploying to the cloud (e.g. provisioning infrastructure, CI/CD pipelines, monitoring)
Expertise in programming in Python
Consultancy experience is a big plus
Excellent command of the English language and communication skills (Danish is a big plus)


What We Offer


A steep learning curve through taking on responsibility from day one
Projects in which you can immerse yourself in challenges to make a positive impact
Freedom to realize your own initiatives and implement your ideas
A training programme focusing on your self-development, designed to transform people into trusted advisors, specialists, and ADC leaders
A knowledge-sharing culture in the form of peer groups, project presentations
Our Collective Week, a workcation with the entirety of ADC during which we work on pro bono projects and make unforgettable memories
A welcoming office space in the center of Copenhagen, with daily lunches provided by a nearby restaurant
Various social events, including Friday drinks, events, sports activities, etc.


What To Do Next

If you are inspired by this opportunity, apply at the link below! For questions, please contact us at recruitment@adc-consulting.com


ADC is an equal-opportunity employer. We value diversity and promote equality to shape a better future. No characteristics are discriminated against, as indicated in Directive 2000/78/EC. We encourage and welcome all applications. Additional arrangements or adjustments to support your application can be discussed further.

Title: Data Engineer for ML Ops Area
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

In Data Science Platform Squad, we Build and maintain a generic, scalable and govern platform for Data Science model of online models to enable an automated, compliant and efficient Model Life Cycle process. We use technologies like Open-Shift to build Containerized platform for Hosting Model execution & Deployment.

Our squad is responsible for:


Hosting Python statistical and machine learning models. The solution is primarily serving the Data Science communities who develop the models, on behalf of the many enterprise domains in the bank.
AAPF (Advanced Analytical Platform for Fraud) is a platform in conjunction with CMDEP (Containerized Management Deployment and Execution platform) is designed to execute machine learning models to score payment transactions for fraud. Payment transactions include e-banking domestic/ international & District International models deployed in CMDEP.
Shaping the current On-Prem infrastructure into a Cloud-Native platform.


As a MLOps Data Engineer, you will work closely with the Product Owner and Chapter Lead in a "2 in a box" model, using agile methodologies. You will be responsible to develop and maintain scalable ML pipelines on futured MLOps platform built on AWS and Databricks. You will be tasked with ensuring seamless and automated transition of models from development to production using CICD workflows, implement the infrastructure as code. You will ensure that our machine learning models operate reliably, efficiently and at scale.

You will:


Design and implement automated pipelines for model training , validation and inference
Build and maintain CI/CD workflows using Github actions to ensure model code is versioned and seamlessly deployed to production
Utilize tools like MLflow for model tracking, versioning and ensuring reproducibility and compliance across the ML lifecycle
Use terraform to provision and manage scalable secure infrastructure required for ML workloads
Leverage docker containers to build, deploy and manage containerized ML services for both batch and real time inference
Work closely with data scientist, product owner and chapter lead with inn your tribe to understand model requirement and integrate the feedback into continuous MLOps pipelines
Follow the MLOps best practices and focused on automating ML workflows, troubleshooting production issues and optimizing the resources usage


About you:


Minimum of 2+ years of practical experience in MLOps, DevOps and Data Engineering role with focus on ML
In-depth knowledge of AWS services and Databricks, with a background in creating and managing ML pipelines
Proficiency in Python, Pyspark and strong SQL skills
Experience in CI/CD tools terraform and container orchestration
Problem solving and debugging skills
Solid understanding and practical experience with PubSub and Kafka streaming services
Upper-Intermediate English skills


“We believe that the most valuable asset is human potential.”

We offer:

If you are hired in Lithuania, the applicable salary range will be from 3120 EUR to 4680 EUR gross (based on your competencies relevant for the job).

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package which includes:


Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.
Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; additional health insurance; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.
Hybrid working conditions: Work from home up to two days a week; home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.
Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.
Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; IIIrd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.


See all the benefits HERE.

Your title in job contract will be IT Platform Engineer.

If you're interested in this role and joining my team, feel free to contact me - Dinesh Chaudhari via LinkedIn or email dinc@danskebank.dk, and I will answer your questions!

#DK

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.
